title: Job in Germany: Business-Analyst (m/w/d)
description: Business Analyst (m/f/d) View job here Business analyst (m/f/i) - full-time, permanent Full-time ProPotsdam, Pappelallee 4, 14469 Potsdam, Germany With professional experience 27.06.23 ProPotsdam GmbH is the largest housing company in the state capital Potsdam and a leading service provider in the areas of urban redevelopment, urban development, housing construction and housing welfare. With a portfolio of over 17,800 rental apartments, it is also the largest housing provider in the Potsdam housing market. Are you interested in helping our company drive the digitalization of our business processes and do you always like to solve new problems? You will fit in with us if you have both a technical affinity but also an eye for technical and business optimization potential and would like to implement new digitization requirements together with the specialist departments and the IT team. Don't miss this opportunity to apply your skills and passion in an exciting environment. Awaiting you is... a proactive team with strong communication skills that you can rely on, as well as a modern S/4 HANA landscape with apps and portals and Microsoft M365 environment. ProPotsdam GmbH is looking for an as soon as possible. Business Analyst (m/f/i) - full-time, permanent Your tasks: Receive, review and evaluate new requirements, taking into account implementation time, costs, ongoing projects, existing standards and IT architecture, as well as IT security and compliance requirements. Review solution approaches and design solution scope to outline possible IT solutions with it. Manage and control the central requirements management as a link between business department and IT team and IT project management. Prepare a project outline that outlines the business and IT framework, includes a price and capacity estimate, makes cost-benefit considerations and takes into account the estimated support needs and ongoing support. Create concepts and guidelines for the implementation of IT solutions, as well as perform process modeling in collaboration with stakeholders. Handover to the project management and participation in the implementation. Determine the plan values for IT requirements from the company to the annual economic planning and responsibility of these budgets according to the agreed implementation goals. Other comparable tasks as well as special tasks as specified by the supervisor. Job Requirements: Completed studies in business informatics or comparable studies. Expertise in the analysis and evaluation of business requirements from the areas of construction and project controlling and ordering processes (knowledge of SAP modules PS, PM, MM). Experience in requirements/demand management and consulting and evaluation of new digitization projects. Strong understanding of business processes and a clear focus on the needs of the business, combined with in-depth IT knowledge and methodological expertise Understanding of technology and flexibility in familiarizing with new systems, applications, structures and processes. Strong communication skills, ability to work in a team as well as a high analytical, structured and solution-oriented way of working We offer, among other things: We give you the working environment so that you can shape life in Potsdam with their commitment and projects: With flexible working hours and the option of mobile working. with a structured onboarding process and regular feedback meetings, we ensure a successful integration into our company with a long-term investment in our employeesinnen - for this reason we promote the personal and professional development of our employeesinnen with an attractive workplace in a municipal company established for over 30 years in Potsdam. You can get an overview of our benefits here: MA-Benefits-Booklet_RZ_Web.pdf (propotsdam.de) What you can expect from us In the ProPotsdam group of companies, you can expect many interesting and varied tasks as well as a large, friendly team in a modern and family-friendly working environment. ProPotsdam is one of the best employers in the capital region Berlin-Brandenburg and has been awarded in the competition Great Place to Work® "Best Employers in Berlin-Brandenburg 2022". You too can become part of the ProPotsdam team We look forward to tackling and implementing the most diverse tasks for our state capital Potsdam together with you. Have we piqued your interest? Then apply online now via the application button. To do this, please upload your complete application documents. Applications will only be accepted via the application form. Contact: Cassie Opitz (0331-6206 229). Imprint | Privacy Policy Powered by softgarden

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
Responsibilities
• Requirements Analysis: ability to elicit, analyze and clearly document business requirements.
• Solution Design: Expertise in developing functional specifications and innovative solution approaches.
• Process Optimization: experience in identifying potential improvements and proposing solutions.
• Data Analysis: Expertise in extracting, transforming, and preparing data for decision-making processes.
• Project management: Experience in planning, implementing and controlling IT projects.
• Communication: strong skills in communicating with various internal and external stakeholders (empathy, knowledge of communication models such as PCM).
• Stakeholder management: Ability to differentiate between the tasks of internal and external stakeholders, to engage them if necessary and to model process and requirements together with them.

Requirements
• Academic Degree: Graduate degree / UAS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related... field.
• IREB certification (at least foundation level).
• Work Experience: Several years of experience as Business Analyst or Requirements Engineer in IT projects.
• Project Management Skills: Sound knowledge of project management and experience with agile methodologies (SCRUM, SAFE, KANBAN, Test-Driven-Development).
• Modeling skills: Experience and knowledge in creating and interpreting models in UML (Unified Modeling Language), PBM2.0 (Process Behavior Models 2.0) and ARIS process chains.
• Requirements Management: Extensive experience in backlog maintenance, workshop documentation, research and analysis using Atlassian Confluence and Jira, and Spluk.
• Data Analysis: Extensive experience in data analysis and with proprietary data formats, as well as with standardized data formats (XML, JSON) and data transfer technologies (REST API, FTP, WSDL).
• Experience in the railroad sector desirable but not required

HO regulations
• 2-3 days/week on-site, the rest is HO

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
Are you a problem solver with a passion for driving business success by asking all the challenging questions?

Come and join our forward-thinking team!

If you possess a keen eye for detail, and love translating technical jargon into actionable insights, then this is the opportunity you've been waiting for. Come be a catalyst for change and make a tangible impact on the organization's growth.

How you'll be doing that?
• Elaborating requirements together with the business representatives and customers
• Documenting the gathered information in a structured way to enable solution design, implementation and proper testing
• Participating, as part of a cross-functional team, elaborating innovative solution concepts for new interfaces using the fitting technology
• Supporting IT functional testing, user acceptance testing and deployment of new solutions

What will you need?
• Previous professional experience in business analysis / requirements engineering, especially in integration... technologies including interface workflow design and data mapping
• Ability to analyze and design complex workflows and processes in BPMN
• To have an interest in details but not losing the focus on the big picture (of the complex integration landscape based on shared backend services)
• Sound English skills
• Solution oriented mindset| organized working style| positive attitude

Why cargo-partner?
• The minimum monthly salary starts from 3.600 € gross. The final compensation may be above, depending on your professional qualifications and experience and will be discussed in the following stages.
• Career plan and professional growth opportunities? We guarantee an individual path of professional development. We give development opportunities in various IT projects.
• Implementation of own initiatives? Our success is based on team spirit. This is why our colleagues accept responsibility, are always part of the solution, and act as true partners to customers and colleagues alike.
• Stability of employment? Dynamic work in a stable international company with a leading position in the air and sea freight market. We focus on long-term cooperation. After the project is over, we talk, listen and provide further challenges.
• Benefits? We provide technical and personal trainings, eLearning, co-financing of language courses and more

Ready to get things moving?

follow us with a hashtags: #cargopartner #workingdigital

find out more about our applications: www.spotworx.com www.carrierplatform.com

cargo-partner is a privately owned full-range info-logistics provider offering a comprehensive portfolio of air, sea, land transport and warehousing services, with special expertise in information technology and supply chain optimization. The company operates over 140 offices in 40 countries around the world to create fast and efficient solutions for a wide range of industries. With the SPOT platform, cargo-partner ensures easy cooperation and full transparency throughout the supply chain.

As a family-owned business, we are very employee-oriented and want to work with you to develop your career and personal goals. Take a look at our Mission & Vision.

If you are looking for a challenging position in an innovative and dynamic international company, we want to get to know you!

View our Privacy Policy

title: CRM Business Analyst (m/f/d)
description: Job-ID: V000007732 Location: Vienna Start date: as soon as possible Closing date: 03.08.2023 Working Hours: Full-time Introduction voestalpine High Performance Metals GmbH is the parent company of the High Performance Metals Division in the voestalpine Group. We are the global market leader in tool steel and also hold leading positions in high-speed steel, valve steel, special engineering steel and other special grades. Customers can rely on our well-established brands that have frequently set the standards for the special steel sector over many decades with their innovation and top quality. The Strategic Marketing & Sales team works with our global sales network in the Value-Added Service Business Unit to optimize & digitalize the marketing & sales process of our division. You join a team of open-minded colleagues from diverse backgrounds who enjoy driving their joint activities with high ambition and strong target orientation. Please find further information on our website: Job... description You will be part of the global, Vienna based, CRM-team You will work on the divisional salesforce platform, including sales cloud, marketing cloud & CRM Analytics You will support our 1600 sales cloud users in 70 sales organizations by steering the live support team, building up knowledge base on confluence & answering questions from the local admins You will support the team with your analytical skill to build reports & dashboards in salesforce CRM/CRM Analytics and get business insight You will be responsible for the data integrity in the system based on data analysis. You will need to reach out to the CRM responsible colleagues in the subsidiaries and support them to improve the data quality continuously You will support the subsidiaries by coordinating projects in CRM data reorganization, system authorization change, CRM Restart, etc. You will test new features as part of the product owner team and give feedback to the DEV You will take over administrative tasks, such as product management, to make sure that the product master data in salesforce supports business requirement Qualifications You have a bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing & Sales, Management Information System, IT or similar qualification You have experienced a dynamic and ambitious business environment for at least 2 years You have experience with CRM (would be beneficial) You have a good command in English You are a team-player You are used to work with a high degree of self-initiative You have a great willingness to learn new things What we offer Salary Package and Benefits: The collective minimum salary agreement for this position is 4.011,25 gross (14 x per year). The actual payment depends on the particular qualification and experience. voestalpine offers its workforce an attractive and appreciative working environment : We support with an extensive initial introduction phase, regular on – the – job trainings, flexible working hours and annual appraisal interviews. We enable certain perquisites and benefits for different commercial partners and with a good course of business all employees will be paid an additional annual bonus. Employee participation is of particular importance for us; currently employees of voestalpine hold 14% of the shares. The fact that voestalpine is a globally leading steel and technology group today is primarily thanks to its approximately 51,200 employees. We are constantly working to create a modern working environment that values diversity, equal opportunities and the joy of innovation. We are looking forward to receive your application. Training and education Barrier-free workplace Company pension Company doctor Company cell phone Company laptop Food allowance Flexible work hours Health measures Beverages Good transportation access Home office Employee bonuses Employee benefits Employee participation Fruit basket Parking space Reconciling family and career Training and education; Barrier-free workplace; Company pension; Company doctor; Company cell phone; Company laptop; Food allowance; Flexible work hours; Health measures; Beverages; Good transportation access; Home office; Employee bonuses; Employee benefits; Employee participation; Fruit basket; Parking space; Reconciling family and career Video Contact & Application More information about our application process can be found on the first page of our application form and in the “ FAQs to apply ”. Please be aware that benefits may vary depending on location. If we have sparked your interest, please use our online application form. Our CV - parsing tool makes your application even faster. Recruiter: Sandra Fröhlich 43 50304 15 73890 Hiring Manager: Xingxie Wu 43 50304 10 22747 Awards

title: Logistics Business Analyst (m/f/d) 38,5h/w - IKEA Austria GmbH
description:
About this work area

The Customer Order management Team is looking for Order Allocation specialist. You will be responsible for the execution of the order allocation strategy which maximizes customer fulfilment network utilization, by contributing to analyse order and range allocation performance in all customer touch points from end-to-end perspective. You will be involved in our ongoing transformation from a traditional cash & carry retailer to an Omni-channel retailing in home furnishing business area.

About you:
• You are inspired by finding improvements through data analysis
• You feel motivated by self-driven learning environment
• You have passion to be part of omnichannel retailing transformation
• You have excellent analytical and numeric skills and ability to perform accurate advanced data manipulation, data analysis, and information presentation
• You are proficient in statistical packages like Excel, and fluent in data visualization software like Qlik; knowledge of... statistical programming software (Phytons, SQL) and will be a bonus point.
• You can provide structure and order to undefined problems, and uses systemic thinking in devising solution options
• You have ability to effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders to support proposed improvements
• You have working experience as business analyst or equivalent function within supply chain, economics (preferrable in omnichannel retailing sector).
• You are fluent in English, both written and verbal

About this work area

• Responsible for creating an efficient and effective configuration of the order management system to support ideal order allocation in each fulfilment unit on the market; with strong cooperation with the key stakeholders to ensure that all business factors are considered to excellently fulfil the customer promise.
• Responsible for dynamic order management system including investigating and troubleshooting on system issue, provide business input to digital development.
• Responsible to review order orchestration parameters, according to business improvement need, in customer fulfilment backbone systems in collaboration with your stakeholders.
• Responsible for monitoring customer order flow throughout the order life cycle; gather and analyse order information, turn order data into information and insight, which can be used to recognizes customer order flow problems and opportunities, engages in continuous assessment and improvement to find better order fulfilment setup towards lower costs.
• Responsible for reviewing product allocation while keeping holistic view in balancing among capacity utilisation, stock, and service availability to provide seamless customer shopping experience.
• Contribute to developing local improvements in working methods, process, and tools; and take part in implementing global routines, systems solutions and ways of working with all partners on the market, in close cooperation and co-creation with the Group Customer Order Team to secure continuous improvement.

Together as a team

We’re the team behind the scenes that make the IKEA products available to the many people. As a diverse mix of co-workers we use our supply process expertise to balance range and space capacity with forecasting and ordering to provide customers with high availability while minimizing costs. If you’ve wonder who’s responsible for finding effective and efficient ways of picking up the products for our customers, that’s us. We’re passionate about working together to improve the customer experience at IKEA!

Yulan and her Team, consisting of three great colleagues, are looking forward to meeting you!

Apply now!

We welcome all applications and especially applications from people with disabilities and people from different ethnic backgrounds. Please apply online and don't forget to include your motivation letter (we think that a good and interesting motivation letter often says much more about you than many degrees).

For this position we offer you a monthly gross salary starting from € 2.775,- (on fulltime base with an ALL IN contractual agreement). We are willing to pay more depending on experience and qualification. And we are happy to offer the option for job sharing.

You have the flexibility to work up to 2/3 of your time in home office. You can find out more about our benefits and development opportunities here

About this work area

• Responsible for creating an efficient and effective configuration of the order management system to support ideal order allocation in each fulfilment unit on the market; with strong cooperation with the key stakeholders to ensure that all business factors are considered to excellently fulfil the customer promise.
• Responsible for dynamic order management system including investigating and troubleshooting on system issue, provide business input to digital development.
• Responsible to review order orchestration parameters, according to business improvement need, in customer fulfilment backbone systems in collaboration with your stakeholders.
• Responsible for monitoring customer order flow throughout the order life cycle; gather and analyse order information, turn order data into information and insight, which can be used to recognizes customer order flow problems and opportunities, engages in continuous assessment and improvement to find better order fulfilment setup towards lower costs.
• Responsible for reviewing product allocation while keeping holistic view in balancing among capacity utilisation, stock, and service availability to provide seamless customer shopping experience.
• Contribute to developing local improvements in working methods, process, and tools; and take part in implementing global routines, systems solutions and ways of working with all partners on the market, in close cooperation and co-creation with the Group Customer Order Team to secure continuous improvement.

Together as a team

We’re the team behind the scenes that make the IKEA products available to the many people. As a diverse mix of co-workers we use our supply process expertise to balance range and space capacity with forecasting and ordering to provide customers with high availability while minimizing costs. If you’ve wonder who’s responsible for finding effective and efficient ways of picking up the products for our customers, that’s us. We’re passionate about working together to improve the customer experience at IKEA!

Yulan and her Team, consisting of three great colleagues, are looking forward to meeting you!

Apply now!

We welcome all applications and especially applications from people with disabilities and people from different ethnic backgrounds. Please apply online and don't forget to include your motivation letter (we think that a good and interesting motivation letter often says much more about you than many degrees).

For this position we offer you a monthly gross salary starting from € 2.775,- (on fulltime base with an ALL IN contractual agreement). We are willing to pay more depending on experience and qualification. And we are happy to offer the option for job sharing.

You have the flexibility to work up to 2/3 of your time in home office. You can find out more about our benefits and development opportunities here"]}]

title: Staff Consultant, Business Analyst
description:
Company Description

👋🏼 We're Nagarro.
We are a digital product engineering company that is scaling in a big way! We build products, services, and experiences that inspire, excite, and delight. We work at scale — across all devices and digital mediums, and our people exist everywhere in the world (18,000+ experts across 33 countries, to be exact). Our work culture is dynamic and non-hierarchical. We're looking for great new colleagues. That's where you come in!

Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in working with software development projects
• completed IT education (HTL, university, FH, Kolleg)
• Strong understanding of software development processes, software design, and programming languages
• Proficient in creating comprehensive and detailed business requirement documents, use cases, user stories, and functional specification
• Knowledge of database systems, networking, and system architectures
• Ability to analyze complex data and processes and identify opportunities for... improvement
• Comfortable with data analysis tools and techniques to identify patterns and trends and make data-driven decisions
• Strong interpersonal skills to build relationships with stakeholders and collaborate effectively with the development team
• Proficient in research related to the industry and customer business and competition

Additional Information

Click here to access the application privacy notice

title: Manufacturing Business Analyst (f/m/d)
description:
Job Family: Engineering

Req ID: 371256

Manufacturing Business Analyst

Make the vision of a Siemens IT/OT ecosystem for smart manufacturing real!

“Technology with purpose” means the translation of IT technology into business value. Especially for new and innovative technology, as is so often in the field of IoT, this process must be accompanied and moderated.

For this reason, the role of a business analyst with a technical focus is essential. In this role, you will either come from processes and translate which IT building blocks are needed to digitize manufacturing processes, or you will come from technology and show process responsible how the technology can be used to create value in their domain. For this task, you should have a background in manufacturing and domain knowledge in the areas of production and (intra) logistics.

Besides of this you will act in the role of an ambassador driving IT/OT convergence forward, facilitating IT/OT communities and taking over the product... owner role for the “solution platform” – a marketplace for factories to accelerate their digital transformation.

In this role you will work intensively with colleagues from MF, IT and DI product units to achieve the optimum for Siemens.

What part will you play?
• Leading project modules for (Siemens internal) market & demand analysis with focus on manufacturing
• Screening and analyzing use cases as part of projects and co-creations or customer-zero initiatives
• Deriving requirements for required products, solutions and IT services to elevate the maximum of value
• Driving co-creations and customer-zero deployments between factories, solution providers and IT
• Building up topic driven interdisciplinary communities with representatives from MF, IT and solution providers
• Working on new business models which are driven by IT/OT convergence
• Being responsible in the role of a “product manager” for the evolution of “Solution Platform” – a marketplace for Siemens factories

What you need to make real what matters?
• A University degree in engineering or IT
• Several years’ experience and background in manufacturing
• Experience in business process analysis and projects
• Understanding of Siemens Digital Industries portfolio e.g. MES, Intralogistics, Digital Twin
• A passion for IT/OT convergence and understand requirements and dependencies
• Good moderation skills, the ability to open rooms for visionary discussions, as well as to drive meetings to concrete practical and valuable outcomes
• You are a systemic problem solver and you are able to connect the dots
• You play in teams and have excellent people skills and the adaptability to connect quickly with people
• Proficiency in English and German would be an add-on

We’ve got quite a lot to offer. How about you?

www.siemens.com

if you wish to find out more about Siemens before applying.

www.siemens.com/global/en/company/jobs/faq

if you need information on the application process.

www.siemens.com/careers

if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens

title: (Junior) Requirements Engineer/ IT Business Analyst für iTWO...
description:
Analyse & Qualitätssicherung der Produktionsplanung und -steuerungssoftware
PPS-Development, PPS-Development, RIB SAA Software Engineering GmbH, Vollzeit, Wien PPS Developer

Innovation, Performance, Respekt, Mut, Integrität und Qualität - das sind die Werte, die uns bei RIB SAA verbinden. Die Firma RIB SAA in Wien, baut auf 25 Jahre Expertise und ist einer der weltweit führenden Anbieter für Digitalisierung und Automatisierung im Fertigteilbau. Seit 2015 gehört RIB SAA zur RIB Group, als Center of Excellence für "Smart Production". Durch die Integration der intelligenten Produktionslösungen von RIB SAA in die Constructioncloud iTWO 4.0, kann der gesamte Construction-Lifecycle eines Bauprojektes beginnend mit der Vorfertigung - vom Design über die Produktion bis hin zu Montage, Instandhaltung und Betrieb - abgedeckt werden. Die RIB Group ist ein Mitglied von Schneider Electric. Mit über 2.700 Mitarbeiter:innen in mehr als 25 Ländern weltweit zielt die RIB Group darauf ab, die... Bauindustrie zur nachhaltigsten und digitalisiertesten Branche des 21. Jahrhunderts voranzutreiben. Wirst du ein Teil davon sein?

Aufgaben

Unsere Softwarelösung iTWO PPS ist die digitale Suite zur Optimierung des Vorfertigungsgeschäfts. Dabei deckt der PPS-Workflow den Zyklus vom Vertrieb/ Projektmanagement über die Beschaffung, Produktion/ Planung bis zum Logistikmanagement ab. Als Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams, bist du praktisch der "Requirement Analyst" denn du
• analysierst gemeinsam mit dem Consulting- und Entwicklungsteam neue Kundenanforderungen, bearbeitest/ konzeptionierst diese und koordinierst deren Umsetzung und damit die Weiterentwicklung der Software iTWO PPS
• spezifizierst Entwicklungsaufgaben und führst die Qualitätskontrolle der umgesetzten Funktionalitäten durch
• erweiterst die Tests/ Qualitätskontrolle durch deine Prozessvorschläge zur Weiterentwicklung/ Optimierung der Test-Methoden
• erstellst und pflegst Backlogs, stellst eine nachhaltige Dokumentation sicher
• gestaltest wesentlich die Produktstrategie & Produkt Road Map mit

Profil
• Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung (HTL, FH, Uni) oder vergleichbare Berufsausbildung
• Analytisches, lösungsorientiertes und prozessuales Denken
• Affinität mit dem Umgang von IT-Softwarelösungen & ERP Systemen
• Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office Tools
• Grundkenntnisse in Microsoft SQL & Skriptsprachen C#, JavaScript
• Durchsetzungsvermögen, Überzeugungskraft sowie Kommunikationsstärke
• Hohe Einsatzbereitschaft und Selbstständigkeit
• Zur Stärkung der Kundenbeziehung: Reisen sind bei Bedarf möglich (
• Sehr gute Deutsch- sowie sehr gute Englischkenntnisse

Von Vorteil
• Kenntnisse in HP-ALM (zukünftig Jira/ Confluence), SCHEMA ST4
• Erste Berührungspunkte mit dem Bauwesen/ der Baubranche

Wir bieten
• Performance, Respekt, Mut, Integrität und Qualität - das sind die Werte, die uns bei RIB verbinden. Du profitierst nicht nur von unserer agilen Unternehmenskultur, sondern ebenfalls von:
• Attraktiver Fachkarriere mit spannenden Herausforderungen in einem international tätigen Unternehmen
• Moderne Arbeitsplatzinfrastruktur sowie flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Homeoffice-Möglichkeit
• Langfristige Anstellung, abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeiten und Raum für eigene Ideen
• Individuelle Förderung mit laufend möglicher Aus- und Weiterbildung (u.a. Udemy Business)
• Ansprechenden freiwilligen Sozialleistungen (wie z.B. Pensionversicherung, Jahresprämie, Essenszuschuss, Jobticket, Zugang zu Sportveranstaltungen, Mitarbeiterrabatte, etc.)
• Als Green Company mit Verantwortungs- und Nachhaltigkeitsbewusstsein kannst Du mit uns eine grüne Zukunft schaffen

Wir sind dazu verpflichtet darauf hinzuweisen, dass das Bruttojahresgehalt lt. IT-Kollektivvertrag für diese Position zwischen 40.000 € - 74.000 € liegt. Das tatsächliche Gehalt orientiert sich dabei an deiner Ausbildung, Erfahrung sowie deinen Qualifikationen

title: Digital Sales Business Analyst - focus Salesforce (all genders)
via: via OMV Jobs | Career - OMV Group
description:
Overview of the company

As one of Austria's largest listed industrial companies and a global energy and chemicals group, OMV is working on answers to address the challenges of climate change. The agenda is to become a leading supplier of sustainable fuels, chemicals and materials with a focus on circular economy solutions by 2030, and to be climate neutral by 2050 at the latest. This is the mission of our approximately 22,400 employees.

Sustainability: Our approach

In Chemicals & Materials, OMV through its subsidiary Borealis, is one of the world's leading providers of advanced and circular polyolefin solutions and a European market leader in base chemicals, fertilizers, and plastics recycling. Together with its two major joint ventures - Borouge (with ADNOC, in the UAE and Singapore) and Baystar™ (with TotalEnergies, in the USA) - Borealis supplies products and services to customers across the globe. OMV's Fuels & Feedstock business produces and markets fuels as well as feedstock... for the chemical industry, operates three refineries in Europe, and holds a 15% stake in a refining joint venture in the UAE. OMV operates around 1,800 filling stations in ten European countries. In the Energy segment, OMV explores and produces oil and gas in the four core regions of Central and Eastern Europe, Middle East and Africa, North Sea, and Asia-Pacific. Average daily production in 2022 amounted to 392 kboe/d. Its activities also include the Low Carbon Business as well as the entire gas business.

Our business

Your tasks

You’ll be working on future-oriented and customer centric digital initiatives in OMV’s marketing and sales business, making sure we put the customer experience at the heart of our operations. You’ll connect our operational and customer facing business units and help to improve business processes and efficiency in our digital sales and CRM platforms.
• Act as Business Analyst for our Salesforce platform, which means you understand business processes and interpret them into features, which bring value to both OMV and our customers
• Identify connections and interdependencies in our Marketing and Sales Business Processes, so that you can derive lean technical requirements from them
• Drive both writing and reviewing business requirements and translate them into concrete user stories, which are the basis for new features and implementations
• Support business case definition and prioritization for each release cycle within the entire value stream
• Identify options for solving business challenges and support the implementation of digital business solutions
• Manage and measure the day-to-day performance of our sales platforms, especially creating and monitoring the KPIs
• Create an environment for open communication between IT and business stakeholders and build a strong network with internal and external partners

Your profile
• University Degree Master/Diploma in IT or technical/economical field
• Minimum of 7 years relevant experience within CRM platforms in a corporate environment or IT consultancy, preferably Salesforce
• Solid understanding of the Salesforce platform and profound knowledge of functions within different Salesforce modules (Sales and Service Cloud, Customer Portal or Marketing Cloud)
• Basic understanding of integration patterns, APIs and 3rd party application integration is beneficial
• Buzzwords like agile delivery, user stories, value stream and DevOps are well known to you
• Strong communication skills and passion for technology combined with an enthusiasm for optimizing business processes
• Excellent English language skills

What to expect from OMV

We believe that we can only evolve and thrive as a company with a highly diverse mix of employees and by ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have a strong culture of collaboration and our group values "we care, we're curious, we progress" are guiding us along the way on our path into a sustainable future. We will encourage you to take on new responsibilities, work across different functions, become involved in new projects, as well as completing international assignments. In return, we have excellent development programs that will help you achieve your career goals and reach your potential.

What OMV can offer

The opportunity to join an internationally renowned company in a fast moving business sector, providing excellent development opportunities. We offer an attractive compensation package that matches your qualifications and professional experience. The minimum gross annual salary according to the collective agreement amounts to EUR 80.577, all in. Depending on skills and specific experience, over-payment is possible. OMV also offers additional benefits and relocation packages for international moves.

Your contact

Please contact Isabella Arleth for further information

title: Business Analyst for Counterparty Data Hub Servicing (all genders)
description:
Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up.

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.

We in Daily Banking Services want to provide to our clients the best digital experience, which is seamless, convenient, fast and compliant. We aim to digitalize and automatize all our back-office processes to the core, regardless of channels. Customer Data Hub is one of our key systems to provide business support to all Erste Group Banks and meet regulatory requirements. We are currently seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing business processes and identifying opportunities for... improvement. You will work closely with other members of the Servicing team to implement changes and enhance efficiency in banking operations.

Aufgaben
• You will have a crucial role in designing, documenting, and continuously improving our processes end to end and front to back
• Work closely with stakeholders, end users, product- and other process owners to define desired outcome of each process improvements or digitalization
• Responsible to achieve defined targets (KPIs) for process improvements and digitalization
• Responsible to manage the success and efficiency of processing Units
• Actively collect customer feedback to drive the re-design and enhancement of end-to-end processes
• Identify data quality issues and work with the appropriate teams to resolve them
• Act as competency for complex inquiries towards our stakeholders from stakeholders, business and service providers

Profil
• At least five years background in the banking industry, in process improvement or operations, with strong focus on corporate customers
• Exceptional knowledge and understanding of corporate customer needs, risk and compliance
• Customer-oriented and excellent communication skills; making it easy for you to interact with people in an intercultural and diverse environment
• You're self-accountable and solution-oriented, with a hands-on mindset, a positive, entrepreneurial, and agile spirit, and the willingness to accept challenges
• Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau preferred
• If you're fluent in English and German and want to be part of a dynamic and passionate team that's dedicated to improving the customer experience, we encourage you to apply now. Let's make a difference together

Wir bieten
• We are a team who lives and breathes innovation and digital transformation and likes to push boundaries to the next level.
• We are open minded, supportive and always ready to go the extra mile for our customers
• We take care of your personal wellbeing, career development, and we actively support your educational needs
• Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group
• The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 44.567, gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
• We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.
• Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin
job_highlights:
[{'items': ["Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up.

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.

We in Daily Banking Services want to provide to our clients the best digital experience, which is seamless, convenient, fast and compliant. We aim to digitalize and automatize all our back-office processes to the core, regardless of channels. Customer Data Hub is one of our key systems to provide business support to all Erste Group Banks and meet regulatory requirements. We are currently seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing business processes and identifying opportunities for... improvement. You will work closely with other members of the Servicing team to implement changes and enhance efficiency in banking operations.

Aufgaben
• You will have a crucial role in designing, documenting, and continuously improving our processes end to end and front to back
• Work closely with stakeholders, end users, product- and other process owners to define desired outcome of each process improvements or digitalization
• Responsible to achieve defined targets (KPIs) for process improvements and digitalization
• Responsible to manage the success and efficiency of processing Units
• Actively collect customer feedback to drive the re-design and enhancement of end-to-end processes
• Identify data quality issues and work with the appropriate teams to resolve them
• Act as competency for complex inquiries towards our stakeholders from stakeholders, business and service providers

Profil
• At least five years background in the banking industry, in process improvement or operations, with strong focus on corporate customers
• Exceptional knowledge and understanding of corporate customer needs, risk and compliance
• Customer-oriented and excellent communication skills; making it easy for you to interact with people in an intercultural and diverse environment
• You're self-accountable and solution-oriented, with a hands-on mindset, a positive, entrepreneurial, and agile spirit, and the willingness to accept challenges
• Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau preferred
• If you're fluent in English and German and want to be part of a dynamic and passionate team that's dedicated to improving the customer experience, we encourage you to apply now. Let's make a difference together

Wir bieten
• We are a team who lives and breathes innovation and digital transformation and likes to push boundaries to the next level.
• We are open minded, supportive and always ready to go the extra mile for our customers
• We take care of your personal wellbeing, career development, and we actively support your educational needs
• Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group
• The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 44.567, gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
• We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.
• Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin"]}]

title: Business Analyst (f/m/d)
description:
:

SOS Children's Villages, founded in 1949, is the world's largest non-governmental organization focused on supporting children and young people without parental care, or at risk of losing it.

Child neglect, abuse and abandonment is everywhere. Families are at risk of separation. Locally led, we work in more than 130 countries and territories to strengthen families who are under pressure so they can stay together. When this is not in a child or young person's best interests, we provide quality care according to their unique needs.

Together with partners, donors, communities, children, young people and families, we enable children to grow up with the bonds they need to develop and become their strongest selves. We speak up for each child's rights and advocate for change so all children can grow up in a supportive environment.

Location:
Vienna or Innsbruck (Austria)

Duration:
Full-time, unlimited

Mission

The Information & Communication Technology (ICT) function represents an... innovative business partner for the SOS Children’s Villages Federation in the digital age. It powers value creation as well as competitive advantage and adapts agile to emerging opportunities, while delivering core functionality flawless and effectively. The ICT Network is a global team of ICT experts with diverse competencies and solid business understanding, which implements our ICT mission and serves as regional hubs to foster change and innovation. Identifying business needs and determining ICT solutions to business problems often includes a systems development component, but may also consist of process improvements.

Business Analysts act as interaction points between a function and ICT Product Advisor for software development. This includes the coordination of software projects, as well as collecting and analysing software requirements within a function. Business Analysts act either as consultant for project managers in software acquisition projects or are themselves project manager of such projects. They also help implement, improve and tailor the ALM processes in their work area. Business Analysts are responsible for a stable and functional Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP environment. They also ensure system- services- and application operations, availability, security and stability within the SOS Microsoft Tenant for all affected SOS Children’s Villages co-workers.

The purpose of the position is to design, implement, roll-out and continuously improve and support the D365 Finance and Operations Module, and to support the overall management of the D365 optimization and continuous further development of the Finance functions to ensure optimal use by the member organization.

The Business Analyst (BA) works close together with the Process Owner in the different departments on IO and Regional Level to identify additional requirements and problem areas that can be improved. The aim of the D365 F&O Business Analyst is to guarantee a stable and functional Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP environment and ensure that the Finance & Operations Modules are configured and set up in such a way as to ensure use by users throughout the federation.

Overall, this BA position exists to support the organization's mission of helping many more children to succeed in life by driving digitalis transformation and by providing data analysis tools that inform decision-making and drive positive outcomes.

Tasks & Responsibilities
• Design, implement, roll-out and continuously improve and support the D365 system
• Implement modification and additional configurations
• Improve the ERP processes together with the process owners in the International Finance team and in the International Office Regions
• Quality assurance of existing application specifications
• Manage ongoing relationship with the International Finance team and International Office Regions stakeholders to drive satisfaction with the ERP functionality
• Manage small D365 implementation projects as defined by the stakeholders

Requirements

Essential:
• Bachelor degree in IT / Engineering
• Expertise in D365 Finance & Operation
• Project Management Skills
• Ability to adhere to the clear segregation of duties between the process owner and the BA and demand this from the other parties
• Ability to make the decision-making processes appropriately transparent and implement them within the planned timeframe
• Ability to manage the coordination between a large number of users and interest groups
• Excellent written and spoken English language skills
• Work permit to the chosen location (and willingness to relocate, if necessary)

B
usiness Domain
• Deep functional understanding of the business domain
• Ability to understand business processes within the function
• Ability to suggest improvements for business processes within the function
• Ability to analyse and document business requirements according to ALM standards

Software Domain
• High-level understanding of technical aspects of software solutions
• Experience in the management, and development of software requirements
• Ability to facilitate requirement workshops

Desirable:
• Power BI and Management Reporter Skills

We offer
• A diverse range of interesting tasks in a leading INGO multicultural working environment
• As a responsible employer we provide a range of training schemes and encourage educational enhancement
• A salary that will be commensurate with experience and qualifications
• 14 salaries/year
• Overtime – does not get lost and can be taken as hours off
• Home-office possibility (from your official home address in Austria)
• Possibility to work from abroad max 25% of your working time
• 25 days of paid annual leave
• Choice between Innsbruck and Vienna office

What we stand for

SOS Children’s Villages is committed to creating and maintaining a caring and protective environment, which promotes its core values, and prevents and addresses child abuse and exploitation. We strongly condemn all forms of child abuse and exploitation, be it within or outside of our organization, and always respond to any case of proven, alleged or attempted abuse within our sphere of influence according to its nature. Efforts ensure that mechanisms are in place to raise awareness, aid prevention, encourage reporting and ease response. They range from human resource development actions such as training and counselling to measures such as suspension, dismissal, and legal action.

SOS Children’s Villages is committed to creating and maintaining a safe working environment for our staff, the children and young people and the communities that we work for. The organization prohibits harassment, exploitation and abuses by or of any employee, supervisor, manager, child, young people, community, contractor, applicant, or other individual with whom SOS Children’s Villages employees come into contact by virtue of their work. All employees are expected to carry out their duties in accordance with our prevention and protection against Sexual Harassment, Exploitation and Abuse policy.

In addition, SOS Children’s Villages apply a zero tolerance concerning any fraud situation. The organization does not charge a fee at any stage of the recruitment process.

Successful candidates will have to submit a criminal record certificate, current within the last three years. In accordance with the organisation’s child protection policy, these positions will be subject to criminal record checks.

If you are interested in this position, please submit your detailed application in English
by June 24th, 2023 at
https://careers-sos-kd.icims.com

Due to the high level of responses, SOS Children Villages can only respond to shortlisted candidates

title: Business Analyst
description:
You will join one of our offices around the world to work in teams and directly with our clients.

In this role you will help our clients in the private, public, and social sectors solve some their most pressing problems.

You will also work with a range of experts in the firm, from data scientists to researchers to software and app designers.

You'll work in teams of typically 3 - 5 consultants to identify, and oftentimes implement, potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge.

Together, you will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important goals.

Over the course of each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate, and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations.

You'll also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.

In some cases, you will be asked to travel to your client site.

When you join McKinsey, you are... joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

As a business analyst, you will receive training and coaching on how to better :
• Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them
• Synthesize clear takeaways from complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods
• Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act
• Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations
• Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner
• Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values

McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you’ll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals.

Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams.

We view the business analyst position as the start of a rewarding, challenging, and highly flexible career with McKinsey.

During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a business analyst on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of industry and functional areas.

We encourage you to explore different content areas or geographies through a year-long rotation with one of our practices (e.

g., corporate finance, social sector, healthcare, operations) or global offices; many do this after two years as a generalist business analyst.

You will likely intersect with many elements of our firm’s work including digital, implementation, and tech and analytics capabilities either by collaborating on teams or working with colleagues from these group.

Following your business analyst tenure, assuming good performance, you will move into a post-graduate school role. Some business analysts will take advantage of the opportunity to get outside experience through a secondment (externship) with a private sector or social sector client with the firm’s support.

Others may choose to pursue graduate school with support from the firm.
• Undergraduate degree or master’s degree or 1+ years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degree; Requirements may vary by country or practice
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization
• Capability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team project
• Comfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situations
• Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis
• Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language(s

title: IT Business Analyst (f/m/x)  in Group Data Management
description:
IT Business Analyst (f/m/x) in Group Data Management

The Group Data Management department is responsible to plan, execute and steer large data innovation initiatives across RBI and its subsidiaries in CEE. Our internal customers include Advanced Analytics, Corporate, Finance, Retail, Markets and Regulatory Reporting and others. We enable our company to become a data driven organization by utilizing cross functional and cross border collaboration, modern technology and continuous innovation.
#full-time
(38.5h / week)
#viennaoffice
(1030)
#homeoffice
possible

Your mission at RBI
• Act as end-to-end coordinator and data consultant for large scale data initiatives
• Support the Product Owners in structuring and breaking down Data Demands in the central data backlog
• Collaborate across hierarchies with teams in head office and RBI subsidiaries in CEE to deliver new data demands
• Identify and propose solutions in our Data Ecosystem
• Building a Prototype of new data requirements and... collect acceptance criteria
• Define test approaches and support integration- and user acceptance tests
• Support the definition and implementation of the Group Data Strategy
• Analyze data flows across the organization and identify improvement potentials
• Working in a highly motivated agile team with excellent team spirit

Your core competencies
• University degree or similar with business or technical background
• Good knowledge about delivery methods or project management
• Good knowledge of requirements engineering and testing methods
• Good Data modeling and SQL knowledge or similar data manipulation skills are beneficiary
• Knowledge of bank steering business processes (finance, risk management)
• Analytical, result-oriented and structured way of working
• Fluent in English

Nice to have
• Preferably 3 years’ experience in a Data Management, Business Intelligence or Project Management position
• Very good communication, presentation and facilitation skills
• Experience with SCRUM or other agile methods are appreciated
• Dedicated team player with high customer orientation

What's in it for you
• Work Life Balance: flexible working hours (no core time), extensive hybrid working options / work from home
• Easy Moving: work permit support
• Top-notch Equipment: modern tools & technologies
• International Spirit: multi-cultural teams, English as company language, team building events
• Learning & Agile Working: as part of our DNA & culture
• Canteen: healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized
• Saving: with vouchers / discounts from our staffs' council (eg. supermarket)
• Further Goodies: free public transport pass, salary account & credit card, reduced gym membership, gender-neutral parental leave, bilingual company kindergarten etc.
• Salary: the offered gross yearly salary starts at 50.000,- Euro (basis full-time) excluding overtime, depending on qualification and experience.)

At Raiffeisen Bank International, we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries – what got us here, are our talented people. From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs.

For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our website or check out our FAQ.

Follow us on our RBI Account on LinkedIn

title: IT-Business Analyst
description:
Firmenprofil

Das Unternehmen hat seinen Schwerpunkt in der Technologieberatung und ist hierbei österreichweit aktiv. Es bringt fachlich bezogene Themen und technologische Expertise zusammen. Somit ermöglicht es Ihnen stets die neuesten und besten Lösungen an Ihre Kollegen*innen und Kunden*innen weiterzugeben. Das Ziel ist es, Ideen der Fachabteilungen und Kunden noch schneller umzusetzen, sowie Neueinführungen und Änderungen von Software-Lösungen voranzutreiben. Daher werden engagierte IT-Business Analysten (m/w/d) gesucht, um tatkräftig zu unterstützen und eigene Ideen mit einzubringen.

Aufgabengebiet
• Sie sind Teil eines internationalen Solution-Teams (agil und klassisch) und setzen verschiedene IT-Lösungen für unsere Kund:innen um
• Gemeinsame Konzeption und Umsetzung von Anforderungen mit Kund:innen, Fachabteilungen und Architektur
• Aktive Unterstützung der Kund:innen in allen Phasen einer Anforderung - von der Anforderungserhebung, Aufwandsschätzung, Lösungsdesign... Prototyping und Testing bis zum Rollout der Lösung
• Wartung und Weiterentwicklung von bestehenden und neuen Produkten
• Consulting der Fachverantwortlichen zur optimalen Weiterentwicklung der IT Lösungen

Anforderungsprofil
• Idealerweise ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit Schwerpunkt Informationstechnologie oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung (z.B. HTL mit IT-Schwerpunkt)
• 2-3 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung als Business Analyst oder in einer vergleichbaren Position
• Gute Kenntnisse der Prinzipien des Requirement Engineerings
• Erfahrung mit JIRA, Confluence sowie PEGA
• Strukturiertes und methodisches Vorgehen bei der Entwicklung von technischen Lösungen
• Ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch

Vergütungspaket
• Arbeiten mit state-of-the art Technologien an innovativen und digitalen Lösungen
• Starker Teamgeist, modernes Arbeitsumfeld inkl. Remote Working & erstklassigen Benefits
• Zukunftssicherer Arbeitsplatz mit professioneller Einarbeitung
• Spannende Weiterbildungs- & Karrieremöglichkeiten
• Berufliche Vielfalt, hohe Eigenverantwortung und gelebtes Miteinander sowie Fokus auf Nachhaltigkeit
• Bei Erfüllung der geforderten Kriterien liegt das Jahresbruttogehalt für diese Position bei mind. 65.000 Euro auf Vollzeitbasis mit der Möglichkeit auf Überzahlung (bis zu 90.000 Euro

[{'items': ['Firmenprofil

Das Unternehmen hat seinen Schwerpunkt in der Technologieberatung und ist hierbei österreichweit aktiv. Es bringt fachlich bezogene Themen und technologische Expertise zusammen. Somit ermöglicht es Ihnen stets die neuesten und besten Lösungen an Ihre Kollegen*innen und Kunden*innen weiterzugeben. Das Ziel ist es, Ideen der Fachabteilungen und Kunden noch schneller umzusetzen, sowie Neueinführungen und Änderungen von Software-Lösungen voranzutreiben. Daher werden engagierte IT-Business Analysten (m/w/d) gesucht, um tatkräftig zu unterstützen und eigene Ideen mit einzubringen.

Aufgabengebiet
• Sie sind Teil eines internationalen Solution-Teams (agil und klassisch) und setzen verschiedene IT-Lösungen für unsere Kund:innen um
• Gemeinsame Konzeption und Umsetzung von Anforderungen mit Kund:innen, Fachabteilungen und Architektur
• Aktive Unterstützung der Kund:innen in allen Phasen einer Anforderung - von der Anforderungserhebung, Aufwandsschätzung, Lösungsdesign... Prototyping und Testing bis zum Rollout der Lösung
• Wartung und Weiterentwicklung von bestehenden und neuen Produkten
• Consulting der Fachverantwortlichen zur optimalen Weiterentwicklung der IT Lösungen

Anforderungsprofil
• Idealerweise ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit Schwerpunkt Informationstechnologie oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung (z.B. HTL mit IT-Schwerpunkt)
• 2-3 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung als Business Analyst oder in einer vergleichbaren Position
• Gute Kenntnisse der Prinzipien des Requirement Engineerings
• Erfahrung mit JIRA, Confluence sowie PEGA
• Strukturiertes und methodisches Vorgehen bei der Entwicklung von technischen Lösungen

title: Senior Business Analyst
company_name: Atos IT Solutions and Services GmbH
description:
Your role in the team
• Designing new customer applications together with business and IT stakeholders
• Organisation, moderation and consolidation of the results of workshops
• Management and coaching of other business analysts as well as specification of the process model and integrity in requirements engineering
• Management and definition of user stories (including acceptance criteria and tests)
• Identification of causes and connections as well as commenting on deviations
• Interpretation and discussion of results as part of discussions and reviews with the operational units
• Sound experience in software development and programming in various programming languages

Technologies and skills
• Java
• JavaScript

Our expectations:

Qualifications
• Close cooperation with the customer, various departments and agile teams
• Certification in Requirements Engineering

Experience
• Experience in the field of technical requirements engineering, in the development of user stories and in... the creation of interface documentation
• Years of modeling experience

Education
• Completed studies (computer science, experience as a business analyst in both classic and agile projects

title: (Senior) Business Analyst - Business Process Management (m/w/d)
description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Wir, die IT der REWE Group Österreich, entwickeln mit über 600 Mitarbeiter:innen innovative IT-Produkte und Services für all unsere Unternehmensbereiche im In- und Ausland und geben den Ton für den modernen Handel an.

Du möchtest im Business Analysis & Process Engineering Team unser sehr umfangreiches IT-Modernisierungsprogamm mit begleiten und unsere Geschäftsprozesse im Lebensmittel- und Drogeriefachhandel für unsere Handelsfirmen Billa, Bipa, Penny, Adeg und IKI in 9 Ländern auf das nächste Level heben?

Du konzipiest leidenschaftlich gerne Geschäftsprozesse um End-to-End das Beste rauszuholen? Du möchtest federführend an der Entwicklung von state-of-the-art IT Lösungen für unsere Handelsfirmen beteiligt sein? Dann bist Du bei uns richtig!

Stellenbeschreibung
• Verantwortung für die Neukonzeption und Digitalisierung unserer End-to-End Geschäftsprozesse
• Unterstützung der kontinuierlichen Weiterentwicklung unseres Unternehmens durch systematisches... Erheben und Verbessern aktueller Abläufe
• Entwurf von Prozessen für neue strategische Geschäftsmodelle auf Basis von Best Practices sowie Anforderungen der Fachbereiche
• Identifikation relevanter Prozess-Kennzahlen zur Messung des Optimierungserfolges
• Mitarbeit bei der Auswahl von IT-Lösungen durch Identifikation, Analyse und Spezifikation fachlicher Anforderungen
• Aufbereitung von Entscheidungsvorlagen für das Top-Management inkl. Business Case Betrachtungen
• Enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Business Process Ownern aus den Fachbereichen
• Unterstützung von innovativen Projekten
• Planung und Mitarbeit bei unternehmensweiten Schulungen in Prozessmanagement und/oder Business Analyse

Qualifikationen
• Abgeschlossenes Studium (Uni/FH) im Bereich Prozessmanagement, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Betriebswirtschaft oder einer vergleichbaren Ausbildung
• 2+ Jahre (Junior) bzw. 5+ Jahre (Senior) praktische Erfahrung im Prozessmanagement oder Solution Design
• Solides Grundverständnis von relevanten Geschäfts- und IT-Prozessen
• Erfahrung und Methodenkompetenz in der Identifikation, Analyse, Verbesserung und Design von Geschäftsprozessen inkl. Erstellen von Prozessdiagrammen und KPIs
• Verständnis für die Erstellung und Pflege von Prozesslandkarten
• Facheinschlägige Zertifizierungen sowie Kenntnisse von BPMN und marktüblicher Tools von Vorteil
• Analytische, lösungsorientierte und strukturierte Arbeitsweise
• Ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit gepaart mit einem hohen Maß an Eigeninitiative und Selbstverantwortung
• Souveränes Auftreten mit der Fähigkeit KundInnen mit innovativen Ansätzen zu überzeugen
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Zusätzliche Informationen
• Langfristige, abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit bei einem verlässlichen Arbeitgeber in einem kollegialen Team
• Familienfreundliche Unternehmenskultur mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice unter Berücksichtigung deiner individuellen Bedürfnisse
• Zahlreiche Ausbildungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten im Konzern (5% der Arbeitszeit für selbstorganisierte Weiterbildung)
• Mitarbeiter:innen-Rabatte bei Einkauf und Reisen
• Umfangreiches Angebot zur Gesundheitsvorsorge wie z.B. Fitnesskurse, Massagen,..
• Gute öffentliche Erreichbarkeit
• Ein marktkonformes, attraktives und leistungsbezogenes Jahresbruttogehalt ab min. EUR 55.000,- mit klarer Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung bei entsprechender Erfahrung und Qualifikation

Wir suchen die Neugierigen, die Verlässlichen, die Motivierten, die Vielseitigen, die Ungewöhnlichen, die Offenen, die Fokussierten, die Umdenkenden, die Mitdenkenden, die Nachdenkenden und vor allem die Menschlichen, die Neues entdecken wollen.

Wir fördern ein vielfältiges und inklusives Arbeitsumfeld. Daher freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen unterschiedlichen Geschlechts, Alters, kulturellem oder sozialem Hintergrund, sexueller Identität und Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderungen. Zusätzlich möchten wir den Anteil von Frauen in technischen Berufsfeldern erhöhen und freuen wir uns für diese Position besonders über Bewerbungen von Frauen

title: Junior Business Analyst mit IT-Fokus (w/m/d).
description:
Was gibt es Besseres, als jemandem ein Lächeln ins Gesicht zaubern zu können? Bei uns kannst du das. Denn Kundenanliegen wird es immer geben. Und du sorgst dafür, dass sie gehört und bestmöglich gelöst werden. Engagement und eine Macher-Mentalität zeichnen dich aus? Dann bewirb dich bei uns.
Wir sind eine offene, motivierte und hilfsbereite Truppe, die Spaß am gemeinsamen Ausprobieren und Umsetzen hat. Wir hinterfragen bestehende Prozesse, durchbrechen Denkmuster und begleiten ein Thema von der Idee bis zur Umsetzung.
Am Ende sind wir stolz auf das, was wir geschaffen haben und feiern gemeinsam unsere Erfolge.

Junior Business Analyst mit IT-Fokus (w/m/d).

Deine Aufgabe bei uns einfach erklärt...
Stell dir vor, wir möchten ein neues Versicherungsprodukt auf den Markt bringen. Am Anfang eines jeden Vorhabens steht eine vage oder konkrete Idee. Ist sie konkret, spießt sie sich aber oft mit der Realität. Vor allem dann, wenn sie von Nicht-IT-Fachleuten kommt. Deine Aufgabe als Junior... Business Analyst besteht darin, Wünsche und Realität zueinander zu führen.
Das heißt für dich:
• Du gehst mit den Stakeholdern in den Austausch und erhebst ihre Anforderungen.
• Du dokumentierst die Anforderungen in Form von User Stories.
• Gemeinsam mit der IT suchst du nach effizienten Lösungen für die Umsetzungen.
• Dabei hast du stets einen Blick darauf, die Prozesse zu optimieren und zu digitalisieren.
• Du machst Anwendertests und prüfst die IT-Systeme damit auf ihre fachliche Richtigkeit.
• Als Schnittstelle zwischen den Stakeholdern bist du Übersetzer, Berater und Moderator in einem.
• Warum gerade Du?
• Du hast eine abgeschlossene Schulausbildung (Matura), grundlegendes Verständnis für Webanwendungen sowie IT-Systeme und Freude an agilen Arbeitsweisen.
• Du hast Interesse an Geschäftsprozessen einer Versicherung und denkst analytisch.
• Du arbeitest strukturiert und organisiert.
• IT-Systeme schrecken dich nicht, sondern bereiten dir Freude.
• Du findest Lösungen, die das Arbeiten für dich, das Team und die Firma einfacher machen.

Kontakt

Patricia Scurtu
Recruiting Expertin
+43 (0) 50 222 1228

Machen Sie den ersten Schritt und bewerben Sie sich ausschliesslich online. Wir berücksichtigen nur Direktbewerbungen.

Arbeiten bei Helvetia

Wir bei Helvetia suchen Menschen mit Ecken und Kanten. Echte Persönlichkeiten, die mit Herz bei der Sache sind, mutig vorangehen und nicht davor zurückschrecken mal auf Gegenwind zu stoßen. Denn nur wer Neues ausprobiert und daraus lernt, bringt sich selbst und das gesamte Unternehmen weiter. Dieses Vertrauen schenken wir all unseren Mitarbeitenden und genau das macht Arbeiten bei Helvetia auch so besonders. Wir sagen dazu: &Los

title: Business Analyst Global Logistics /m/f/x/ - Urgent
description:
We are looking for a proactive Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x) to join our cohesive team at Hilti Aktiengesellschaft in Liechtenstein.
Growing your career as a Full Time Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x) is an awesome opportunity to develop exceptional skills.
If you are strong in problem-solving, planning and have the right work ethic for the job, then apply for the position of Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x) at Hilti Aktiengesellschaft today!

Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x)

You will be working with a team of people striving for excellence, with an open, inclusive, and supportive culture. Come to a place where you will own your development and career journey: global or local, cross-functional or as a specialist. If you’re willing to go the extra mile, there is no limit to what you can achieve. Global Logistics is run from our state-of-the art fully automated warehouse in Nendeln, Liechtenstein. Just a short, 5 minute bus ride north of our main... headquarters campus. Enjoy the variety of healthy food from the campus restaurants, keep in shape at the in-house gym, bring your kids to the on-site childcare, or commute with e-bikes free of charge. For the full range of benefits, take a look at Additionally, you will be amazed by the natural beauty of the area and what the alpine life has to offer.

Strong functional expertise in reporting, analysis and statistics with high affinity for new technologies and market trends like AI, machine learning, big data Excellent communication and presentation skills Very strong project management skills, experience with agile approach (SCRUM) Excellent SAP R/3, BW/4HANA, S/4HANA, SAC and MS Power Bi knowledge, database skills of advantage Experience in Power Automate Programming skills in Python Strong experience in logistics and/or supply chain Master’s degree in business, economics and/or data science Fluent in English

Strong functional expertise in reporting, analysis and statistics with high affinity for new technologies and market trends like AI, machine learning, big data Excellent communication and presentation skills Very strong project management skills, experience with agile approach (SCRUM) Excellent SAP R/3, BW/4HANA, S/4HANA, SAC and MS Power Bi knowledge, database skills of advantage Experience in Power Automate Programming skills in Python Strong experience in logistics and/or supply chain Master’s degree in business, economics and/or data science Fluent in English

Benefits of working as a Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x) in Liechtenstein:

● Company offers great benefits
● Rapid Progression
● Attractive packageCompetitive Pay

title: Hello,  IT Business Analyst (m/w/d)!
description:
Beginne Deine berufliche Karriere als IT Business Analyst in unserem wachsenden Beratungsteam. Lerne hierzu Lösungsvarianten und Konzepte für aktuelle Herausforderungen unserer Kunden:innen zu entwickeln. Dies beinhaltet die Verbesserung von Geschäftsprozessen, die Umgestaltung bestehender Organisationsstrukturen, die Umsetzung regulatorischer Anforderungen oder die Analyse und Realisierung neuer Geschäftsideen.
Deine Aufgaben
• Analyse und Gestaltung IT-gestützter Geschäftsprozesse unserer Kund:innen in Fachbereichen wie CRM, IT Security oder Supply Chain Management
• Anforderungsanalyse, Konzeption und Planung (organisatorisch, funktional und technisch) in komplexen Transformationsprojekten in einer Schnittstellenfunktion zwischen Fachbereichen und IT
• Strukturierte Erhebung von fachlichen Anforderungen und Überleitung in funktionale Konzepte
• Arbeitspaketverantwortung in Consulting-, Konzeptions- und Umsetzungsprojekten
• Unterstützung bei Pre-Sales Aktivitäten
Dein Profil
•... Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, BWL oder in den technischen Wissenschaften mit IT-Bezug
• Methodische Erfahrungen mit Business-Analyse, Prozessoptimierung und Solution Design
• Hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten und proaktiver selbstständiger Arbeitsstil
• Freude am Kundenkontakt und sehr gute Präsentationsfähigkeiten
• Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Das erwartet Dich bei uns
• Umfangreiche interne und externe Weiterbildung
• Flache Hierarchie und kurze Kommunikationswege
• Die Möglichkeit, das Unternehmen aktiv mitzugestalten
• Ausgezeichnete Karrieremöglichkeiten vom Consultant bis zu Partner:innen
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office-Möglichkeit
• Benefits wie z. B. Gewinnbeteiligung, Essensgutscheine, Klimaticket, Friday Business Breakfast, Teamevents
• gute Verkehrsanbindung und zusätzlicher Urlaub vom 24. bis 31. Dezember gemäß interner Policy
Das Unternehmen

Ventum Consulting ist ein internationales Technologie- und Managementberatungsunternehmen mit über 170 Mitarbeiter:innen in Wien, München, Beijing und Foshan (China). Wir unterstützen Unternehmensbereiche bei der Neuausrichtung ihrer Strategien und Prozesse und stärken die Unternehmens-IT als Innovationsträger.

Unsere Stärke liegt in unserem herausragenden Team. Mit fachlicher Expertise und Branchenkenntnis, kreativem Potenzial, hohem Engagement und unternehmerischem Zugang gelingt es unseren Mitarbeiter:innen, über den Tellerrand hinaus zu schauen und herausfordernde Aufgaben zu meistern.
Warum Ventum Consulting

Deine Berufserfahrung füllt noch keine Bände? Bei Ventum Consulting ist es nie zu früh, um großartig zu sein! Wir vertrauen in Deine Talente – und lassen Dich machen. Wachse über Dich hinaus, während Du anspruchsvolle Projekte umsetzt. Teste Deine Ideen im Kontakt mit der Wirklichkeit. Und sei Dir sicher, dass Dein Team und Dein Counselor immer für Dich da sind, wenn Du einmal nicht weiterkommst. Hinterlasse Deine Spuren in der Welt – ab dem ersten Tag.
Bewirb dich jetzt einfach mit deinem Onlineprofil!

Sende uns Deinen aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf und relevante Zeugnisse gerne unter Angabe Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

Für diese Position wird ein Jahresgehalt ab EUR 44.000 brutto geboten. Je nach Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung besteht die Bereitschaft zur deutlichen Überzahlung.

Hier bewerben

Zurück zur Übersicht
