title: Logistics Business Analyst (m/f/d) 38,5h/w - IKEA Austria GmbH
description:
About this work area

The Customer Order management Team is looking for Order Allocation specialist. You will be responsible for the execution of the order allocation strategy which maximizes customer fulfilment network utilization, by contributing to analyse order and range allocation performance in all customer touch points from end-to-end perspective. You will be involved in our ongoing transformation from a traditional cash & carry retailer to an Omni-channel retailing in home furnishing business area.

About you:
• You are inspired by finding improvements through data analysis
• You feel motivated by self-driven learning environment
• You have passion to be part of omnichannel retailing transformation
• You have excellent analytical and numeric skills and ability to perform accurate advanced data manipulation, data analysis, and information presentation
• You are proficient in statistical packages like Excel, and fluent in data visualization software like Qlik; knowledge of... statistical programming software (Phytons, SQL) and will be a bonus point.
• You can provide structure and order to undefined problems, and uses systemic thinking in devising solution options
• You have ability to effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders to support proposed improvements
• You have working experience as business analyst or equivalent function within supply chain, economics (preferrable in omnichannel retailing sector).
• You are fluent in English, both written and verbal

About this work area

• Responsible for creating an efficient and effective configuration of the order management system to support ideal order allocation in each fulfilment unit on the market; with strong cooperation with the key stakeholders to ensure that all business factors are considered to excellently fulfil the customer promise.
• Responsible for dynamic order management system including investigating and troubleshooting on system issue, provide business input to digital development.
• Responsible to review order orchestration parameters, according to business improvement need, in customer fulfilment backbone systems in collaboration with your stakeholders.
• Responsible for monitoring customer order flow throughout the order life cycle; gather and analyse order information, turn order data into information and insight, which can be used to recognizes customer order flow problems and opportunities, engages in continuous assessment and improvement to find better order fulfilment setup towards lower costs.
• Responsible for reviewing product allocation while keeping holistic view in balancing among capacity utilisation, stock, and service availability to provide seamless customer shopping experience.
• Contribute to developing local improvements in working methods, process, and tools; and take part in implementing global routines, systems solutions and ways of working with all partners on the market, in close cooperation and co-creation with the Group Customer Order Team to secure continuous improvement.

Together as a team

We're the team behind the scenes that make the IKEA products available to the many people. As a diverse mix of co-workers we use our supply process expertise to balance range and space capacity with forecasting and ordering to provide customers with high availability while minimizing costs. If you've wonder who's responsible for finding effective and efficient ways of picking up the products for our customers, that's us. We're passionate about working together to improve the customer experience at IKEA!

Yulan and her Team, consisting of three great colleagues, are looking forward to meeting you!

Apply now!

We welcome all applications and especially applications from people with disabilities and people from different ethnic backgrounds. Please apply online and don't forget to include your motivation letter (we think that a good and interesting motivation letter often says much more about you than many degrees).

For this position we offer you a monthly gross salary starting from € 2.775,- (on fulltime base with an ALL IN contractual agreement). We are willing to pay more depending on experience and qualification. And we are happy to offer the option for job sharing.

You have the flexibility to work up to 2/3 of your time in home office. You can find out more about our benefits and development opportunities here: Arbeiten bei IKEA

title: IT Business Analyst for our DWH and Group Data Integration (f/m/x)
description:
IT Business Analyst for our DWH and Group Data Integration (f / m / x)

DWH & Group Data Integration is responsible for all innovations and operations in our Enterprise and Group Data Warehouse area, which is the basis for RBI bank steering (Finance, Risk and Regulatory).

In our international team intercultural skills and customer orientation are key success factors.

In order to strengthen our team, we are looking for a Business Analyst responsible for managing the business analysis, facilitating and challenging requirements as well as defining test cases to shape the next generation data architecture to fulfill regulatory requirements.

You will engage in cross department business analysis initiatives (know-how exchange with subsidiaries) and improve quality assurance of the solutions throughout the entire development process.

Support business lines in definition of new IT requirements and change requests are additional responsibilities of that role.

full-time

38.5h ... week)

viennaoffice

1030 or 1190)

homeoffice

possible

Your mission at RBI
• Analyzing and documenting business requirements, changing requests and business processes
• Structuring and breaking down the backlog with the Product Owner
• Performing structured system analysis and effort estimations
• Elaborating detailed mappings for interfaces and facilitating requirements workshops
• Assisting in troubleshooting of software application issues and incidents
• Creating the test cases and support system- and user acceptance tests (UAT)

Your core competencies
• Analytical, result-oriented and structured way of working
• Experience with Data Warehouse and work experience with SQL
• Work experience in the finance industry as Business Analyst and Requirements Engineer
• Knowledge of or interest in the most important bank steering business processes (finance, risk management)
• Communication skills to act as an interface with different stakeholders
• Sound skills of English

Nice to have
• Design backend and front end of BI solutions
• German

What's in it for you
• Work Life Balance : flexible working hours (no core time), extensive hybrid working options / work from home
• Easy Moving : relocation allowance & work permit support
• Top-notch Equipment : modern tools & technologies
• International Spirit : multi-cultural teams, English as company language, team building events
• Learning & Agile Working : as part of our DNA & culture
• Canteen : healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized
• Saving : with vouchers / discounts from our staffs' council (eg. supermarket)
• Further Goodies : free public transport pass, salary account & credit card, reduced gym membership, gender-neutral parental leave, bilingual company kindergarten etc.
• Salary : the offered gross yearly salary starts at 60.000 Euro (basis full-time) includingovertime, depending on qualification and experience.

At Raiffeisen Bank International , we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries what got us here, are our talented people.

From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive.

are essential components of our and are reflected in our values : collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility.

Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs.

For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our our check out our .

title: IT Business Analyst (f/m/x) in Group Data Management
description:
IT Business Analyst (f/m/x) in Group Data Management

The Group Data Management department is responsible to plan, execute and steer large data innovation initiatives across RBI and its subsidiaries in CEE. Our internal customers include Advanced Analytics, Corporate, Finance, Retail, Markets and Regulatory Reporting and others. We enable our company to become a data driven organization by utilizing cross functional and cross border collaboration, modern technology and continuous innovation.

#full-time

(38.5h / week)

#viennaoffice

(1030)

#homeoffice

possible

Your mission at RBI
• Act as end-to-end coordinator and data consultant for large scale data initiatives
• Support the Product Owners in structuring and breaking down Data Demands in the central data backlog
• Collaborate across hierarchies with teams in head office and RBI subsidiaries in CEE to deliver new data demands
• Identify and propose solutions in our Data Ecosystem
• Building a Prototype of new data requirements... and collect acceptance criteria
• Define test approaches and support integration- and user acceptance tests
• Support the definition and implementation of the Group Data Strategy
• Analyze data flows across the organization and identify improvement potentials
• Working in a highly motivated agile team with excellent team spirit

Your core competencies
• University degree or similar with business or technical background
• Good knowledge about delivery methods or project management
• Good knowledge of requirements engineering and testing methods
• Good Data modeling and SQL knowledge or similar data manipulation skills are beneficiary
• Knowledge of bank steering business processes (finance, risk management)
• Analytical, result-oriented and structured way of working
• Fluent in English

Nice to have
• Preferably 3 years’ experience in a Data Management, Business Intelligence or Project Management position
• Very good communication, presentation and facilitation skills
• Experience with SCRUM or other agile methods are appreciated
• Dedicated team player with high customer orientation

What's in it for you
• Work Life Balance : f lexible working hours (no core time), extensive hybrid working options / work from home
• Easy Moving : work permit support
• Top-notch Equipment : modern tools & technologies
• International Spirit : multi-cultural teams, English as company language, team building events
• Learning & Agile Working : as part of our DNA & culture
• Canteen : healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized
• Saving : with vouchers / discounts from our staffs council (eg. supermarket)
• Further Goodies : free public transport pass, salary account & credit card, reduced gym membership, gender-neutral parental leave, bilingual company kindergarten etc.
• Salary: the offered gross yearly salary starts at 50.000,- Euro (basis full-time) excluding overtime, depending on qualification and experience.)

At Raiffeisen Bank International , we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries – what got us here, are our talented people . From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs.

For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our website or check out our FAQ .

Follow us on our RBI Account on
LinkedIn

title: (Senior) Business Analyst - Business Process Management (m/w/d)
description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Wir, die IT der REWE Group Österreich, entwickeln mit über 600 Mitarbeiter:innen innovative IT-Produkte und Services für all unsere Unternehmensbereiche im In- und Ausland und geben den Ton für den modernen Handel an.

Du möchtest im Business Analysis & Process Engineering Team unser sehr umfangreiches IT-Modernisierungsprogamm mit begleiten und unsere Geschäftsprozesse im Lebensmittel- und Drogeriefachhandel für unsere Handelsfirmen Billa, Bipa, Penny, Adeg und IKI in 9 Ländern auf das nächste Level heben?

Du konzipiest leidenschaftlich gerne Geschäftsprozesse um End-to-End das Beste rauszuholen? Du möchtest federführend an der Entwicklung von state-of-the-art IT Lösungen für unsere Handelsfirmen beteiligt sein? Dann bist Du bei uns richtig!

Stellenbeschreibung
• Verantwortung für die Neukonzeption und Digitalisierung unserer End-to-End Geschäftsprozesse
• Unterstützung der kontinuierlichen Weiterentwicklung unseres Unternehmens durch systematisches... Erheben und Verbessern aktueller Abläufe
• Entwurf von Prozessen für neue strategische Geschäftsmodelle auf Basis von Best Practices sowie Anforderungen der Fachbereiche
• Identifikation relevanter Prozess-Kennzahlen zur Messung des Optimierungserfolges
• Mitarbeit bei der Auswahl von IT-Lösungen durch Identifikation, Analyse und Spezifikation fachlicher Anforderungen
• Aufbereitung von Entscheidungsvorlagen für das Top-Management inkl. Business Case Betrachtungen
• Enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Business Process Ownern aus den Fachbereichen
• Unterstützung von innovativen Projekten
• Planung und Mitarbeit bei unternehmensweiten Schulungen in Prozessmanagement und/oder Business Analyse

Qualifikationen
• Abgeschlossenes Studium (Uni/FH) im Bereich Prozessmanagement, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Betriebswirtschaft oder einer vergleichbaren Ausbildung
• 2+ Jahre (Junior) bzw. 5+ Jahre (Senior) praktische Erfahrung im Prozessmanagement oder Solution Design
• Solides Grundverständnis von relevanten Geschäfts- und IT-Prozessen
• Erfahrung und Methodenkompetenz in der Identifikation, Analyse, Verbesserung und Design von Geschäftsprozessen inkl. Erstellen von Prozessdiagrammen und KPIs
• Verständnis für die Erstellung und Pflege von Prozesslandkarten
• Facheinschlägige Zertifizierungen sowie Kenntnisse von BPMN und marktüblicher Tools von Vorteil
• Analytische, lösungsorientierte und strukturierte Arbeitsweise
• Ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit gepaart mit einem hohen Maß an Eigeninitiative und Selbstverantwortung
• Souveränes Auftreten mit der Fähigkeit KundInnen mit innovativen Ansätzen zu überzeugen
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Zusätzliche Informationen
• Langfristige, abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit bei einem verlässlichen Arbeitgeber in einem kollegialen Team
• Familienfreundliche Unternehmenskultur mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice unter Berücksichtigung deiner individuellen Bedürfnisse
• Zahlreiche Ausbildungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten im Konzern (5% der Arbeitszeit für selbstorganisierte Weiterbildung)
• Mitarbeiter:innen-Rabatte bei Einkauf und Reisen
• Umfangreiches Angebot zur Gesundheitsvorsorge wie z.B. Fitnesskurse, Massagen,..
• Gute öffentliche Erreichbarkeit
• Ein marktkonformes, attraktives und leistungsbezogenes Jahresbruttogehalt ab min. EUR 55.000,- mit klarer Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung bei entsprechender Erfahrung und Qualifikation

Wir suchen die Neugierigen, die Verlässlichen, die Motivierten, die Vielseitigen, die Ungewöhnlichen, die Offenen, die Fokussierten, die Umdenkenden, die Mitdenkenden, die Nachdenkenden und vor allem die Menschlichen, die Neues entdecken wollen.

Wir fördern ein vielfältiges und inklusives Arbeitsumfeld. Daher freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen unterschiedlichen Geschlechts, Alters, kulturellem oder sozialem Hintergrund, sexueller Identität und Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderungen. Zusätzlich möchten wir den Anteil von Frauen in technischen Berufsfeldern erhöhen und freuen wir uns für diese Position besonders über Bewerbungen von Frauen

title: Business Analyst Global Logistics /m/f/x/ - Urgent
description:
We are looking for a proactive Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x) to join our cohesive team at Hilti Aktiengesellschaft in Liechtenstein.
Growing your career as a Full Time Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x) is an awesome opportunity to develop exceptional skills.
If you are strong in problem-solving, planning and have the right work ethic for the job, then apply for the position of Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x) at Hilti Aktiengesellschaft today!

Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x)

You will be working with a team of people striving for excellence, with an open, inclusive, and supportive culture. Come to a place where you will own your development and career journey: global or local, cross-functional or as a specialist. If you’re willing to go the extra mile, there is no limit to what you can achieve. Global Logistics is run from our state-of-the art fully automated warehouse in Nendeln, Liechtenstein. Just a short, 5 minute bus ride north of our main... headquarters campus. Enjoy the variety of healthy food from the campus restaurants, keep in shape at the in-house gym, bring your kids to the on-site childcare, or commute with e-bikes free of charge. For the full range of benefits, take a look at Additionally, you will be amazed by the natural beauty of the area and what the alpine life has to offer.

Strong functional expertise in reporting, analysis and statistics with high affinity for new technologies and market trends like AI, machine learning, big data Excellent communication and presentation skills Very strong project management skills, experience with agile approach (SCRUM) Excellent SAP R/3, BW/4HANA, S/4HANA, SAC and MS Power Bi knowledge, database skills of advantage Experience in Power Automate Programming skills in Python Strong experience in logistics and/or supply chain Master’s degree in business, economics and/or data science Fluent in English

Strong functional expertise in reporting, analysis and statistics with high affinity for new technologies and market trends like AI, machine learning, big data Excellent communication and presentation skills Very strong project management skills, experience with agile approach (SCRUM) Excellent SAP R/3, BW/4HANA, S/4HANA, SAC and MS Power Bi knowledge, database skills of advantage Experience in Power Automate Programming skills in Python Strong experience in logistics and/or supply chain Master’s degree in business, economics and/or data science Fluent in English

Benefits of working as a Business Analyst Global Logistics (m/f/x) in Liechtenstein:

● Company offers great benefits
● Rapid Progression
● Attractive packageCompetitive Pay

title: Hello,  IT Business Analyst (m/w/d)!
description:
Beginne Deine berufliche Karriere als IT Business Analyst in unserem wachsenden Beratungsteam. Lerne hierzu Lösungsvarianten und Konzepte für aktuelle Herausforderungen unserer Kunden:innen zu entwickeln. Dies beinhaltet die Verbesserung von Geschäftsprozessen, die Umgestaltung bestehender Organisationsstrukturen, die Umsetzung regulatorischer Anforderungen oder die Analyse und Realisierung neuer Geschäftsideen.
Deine Aufgaben
• Analyse und Gestaltung IT-gestützter Geschäftsprozesse unserer Kund:innen in Fachbereichen wie CRM, IT Security oder Supply Chain Management
• Anforderungsanalyse, Konzeption und Planung (organisatorisch, funktional und technisch) in komplexen Transformationsprojekten in einer Schnittstellenfunktion zwischen Fachbereichen und IT
• Strukturierte Erhebung von fachlichen Anforderungen und Überleitung in funktionale Konzepte
• Arbeitspaketverantwortung in Consulting-, Konzeptions- und Umsetzungsprojekten
• Unterstützung bei Pre-Sales Aktivitäten
Dein Profil
•... Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, BWL oder in den technischen Wissenschaften mit IT-Bezug
• Methodische Erfahrungen mit Business-Analyse, Prozessoptimierung und Solution Design
• Hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten und proaktiver selbstständiger Arbeitsstil
• Freude am Kundenkontakt und sehr gute Präsentationsfähigkeiten
• Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Das erwartet Dich bei uns
• Umfangreiche interne und externe Weiterbildung
• Flache Hierarchie und kurze Kommunikationswege
• Die Möglichkeit, das Unternehmen aktiv mitzugestalten
• Ausgezeichnete Karrieremöglichkeiten vom Consultant bis zu Partner:innen
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office-Möglichkeit
• Benefits wie z. B. Gewinnbeteiligung, Essensgutscheine, Klimaticket, Friday Business Breakfast, Teamevents
• gute Verkehrsanbindung und zusätzlicher Urlaub vom 24. bis 31. Dezember gemäß interner Policy
Das Unternehmen

Ventum Consulting ist ein internationales Technologie- und Managementberatungsunternehmen mit über 170 Mitarbeiter:innen in Wien, München, Beijing und Foshan (China). Wir unterstützen Unternehmensbereiche bei der Neuausrichtung ihrer Strategien und Prozesse und stärken die Unternehmens-IT als Innovationsträger.

Unsere Stärke liegt in unserem herausragenden Team. Mit fachlicher Expertise und Branchenkenntnis, kreativem Potenzial, hohem Engagement und unternehmerischem Zugang gelingt es unseren Mitarbeiter:innen, über den Tellerrand hinaus zu schauen und herausfordernde Aufgaben zu meistern.
Warum Ventum Consulting

Deine Berufserfahrung füllt noch keine Bände? Bei Ventum Consulting ist es nie zu früh, um großartig zu sein! Wir vertrauen in Deine Talente – und lassen Dich machen. Wachse über Dich hinaus, während Du anspruchsvolle Projekte umsetzt. Teste Deine Ideen im Kontakt mit der Wirklichkeit. Und sei Dir sicher, dass Dein Team und Dein Counselor immer für Dich da sind, wenn Du einmal nicht weiterkommst. Hinterlasse Deine Spuren in der Welt – ab dem ersten Tag.
Bewirb dich jetzt einfach mit deinem Onlineprofil!

Sende uns Deinen aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf und relevante Zeugnisse gerne unter Angabe Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

Für diese Position wird ein Jahresgehalt ab EUR 44.000 brutto geboten. Je nach Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung besteht die Bereitschaft zur deutlichen Überzahlung.

Hier bewerben

Zurück zur Übersicht

title: Business Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking for a Business Analyst (m/f/d)

Your tasks:

– Gather and analyse requirements from various business departments like portfolio management, compliance, product management or customer service

– Align with the product owner(s) the backlog and priority of the requirements

– Critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources and decompose high-level requirements into detailed ones

– Write business specification documents and manage requirements documentation throughout the Software Development Lifecycle

– Structure and align requirements with the development teams including technical analysis of the requirements

– Act as a liaison between business and technical teams to ensure adherence to requirements

– Contribute to the continuous improvement process for requirements analysis and documentation

– Build and maintain product specification documents for internal and customer approval

– Supporting our developers and testers with requirements engineering... and story refinement and specifications

Your qualification:

– Completed academic education (Bachelor / Master) degree in system engineering, software architecture, computer science, information technology or similar

– At least 3 years system engineering experience in a professional environment

– Passion for technology and a thorough understanding of front-end and back-end development

– Ability to translate business needs into stories/requirements

– Having in-depth knowledge as a Business Analyst (Having an IREB certificate is an advantage)

– Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written. German skills are an advantage

– Experience with JIRA and Workflow Diagramming tools

– Strong decision-making, communication skills and an agile mindset

What we offer:

– Flexible working hours and possibility of Homeoffice

– Tea, coffee and fruit for free, special sport offers for CASHPOINT employees and more!

– Wiener Linien annual transport pass (job ticket) or Sodexo meal allowances as a benefit

– Open company culture without dress code

– Innovative working atmosphere as a member of our CASHPOINT family

– Opportunities for professional & personal development (courses, seminars and exhibitions)

– Parties & team-building events (indoor skydiving, kart racing, etc.)

– We offer a gross salary starting at € 3,500.– per month (40 hrs/week) for this position, which exceeds the collective bargaining agreement, with corresponding additional payment offered in accordance with specific qualifications and experience.

If you would like to play your part in the success of a dynamic, innovative company and are interested in pursuing a challenging role, we look forward to receiving your application

title: Associate Director, Business Analyst, Dev Centers Solutions
description:
2023 will potentially see Sandoz become a standalone organization! Already a global market leader in Generics and Biosimilar medicine, this is an exciting, once-in-a-career opportunity to set our own path forward as an independent, purpose-driven organization, and as the founders of a new Sandoz, this is a time of immense opportunity for us all, both professionally and personally!

Together we will shape the future of Sandoz are you ready to make a difference?

Why Sandoz?

500 million patients were touched by Sandoz generic and biosimilar medicines in 2021 and while we're proud of this, we know there is more we could do to continue to help pioneer access to medicines for people around the world.

How will we do this? We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation.

Aufgaben

Job Summary/Purpose :

As an Associate Director, Business Analyst, Dev Centers Solutions (d/f/m) you will be... responsible for project delivery and/or operations in the given business area. It will see you partnering with Business Stakeholders and TT Strategic Business Partners for demand analysis, solution proposal/evaluation and project delivery.

Your Key Responsibilities:

• Execute technology delivery strategy for business systems, platforms, and processes for a particular Business domain / Function.

• Partner with senior business stakeholders and TT Strategic Business Partners for demand analysis, solution proposal/evaluation, and funding estimates.

• Partner with business partners to ensure Technology Service/Solutions Delivery teams deliver products according to strategy with reuse across other areas. Ensure on time, within budget, compliant, secure, and quality delivery of portfolio for responsible function / service area.

• Ensure services, solutions, platforms, products are fit for purpose and achieve thedesired business value and impact.

• Run efficient DevOps for platforms, products, or systems ensuring availability andoptimal performance for responsible function / service area.

• Establish governance structure for projects, operations, etc with right stakeholder representation.

• Track, report, and deliver against agreed success factors and KPIs for variousstakeholders for responsible function / service area.

• Follow industry trends and emerging practices to drive agility, speed, efficiency, and effectiveness. Ensure the overall user experience is taken into account when designing deploying new solutions and services.

Profil

Minimum Requirements

What you will bring to the role:

• University degree or various degrees in business, computer science, information technology discipline or equivalent, MBA optional

• 5 years+ of industry experience in IT, healthcare, or pharma; expert understanding of technology and methodologies as applied in the respective area

• Deep knowledge of IT and business processes and experience in validated environments (GxP)

• Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders, manage issues, resolve conflicts, and mitigate risks.

• Networking with key business and IT stakeholders and ability to present to stakeholder groups

• Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills at team and management levels, with the ability to establish and maintain a high level of trust and confidence

• Strong internal and/or external influencing skills to achieve the program objectives

• Analytical, process-oriented with a keen interest to drive continuous improvements

Wir bieten

Diversity & Inclusion / EEO

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Austria only: Minimum annual gross salary € 66526,88 (on a full-time basis)

That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.

We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world's toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!

Imagine what you could do here at Sandoz!

Already a global market leader in Generics and Biosimilar medicine, this is an exciting, once-in-a-career opportunity to set our own path forward as an independent, purpose-driven organization, and as the founders of a new Sandoz, this is a time of immense opportunity for us all, both professionally and personally!

Together we will shape the future of Sandoz are you ready to make a difference?

Why Sandoz?

500 million patients were touched by Sandoz generic and biosimilar medicines in 2021 and while we're proud of this, we know there is more we could do to continue to help pioneer access to medicines for people around the world.

How will we do this? We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation.

Aufgaben

title: Junior Business Analyst (Remote Internship)
description:
LOCATION: Remote Work

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Are you eager to hone your business analysis skills and kick-start a thriving career in this vibrant field? Would you like to collaborate with a prestigious Management Consulting company in Germany and gain hands-on experience in evaluating business operations? TalentKompass Deutschland is excited to present the perfect opportunity for you!

We are currently offering a beginner-level internship program tailored for individuals passionate about examining business operations and identifying areas for improvement. This internship will equip you with practical experience in business analysis while enhancing your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and more.

As an intern with our client's Management Consulting team, you will work closely with accomplished Business Analysts and consultants to collect and analyze data, discern trends and insights, and formulate recommendations for clients. This remote position allows you to work from... the comfort of your own home.

What we're looking for:
• A genuine interest in understanding business operations
• Robust analytical skills and the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets
• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for collaborating with team members at all levels
• Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to work precisely in a fast-paced environment
• A commitment to learning and growing in the field of business analysis
• Familiarity with Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
• A basic understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques

Responsibilities:
• Assist in collecting and analyzing data from various sources
• Collaborate with consultants to identify trends and insights
• Develop recommendations to address business challenges
• Participate in team meetings, contributing ideas and insights
• Foster a positive team culture and collaborate to achieve team objectives
• Support the creation of project documentation

If you're prepared to embark on your business analysis career and acquire practical experience, we encourage you to apply for our internship program. Seize this exciting opportunity to learn and grow in the field of business analysis

title: Technical Requirements Engineer / Business Analyst (m/f/x)
description:
At Cloudflight we deliver custom software products to our clients and accompany them throughout their digitalization journey that encompasses everything from discovering their challenges to delivering high-class solutions. Our projects are quite diverse in domains, technology, and setup, so we carefully analyze our customers’ processes and needs to deliver state-of-the-art software that makes their lives easier. That's what we call a digital difference.

We believe in the power of technology as a positive force in society. Because of that, we choose our partners based on our values and high moral standards.

Your daily tasks will include

️ collaborating with customers, users, and Scrum team members to identify, analyze, and specify requirements for projects

️ asking targeted questions and proposing alternative solutions to address any professional or technical obstacles that arise during the project

️ taking the lead in technical grooming and architectural sessions to ensure the... project is on track and meets the requirements

️ ensuring that all implemented features provide value to the customer and are delivered on time and within budget

️ conducting acceptance tests to confirm that the project meets the desired quality and functionality

️ visualizing processes and requirements to facilitate communication and understanding among team members and stakeholders

️ acting as the primary point of contact between the development team and customers, ensuring clear and effective communication

️ maintaining and prioritizing the backlog to ensure that the project stays focused and on track

️ developing and growing the project together with the customer, providing valuable advice and guidance as a trusted advisor

The following will make you succeed in this role

️ a minimum of 3 years of job-relevant experience, such as in the positions of business analyst, requirements engineer, product owner, or agile project manager in an agile environment with distributed cross-functional teams

️ analytical thinking, questioning assumptions, and comprehending the requirements of your stakeholders

️ demonstrating proactive behavior and a high degree of self-initiative

️ a solid technical background and knowledge of DevOps processes and architecture to contribute to the development and delivery of successful projects

️ excellent moderation and presentation skills to facilitate productive meetings and presentations with team members and stakeholders

️ fluency in both English and German

️ attention to details while also keeping an eye on the big picture to ensure that all project requirements are met and the project stays on track

️ interest on technical innovations to help drive innovation and continuous improvement within the team and organization

We are an equal opportunity employer. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive regardless of their background and circumstances. All applicants receive equal opportunity regardless of age, gender identity or expression, language, disability, ethnicity, national origin, religion, or sexual orientation.

For Austria: The law stipulates that the minimum wage must be specified in job postings. The minimum salary is 48.370 euros/year in the collective agreement. Adequate to your skills, we are willing to pay much more.

We will go through your application and come back with feedback no matter the stage.

Any questions? Contact us at jobs@cloudflight.io

title: Business Analyst /m/f/d/ Spare Parts Management - Dynamic Team
description:
We are eager to add an expert Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management to join our knowledgeable team at BRP in Gunskirchen.
Growing your career as a Full Time Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management is an incredible opportunity to develop relevant skills.
If you are strong in critical thinking, emotional intelligence and have the right vision for the job, then apply for the position of Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management at BRP today!

Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management

BRP-Rotax gets the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure
• Analysis of spare parts requirements based on historical consumption data
• Introduction of a tool for forecasting spare parts requirements
• Continuous development of the planning model to optimize availability and inventory value
•... Data analysis and development of a value-based spare parts pricing strategy
• Close coordination of the spare parts strategy with the operational business units
• Development and tracking of key performance indicators to optimize the spare parts business

Your experiences and skills
• Degree (FH, University) in the field of Supply Chain Management, Data Engineering, Industrial Engineering or equivalent
• Alternatively, higher technical degree (HTL) with at least 3 years of professional experience, ideally in the area of spare parts sales/logistics
• Excellent IT skills (SAP, MS-Office with focus on Excel, PowerBI)
• Very good knowledge of big data analysis and interest in the topics of value chain planning, processes, inventory management and digitalization
• Good German and very good English skills, both written and spoken
• High level of social skills and initiative, systematic and goal-oriented way of working with high quality awareness

What we offer

You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is EUR 46,346.72 gross/year according to the very attractive collective agreement of the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience.

Benefits of working as a Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management in Gunskirchen:

● Excellent benefits
● Continuous Learning Opportunities
● Competitive salary

title: Hello, Senior Business Analyst & Projektmanager (m/w/d)!
description:
Komm zu Ventum Consulting als Senior Business Analyst & Projektmanager (m/w/d), werde Teil unseres wachsenden Beratungsteams und erarbeite Lösungsvarianten und Konzepte für die aktuellen Herausforderungen unserer Kunden. Dies reicht von der Digitalisierung komplexer Geschäftsprozesse, über die Transformation und Modernisierung bestehender IT-Landschaften bis zur Analyse und Realisierung neuer Geschäftsideen. Darüber hinaus kannst Du als Projektleiter:in auch Verantwortung für die Planung und Umsetzung der Vorhaben übernehmen, denn nichts ist befriedigender, als Dinge auf den Boden zu bringen und einen sichtbaren Beitrag zum Erfolg zu leisten.
Deine Aufgaben als Senior Business Analyst & Projektmanager (m/w/d)
• Bedarfsanalyse und Wirtschaftlichkeitsbetrachtungen für komplexe Transformationsvorhaben in einer Schnittstellenfunktion zwischen Fachbereichen und IT
• Analyse und Gestaltung IT-gestützter Geschäftsprozesse samt strukturierter Erhebung fachlicher Anforderungen und Überleitung... in funktionale Konzepte
• Ausarbeitung und Gegenüberstellung von Lösungsvarianten (organisatorisch, funktional und technisch)
• Eigenverantwortliche Planung, Koordination und Steuerung von IT- & Digitalisierungsprojekten
• Koordination von Teams (ggfs. in einem agilen Umfeld) für eine termingerechte und qualitativ-hochwertige Lieferung der entsprechenden Teilergebnisse.
• Projektstakeholder-Management sowie Vorbereitung und Moderation von Lenkungsausschüssen und Steuerungsgremien
• Unterstützung bei Pre-Sales Aktivitäten
Dein Profil
• Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, BWL oder in den technischen Wissenschaften mit IT-Bezug
• Erfahrung mit Business-Analyse, Prozessoptimierung und Solution Design
• Erste Erfahrung im IT-Projektmanagement und Interesse an der verantwortlichen Leitung von IT Projekten
• Hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten und proaktiver selbstständiger Arbeitsstil
• Freude am Kundenkontakt und gute Präsentationsfähigkeiten
• Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Das erwartet Dich bei uns
• Umfangreiche interne und externe Weiterbildung
• Flache Hierarchie und kurze Kommunikationswege
• Die Möglichkeit, das Unternehmen aktiv mitzugestalten
• Ausgezeichnete Karrieremöglichkeiten vom Consultant bis zum/ zur Partner:in
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office-Möglichkeit
• Benefits wie z. B. Gewinnbeteiligung, Essensgutscheine, Klimaticket, Friday Business Breakfast, Teamevents, gute
• Verkehrsanbindung und zusätzlicher Urlaub vom 24. bis 31. Dezember gemäß interner Policy
Das Unternehmen

Ventum Consulting ist ein internationales Technologie- und Managementberatungsunternehmen mit über 170 Mitarbeiter:innen in Wien, München, Beijing und Foshan (China). Wir unterstützen Unternehmensbereiche bei der Neuausrichtung ihrer Strategien und Prozesse und stärken die Unternehmens-IT als Innovationsträger.

Unsere Stärke liegt in unserem herausragenden Team. Mit fachlicher Expertise und Branchenkenntnis, kreativem Potenzial, hohem Engagement und unternehmerischem Zugang gelingt es unseren Mitarbeiter:innen, über den Tellerrand hinaus zu schauen und herausfordernde Aufgaben zu meistern.
Warum Ventum Consulting

Ab einem bestimmten Joblevel kommt es nicht allein auf einzigartige Projekte und Führungsaufgaben an. Was Du wirklich suchst, ist Freiheit. Die Freiheit, selbstständig zu denken und zu handeln. Deinen Tagesablauf nach Deinen Wünschen zu gestalten. Deine Entwicklungsrichtung selbst zu bestimmen. Genau das bieten wir Dir bei Ventum Consulting. Sei Teil eines Teams, das Deine individuellen Talente fördert und Deine eigene Herangehensweise feiert. You decide where you will go.
Bewirb dich jetzt einfach mit deinem Onlineprofil!

Sende uns Deinen aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf und relevante Zeugnisse gerne unter Angabe Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.

Für diese Position wird ein Jahresgehalt ab EUR 58.000 brutto geboten. Je nach Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung besteht die Bereitschaft zur deutlichen Überzahlung.

Hier bewerben

Zurück zur Übersicht

title: Business Analyst Intern
description:
You will join one of our offices around the world for 10 weeks, usually in the summer, to work in teams and directly with our clients.

In this role, you will help our clients in the private, public, and social sectors solve some their most pressing problems.

You will also work with a range of experts in the firm, from data scientists to researchers to software and app designers.

You’ll work in teams of typically 3 5 consultants, to identify, and oftentimes implement, potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge.

Together, you will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important goals.

Over the course of each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations.

You'll also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.

Some examples of the specific work may include interviewing... clients, leading client teams, building financial models, and working with McKinsey subject experts to develop perspectives and insights for the client.

Depending on your area of focus or client needs, you will be asked to travel to your client site.

When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

As a business analyst intern, you will receive training and coaching on how to better :
• Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them
• Synthesize complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods
• Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act
• Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations
• Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner
• Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values

McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you’ll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals.

Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams.

Our business analyst intern program gives a group of undergraduate students and eligible graduate students first-hand experience with consulting at McKinsey.

At the end of your internship, you may receive an offer to join us as a full-time business analyst after the completion of your degree.
• In your junior year of an undergraduate degree; with an expected graduation dates between December 2024 August 2025
• Junior year of your undergraduate degree or second year of your non-M.B.A masters
• Or in your senior / final year of undergraduate studies and planning to enter a one-year master’s program (in some geographies)
• Or currently completing your first year in a non-business, 2-year master’s program and have less than 2 years of work experience
• Or are in your first year of a two year commitment with Teach for America and have 3 years or fewer of work experience to date
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization
• Capability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team project
• Comfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situations
• Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis
• Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language(s
job_highlights:
[{'items': ["You will join one of our offices around the world for 10 weeks, usually in the summer, to work in teams and directly with our clients.

In this role, you will help our clients in the private, public, and social sectors solve some their most pressing problems.

You will also work with a range of experts in the firm, from data scientists to researchers to software and app designers.

You’ll work in teams of typically 3 5 consultants, to identify, and oftentimes implement, potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge.

Together, you will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important goals.

Over the course of each project, you will gather and analyze information, formulate and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations.

You'll also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.

Some examples of the specific work may include interviewing... clients, leading client teams, building financial models, and working with McKinsey subject experts to develop perspectives and insights for the client.

Depending on your area of focus or client needs, you will be asked to travel to your client site.

When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

As a business analyst intern, you will receive training and coaching on how to better :
• Structure ambiguous problems and take action to solve them
• Synthesize complex information into clear takeaways and recommendations using both qualitative and quantitative methods
• Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solution and move people and organizations to act
• Establish trust-based relationships with clients to better serve their organizations
• Communicate effectively with all audiences, including senior leaders, in a structured manner
• Develop your leadership style, leveraging your own passions, strengths, and personal values

McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you’ll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals.

Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams.

Our business analyst intern program gives a group of undergraduate students and eligible graduate students first-hand experience with consulting at McKinsey.

At the end of your internship, you may receive an offer to join us as a full-time business analyst after the completion of your degree.
• In your junior year of an undergraduate degree; with an expected graduation dates between December 2024 August 2025
• Junior year of your undergraduate degree or second year of your non-M.B.A masters
• Or in your senior / final year of undergraduate studies and planning to enter a one-year master’s program (in some geographies)
• Or currently completing your first year in a non-business, 2-year master’s program and have less than 2 years of work experience
• Or are in your first year of a two year commitment with Teach for America and have 3 years or fewer of work experience to date
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team and create an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization
• Capability to drive an independent workstream in the context of a broader team project
• Comfort with ambiguous, ever-changing situations
• Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis
• Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language(s"]}]

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
Your role in the team
• Analyze and document business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
• Identify and assess technical risks and challenges
• Conduct technical analysis to identify weaknesses in existing systems or processes
• Create specifications, requirements documents and technical process documentation
• Work closely with the development team to communicate requirements and support implementation
• Accompany our departments in the selection of IT solutions as well as the conception and integration into our existing IT landscape
• Assess new technologies and trends to propose innovative solutions

Technologies and skills
• JIRA
• Confluence

Our expectations:

Qualifications
• Independent, responsible and precise way of working as well as strong teamwork and communication skills
• In-depth understanding of technical systems, architectures and processes
• Strong understanding of agile development methodologies and project management
• Very good knowledge... of German and English (min. B2) in word and writing

Experience
• Several years of proven experience as a technical business analyst or in a similar technical analysis role
• Experience in conducting technical analysis and creating technical specifications
• Experience with process modeling tools (e.g. process and sequence diagrams) and requirements management (JIRA / Confluence) is an advantage

Education
• Benefits
• * Mentor Program
• Coffee, Tea, etc.
• Bonus Commisions
• Bicycle Parking Space
• Fitness Offers
• Extra Holidays
• No Physical Barriers
• Employee Discount
• Company Doctor
• Day Care for Kids
• Employee Parking Space
• Company Restaurant
• Meal Vouchers

title: Senior Analyst Business Unit Finance
description: As the world's largest and most broadly based healthcare company, we impact more than a billion lives through the innovation happening at 260 companies located in 60 countries around the world. Teams from Johnson & Johnson's consumer business are improving quality of life by creating digital tools to help people track the health of their skin. Those working in medical devices are 3-D printing artificial joints personalized for each patient, while researchers in pharmaceuticals are using AI to discover lifesaving drugs. We redefine what it means to be a big company in today's world. Who is Janssen? Simply put, we're people; more than 35, 000 working hard to treat, cure, stop and prevent some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time - from autoimmune diseases, hematology, oncology, HIV, mental disorders and heart disease. We believe that challenging something is the best way to change it. So, every day, in more than 150 countries, we bring together cutting-edge science... and the most creative minds in the industry to think differently about how diseases are treated and prevented. We aim not only to innovate but also to empower people with the tools they need to make informed decisions and achieve the best possible results for their health. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it . Business Unit Finance Senior Analyst Location: Vienna Janssen Austria is recruiting a Senior Financial Analyst to join the Business Unit Finance team based in Vienna, Austria. You will be responsible for supporting one or more therapeutic areas and be an integral part of a $300 million business growing strongly in the next years. This is a great opportunity to support a successful, dynamic and diverse operating company! At Janssen, we are dedicated to addressing and solving some of the most important unmet medical needs of our time in oncology, hematology, immunology, neuroscience, pulmonary hypertension and infectious diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we bring innovative products, services and solutions to people throughout the world. Janssen is a pharmaceutical company of Johnson & Johnson (J& J), where we are "Creating a future where disease is a thing of the past." Your Key Responsibilities: To support and drive financial forecasts for each planning cycle for your area of responsibility, ensuring accuracy, credibility, and completeness. To be the finance partner for some of our Business Units, to challenge, advise and support them in their product investments, scenario planning and business cases - having full scope across their sales and spending. To provide insightful analysis to explain deviations in our financial performance. To monitor expenses and resource allocation, where you can provide insights to enable your business leads to make agile decisions across the organization that can drive growth. To manage monthly and quarterly closing cycle, ensuring compliance, accuracy, and timely submissions in close alignment with the Global Services teams and the Finance Accounting Manager. To ensure all business partners have appropriate finance knowledge to enable accurate, timely, complete, and appropriate initiation of financial transactions such as accruals, prepayments, and purchase order goods receipts. To work as a team player across an international environment with the various Finance teams like the transactional and accounting teams in our Prague Global Services hub, the tax team and others. To contribute to an engaging, collaborative, mindful Business Unit Finance team having a Finance Architect mindset - constructive challenging and looking for value creating growth opportunities. To co-create on ad-hoc projects within the local team and/or regional Finance teams. To ensure compliance with the J& J financial, HCC and business conduct procedures and drive accountability throughout the organization. Your Qualifications: University Degree and/or equivalent finance certification Pharmaceutical / commercial finance experience highly desirable Strong business partnering skills; customer oriented and strategic mindset Proactive approach; desire for continuous improvement, simplification, and innovation Excellent interpersonal, communication skills, both written and verbally Ability to independently drive deliverables forward, but work well within a team environment Able to create a positive atmosphere of trust and mutual respect Results oriented with strong prioritization skills and a high sense of urgency Ability to maintain accuracy and be calm under pressure Curious mindset with a desire to learn, innovate and simplify Analytical and able to work with complexity and large amounts of data MS Office high proficiency especially Excel, Analysis for Office, SAP. Fluent English language skills required Fluent German language skills desirable Position requires max. 10% travel (within Europe) For this position we offer a gross annual salary of at least 63.500 EUR (plus applicable variables and benefits). There is a willingness to overpay, depending on professional qualifications and experience. For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) have been part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Our commitment to respect the dignity and diversity of all is embedded in our Credo. We know that the success of our business depends on having the best talent in a workforce that reflects the diverse markets we serve around the world and an inclusive culture that values different perspectives and life experiences. That is why we in Johnson & Johnson are working to create an inclusive environment where diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences are valued and each and every one of our people feels that they belong and can reach their potential. No matter who they are. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Johnson & Johnson means "You Belong

title: IT Business Analyst for our DWH and Group Data Integration (f/m/x)
description:
IT Business Analyst for our DWH and Group Data Integration (f/m/x)

DWH & Group Data Integration is responsible for all innovations and operations in our Enterprise and Group Data Warehouse area, which is the basis for RBI bank steering (Finance, Risk and Regulatory). In our international team intercultural skills and customer orientation are key success factors.

In order to strengthen our team, we are looking for a Business Analyst responsible for managing the business analysis, facilitating and challenging requirements as well as defining test cases to shape the next generation data architecture to fulfill regulatory requirements. You will engage in cross department business analysis initiatives (know-how exchange with subsidiaries) and improve quality assurance of the solutions throughout the entire development process. Support business lines in definition of new IT requirements and change requests are additional responsibilities of that role.

#full-time

(38.5h ... week)

#viennaoffice

(1030 or 1190)

#homeoffice

possible

Your mission at RBI
• Analyzing and documenting business requirements, changing requests and business processes
• Structuring and breaking down the backlog with the Product Owner
• Performing structured system analysis and effort estimations
• Elaborating detailed mappings for interfaces and facilitating requirements workshops
• Assisting in troubleshooting of software application issues and incidents
• Creating the test cases and support system- and user acceptance tests (UAT)

Your core competencies
• Analytical, result-oriented and structured way of working
• Experience with Data Warehouse and work experience with SQL
• Work experience in the finance industry as Business Analyst and Requirements Engineer
• Knowledge of or interest in the most important bank steering business processes (finance, risk management)
• Communication skills to act as an interface with different stakeholders
• Sound skills of English

Nice to have
• Design backend and front end of BI solutions
• German

What's in it for you
• Work Life Balance : f lexible working hours (no core time), extensive hybrid working options / work from home
• Easy Moving : relocation allowance & work permit support
• Top-notch Equipment : modern tools & technologies
• International Spirit : multi-cultural teams, English as company language, team building events
• Learning & Agile Working : as part of our DNA & culture
• Canteen : healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized
• Saving : with vouchers / discounts from our staffs' council (eg. supermarket)
• Further Goodies : free public transport pass, salary account & credit card, reduced gym membership, gender-neutral parental leave, bilingual company kindergarten etc.
• Salary: the offered gross yearly salary starts at 60.000 Euro (basis full-time) including overtime, depending on qualification and experience.

At Raiffeisen Bank International , we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries – what got us here, are our talented people . From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs.

For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our website our check out our FAQ .

Follow us on our RBI Account on
LinkedIn

title: IT Requirements Engineer Business Analyst
description:
Your role in the team
• As an IT requirements engineer/business analyst, you create technical requirements, analyze requirements and their effects on the system landscape and advise on the implementation of IT changes and projects. You support the implementation of user tests (UAT), accompany implementations and communicate with external software developers.

Technologies and skills
• Confluence
• JIRA

Our expectations:

Qualifications
• You have good knowledge of IT administration (Microsoft Office, Jira/Confluence,
• You are characterized by an independent and structured way of working, you have a high level of analytical skills and you recognize complex relationships
• You are an organizational talent and always focus on the customer in all decisions
• You are business fluent in German and English (spoken and written)

Experience
• and at least 2 years of professional experience as an IT requirements engineer or business analyst, preferably in the financial services or automotive... sector
• Ticket systems and ideally some experience with software development

Education
• You have completed technical or commercial training (HAK, HTL, FH, Uni) preferably in the financial services or automotive sector

Benefits
• Flexible Working Hours
• Meal Vouchers
• Health Care Benefits

title: International Business Analyst - Retail
description:
Do you have a passion for analysis, reporting and providing insights? This Business Analyst role in our International HQ could be for you!

The International Business Analyst will play an integral role in the International Retail Key Account team by creating, maintaining, and analyzing centralized KPI reports. The International Business Analyst will be responsible for the coordination and communication of the International Retail Key Account performance internally and externally. Also, will be the key user of data platforms relating to sales and budgeting. As a third pillar, the Business Analyst will drive best practice sharing to the wider Sales Off Premise community via our intranet.

title: Business Analyst Counterparty Data Hub Servicing
description:
Position: Business Analyst for Counterparty Data Hub Servicing (all genders)

Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. #believeinyourself

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.

We in Daily Banking Services want to provide to our clients the best digital experience, which is seamless, convenient, fast and compliant. We aim to digitalize and automatize all our back-office processes to the core, regardless of channels. Customer Data Hub is one of our key systems to provide business support to all Erste Group Banks and meet regulatory requirements. We are currently seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our team.

In this role, you... will be responsible for analyzing business processes and identifying opportunities for improvement.

You will work closely with other members of the Servicing team to implement changes and enhance efficiency in banking operations.
• ​​​​​​You will have a crucial role in designing, documenting, and continuously improving our processes end to end and front to back
• Work closely with stakeholders, end users, product- and other process owners to define desired outcome of each process improvements or digitalization
• Responsible to achieve defined targets (KPIs) for process improvements and digitalization
• Responsible to manage the success and efficiency of processing Units
• Actively collect customer feedback to drive the re-design and enhancement of end-to-end processes
• Identify data quality issues and work with the appropriate teams to resolve them
• Act as competency for complex inquiries towards our stakeholders from stakeholders, business and service providers
• ​​​​​​At least five years background in the banking industry, in process improvement or operations, with strong focus on corporate customers
• Exceptional knowledge and understanding of corporate customer needs, risk and compliance
• Customer-oriented and excellent communication skills; making it easy for you to interact with people in an intercultural and diverse environment
• You're self-accountable and solution-oriented, with a hands-on mindset, a positive, entrepreneurial, and agile spirit, and the willingness to accept challenges
• Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau preferred
• If you're fluent in English and German and want to be part of a dynamic and passionate team that's dedicated to improving the customer experience, we encourage you to apply now. Let's make a difference together
• We are a team who lives and breathes innovation and digital transformation and likes to push boundaries to the next level.
• We are open minded, supportive and always ready to go the extra mile for our customers
• We take care of your personal wellbeing, career development, and we actively support your educational needs
• Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group
• The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 44.567,

-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
• We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.
• Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin

We aim to digitalize and automatize all our back-office processes to the core, regardless of channels. Customer Data Hub is one of our key systems to provide business support to all Erste Group Banks and meet regulatory requirements. We are currently seeking a talented and experienced Business Analyst to join our team.

In this role, you... will be responsible for analyzing business processes and identifying opportunities for improvement.

You will work closely with other members of the Servicing team to implement changes and enhance efficiency in banking operations.
• ​​​​​​You will have a crucial role in designing, documenting, and continuously improving our processes end to end and front to back
• Work closely with stakeholders, end users, product- and other process owners to define desired outcome of each process improvements or digitalization
• Responsible to achieve defined targets (KPIs) for process improvements and digitalization
• Responsible to manage the success and efficiency of processing Units
• Actively collect customer feedback to drive the re-design and enhancement of end-to-end processes
• Identify data quality issues and work with the appropriate teams to resolve them
• Act as competency for complex inquiries towards our stakeholders from stakeholders, business and service providers
• ​​​​​​At least five years background in the banking industry, in process improvement or operations, with strong focus on corporate customers
• Exceptional knowledge and understanding of corporate customer needs, risk and compliance
• Customer-oriented and excellent communication skills; making it easy for you to interact with people in an intercultural and diverse environment
• You're self-accountable and solution-oriented, with a hands-on mindset, a positive, entrepreneurial, and agile spirit, and the willingness to accept challenges
• Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau preferred
• If you're fluent in English and German and want to be part of a dynamic and passionate team that's dedicated to improving the customer experience, we encourage you to apply now. Let's make a difference together
• We are a team who lives and breathes innovation and digital transformation and likes to push boundaries to the next level.
• We are open minded, supportive and always ready to go the extra mile for our customers
• We take care of your personal wellbeing, career development, and we actively support your educational needs
• Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group
• The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 44.567,

-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
• We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office.
• Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin"]}]

title: Business Analyst Project
description:
Your role in the team
• As a business analyst, you and the project manager will handle project planning, management and control in order to successfully implement our software solutions
• You are responsible for requirements engineering: This includes the ACTUAL process analysis, the creation of reusable TARGET concepts, process descriptions and BPMNs
• You specify the gaps for development and prioritize their development with development
• You configure our software solutions for our customers
• Test management and documentation are part of your job
• Numerous development perspectives, such as IT project manager

Technologies and skills
• Oracle
• Java
• PL/SQL
• Oracle Database
• SQL

Our expectations:

Qualifications
• Good knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, SQL and relational databases
• Knowledge of Oracle DB and Oracle PL/SQL is an advantage
• Analytical way of thinking and working
• Enjoy working in a team and with customers
• Very good knowledge of German and... English (spoken and written), other languages are an advantage

Experience
• Education

title: Senior Business Analyst (m/w/d)
description:
Company Description

Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Deaf of Hard of Hearing Black, Hispanic, Asian, Military Veterans, the Elderly, the LGBTQ, and Justice Impacted individuals. If you identify with any of the following communities do not hesitate to register.

Company Name: FIS Global

Job Description

Position Type :
Full time

Type Of Hire :
Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)

Education Desired :
Bachelor of Computer Science

Travel Percentage :
5 - 10%

The world of finance moves fast. At FIS, we’re faster. Our teams are empowered to learn, grow, and make an impact–in their careers and communities. We deliver innovation that advances the way the world pays, banks and invests. If you want to grow personally and professionally, we’d like to know: Are you... FIS?

We are currently looking for a Senior Business Analyst (m/w/d) to support the FIS Banking team in Germany. Ideally located in Munich or Graz (Austria).

About the team

The Design and Architecture Team sits within the Client Delivery organisation and is responsible for architecting and designing technical solutions. The Team is involved in a wide range of activities that include solutioning Client customisations and enhancements, Client implementations, system-specific projects that may involve development or enhancement of internal applications, technology integration and/or infrastructure environment build-out. Another important aspect of the Team’s work is supporting pre-sales initiatives providing input to prospect RFI and RFPs.

What you will be doing
• Use expertise in specific business processes to provide technical guidance to Clients and FIS teams concerning business implications of applications of various systems.
• Work on technology business consulting activities to meet specific Client requirements.
• Serve as liaison between end-users and consultants during consulting projects.
• Create detailed specifications from which programs will be written.
• Support QA teams in writing test plans and test cases to ensure enhancements made to applications meet client needs and application integrity is maintained.
• Support testing such as system, integration, readiness and acceptance tests, ensuring client needs will be met.
• Work at client sites from time to time requiring some travel.

What you bring:
• Previous experience working in a Business Consultant role at a senior level.
• Detailed knowledge of some or all of the following products in the German market: loans, savings and/or payments.
• Experience working in a technology or financial services organization and preferably have worked in a vendor/client capacity.
• Fluent command of English and German

What we offer you:

At FIS, you can learn, grow and make an impact in your career. Our benefits include:
• A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility
• The chance to work on challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
• Varied and challenging work to help you grow your technical and functional skillset
• A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated team

#LI-PL1

Privacy Statement

FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

#pridepass

title: Business Analyst als Freelancer (w/m/d)
description:
Hi, wir sind Active Solution! Als erfolgreiche Spezialisten in den Bereichen IT und Engineering entwickeln wir hochwertige Lösungen für Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Branchen in Österreich. Unser schlagkräftiges Team aus über 200 Consultern arbeitet vor Ort und remote, mit den neuesten Technologien, in freundschaftlicher Atmosphäre, mit flexiblen Strukturen und flachen Hierarchien. Wenn Du auf der Suche nach einem langfristigen Projekt bist - dann Get active!

Aufgaben
• Du analysierst die Anforderungen und die Geschäftsprozesse
• Du bist für die Ausarbeitung und Organisation von Fachkonzepten und Lösungsszenarien verantwortlich
• Du hast Freude daran neue Lösungsdesigns zu erstellen
• Du begleitest die Umsetzung von der Anforderung bis zur Abnahme

Profil
• Du bringst bereits Berufserfahrung als Business Analyst bzw. Requirements Engineer mit
• Du verfügst über eine analytische, lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
• Du bist kommnikativ und teamfähig und hast Spaß an der agilen... Arbeitsweise
• Du bringst ausgezeichnete Deutschkenntnisse in Wort & Schrift mit

Wir bieten
• Langfristiges Projekt in Wien
• Auslastung 100% mit Remote-Anteil von 50%
• Wirtschaftliche Sicherheit (pünktliche Zahlungsziele, Top-Bonität)
• Stabilität durch langjährigen Rahmenvertrag / öffentliche Hand

Du suchst ein langfristiges Projekt? Dann schick uns bitte Dein Profil/CV mit Angabe Deines Stundesatzes und Deiner Verfügbarkeit.

Die Mission ist das Ziel! Get Active-What Else
