title: Wirtschaftsinformatiker/in it-anforderungsmanager/in
description:
Digitalisierung, IT-Projektmanagement, IT-Architektur, IT, SAP S/4 HANA, SAP Business Analyst (m/f/d) View job here Business analyst
• (m/f/i) - full-time, permanent Full-time ProPotsdam, Pappelallee 4, 14469 Potsdam, Germany With professional experience 27.06.23 ProPotsdam GmbH is the largest housing company in the state capital Potsdam and a leading service provider in the areas of urban redevelopment, urban development, housing construction and housing welfare.
With a portfolio of over 17,800 rental apartments, it is also the largest housing provider in the Potsdam housing market.
Are you interested in helping our company drive the digitalization of our business processes and do you always like to solve new problems? You will fit in with us if you have both a technical affinity but also an eye for technical and business optimization potential and would like to implement new digitization requirements together with the specialist departments and the IT team.
Don't miss this... opportunity to apply your skills and passion in an exciting environment.
Awaiting you is a proactive team with strong communication skills that you can rely on, as well as a modern S/4 HANA landscape with apps and portals and Microsoft M365 environment.
ProPotsdam GmbH is looking for a
• n as soon as possible.
Business Analyst
• (m/f/i) - full-time, permanent Your tasks:
Receive, review and evaluate new requirements, taking into account implementation time, costs, ongoing projects, existing standards and IT architecture, as well as IT security and compliance requirements.
Review solution approaches and design solution scope to outline possible IT solutions with it.
Manage and control the central requirements management as a link between business department and IT team and IT project management.
Prepare a project outline that outlines the business and IT framework, includes a price and capacity estimate, makes cost-benefit considerations and takes into account the estimated support needs and ongoing support.
Create concepts and guidelines for the implementation of IT solutions, as well as perform process modeling in collaboration with stakeholders.
Handover to the project management and participation in the implementation.
Determine the plan values for IT requirements from the company to the annual economic planning and responsibility of these budgets according to the agreed implementation goals.
Other comparable tasks as well as special tasks as specified by the supervisor.
Job Requirements:
Completed studies in business informatics or comparable studies.
Expertise in the analysis and evaluation of business requirements from the areas of construction and project controlling and ordering processes (knowledge of SAP modules PS, PM, MM).
Experience in requirements/demand management and consulting and evaluation of new digitization projects.
Strong understanding of business processes and a clear focus on the needs of the business, combined with in-depth IT knowledge and methodological expertise Understanding of technology and flexibility in familiarizing with new systems, applications, structures and processes.
Strong communication skills, ability to work in a team as well as a high analytical, structured and solution-oriented way of working We offer, among other things:
We give you the working environment so that you can shape life in Potsdam with their commitment and projects:
With flexible working hours and the option of mobile working.
with a structured onboarding process and regular feedback meetings, we ensure a successful integration into our company with a long-term investment in our employees
• innen - for this reason we promote the personal and professional development of our employees
• innen with an attractive workplace in a municipal company established for over 30 years in Potsdam.
You can get an overview of our benefits here:
MA-Benefits-Booklet_RZ_Web.pdf (propotsdam.de) What you can expect from us! In the ProPotsdam group of companies, you can expect many interesting and varied tasks as well as a large, friendly team in a modern and family-friendly working environment.
ProPotsdam is one of the best employers in the capital region Berlin-Brandenburg and has been awarded in the competition Great Place to Work® "Best Employers in Berlin-Brandenburg 2022".
You too can become part of the ProPotsdam team! We look forward to tackling and implementing the most diverse tasks for our state capital Potsdam together with you.
Have we piqued your interest? Then apply online now via the application button.
To do this, please upload your complete application documents.
Applications will only be accepted via the application form.
Contact:
Cassie Opitz (0331-6206 229).
Imprint | Privacy Policy Powered by softgarden

title: Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management
description:
Business Analyst (m/f/d) Spare Parts Management

BRP-Rotax gets the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure
• Analysis of spare parts requirements based on historical consumption data
• Introduction of a tool for forecasting spare parts requirements
• Continuous development of the planning model to optimize availability and inventory value
• Data analysis and development of a value-based spare parts pricing strategy
• Close coordination of the spare parts strategy with the operational business units
• Development and tracking of key performance indicators to optimize the spare parts business

Your experiences and skills
• Degree (FH, University) in the field of Supply Chain Management, Data Engineering, Industrial Engineering or equivalent
• Alternatively, higher technical degree (HTL) with at least... 3 years of professional experience, ideally in the area of spare parts sales/logistics
• Excellent IT skills (SAP, MS-Office with focus on Excel, PowerBI)
• Very good knowledge of big data analysis and interest in the topics of value chain planning, processes, inventory management and digitalization
• Good German and very good English skills, both written and spoken
• High level of social skills and initiative, systematic and goal-oriented way of working with high quality awareness

What we offer

You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is EUR 46,346.72 gross/year according to the very attractive collective agreement of the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience

• Alternatively, higher technical degree (HTL) with at least... 3 years of professional experience, ideally in the area of spare parts sales/logistics
• Excellent IT skills (SAP, MS-Office with focus on Excel, PowerBI)
• Very good knowledge of big data analysis and interest in the topics of value chain planning, processes, inventory management and digitalization
• Good German and very good English skills, both written and spoken
• High level of social skills and initiative, systematic and goal-oriented way of working with high quality awareness

What we offer

You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is EUR 46,346.72 gross/year according to the very attractive collective agreement of the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience"]}]

title: IT Requirements Engineer / Business Analyst (m/w/x)
description:
Standort: Wien | Anstellung: Vollzeit | ab sofort

BearingPoint ist eine der führenden internationalen Management- und Technologieberatungen, die Beratungs Know How und IT Kompetenz auf einzigartige Weise vereint. Mit weltweit 4.300 Mitarbeiter:innen entwickeln wir digitale Strategien und Geschäftsmodelle, optimieren Prozesse und konzipieren IT-Architekturen für führende Unternehmen aller Branchen und Organisationen der öffentlichen Hand. Wir verstehen uns als wichtiger Partner unserer Kund:innen und begleiten diese nachhaltig auf ihrem erfolgreichen Weg ins digitale Zeitalter. In Österreich sind wir mit 350 Mitarbeiter:innen an den Standorten Wien und Graz vertreten.

Wir suchen laufend die besten Köpfe für unsere spannenden nationalen und internationalen Projekte.

Deine Aufgaben:
• Neue Geschäftsideen designen und konzipieren
• Lösungen sowohl klassisch als auch mit agilen Methoden herbeiführen und technisch als auch fachlich abstimmen
• Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Kund:innen... Lieferant:innen und verschiedenen Business-Units
• Unterstützung von Entwicklungsteams bei der Lösungsumsetzung
• Erarbeitung von maßgeschneiderten Delivery Model Konzepten im Umfeld von agilem Requirements Engineering für unsere Kund:innen
• Bereichsübergreifender Know-how Transfer zwischen den jeweiligen Delivery Units
• Arbeiten mit Epics, User Stories und Use Cases gehören zum Daily Business
• Mitwirkung in der strategischen Entwicklung der Domain Agile Requirements Engineering im Unternehmen

Damit punktest Du bei uns:
• Abgeschlossenes technisches Studium und/oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrung/Qualifikationen, vorzugsweise im agilen Projektumfeld
• Agile Methodologien sind kein Fremdwort
• Breites Verständnis und Wissen über aktuelle IT Technologien und Trends
• Analytisches Denkvermögen, schnelle Auffassungsgabe und hohe Problemlösungskompetenz
• Ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit
• Wille zum selbstständigen Arbeiten mit hoher Eigenverantwortung
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
• Reisebereitschaft

Damit punkten wir bei Dir:
• Berufliche Vielfalt, hohe Eigenverantwortung und gelebtes Miteinander
• Individuelle und aktive Karriereförderung unterstützt durch umfassende Trainingsprogramme
• Inspirierende Projekte an der Schnittstelle Consulting und IT in unterschiedlichen Branchen weltweit
• Laptop für den beruflichen und privaten Gebrauch, Essensgutscheine (Sodexo) und Zuschuss zum Jobticket
• Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung und zahlreiche zusätzliche Benefits

Du hast bei uns die Möglichkeit, basierend auf Deiner individuellen Leistung aktiv dein Gehalt zu beeinflussen. Dieses startet laut Kollektivvertrag bei EUR 3.455,- brutto pro Monat. Gerne sind wir bereit je nach Qualifikation und Erfahrung ein höheres Gehalt anzubieten.

Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt? Hier bekommst du schon einen kurzen Einblick, was dich bei uns im Wiener Office erwartet. Weitere Informationen findest du unter Fachbereich für Technologie.

Let’s grab lunch! Registriere dich für einen informellen Austausch mit unseren MitarbeiterInnen über CareerLunch.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung online oder per Mail.

www.bearingpoint.com

Bei Fragen steht dir unser Recruiter Florian Lenz gerne zur Verfügung: +43 1 50632 5117 oder people@bearingpoint.com

BearingPoint, Wiedner Gürtel 13/ Turm 24, 1100 Wien

title: ERP Finance Business Analyst - Oracle JDE
description: ERP Finance Business Analyst - JD Edwards An International company is implementing Oracle JDE to their International entities. They are looking for an experienced JDE Finance Business Analyst or Functional Consultant to deliver Finance Business Analysis and Gap-Fit the Template solution to existing Finance and Accounting Processes. Support the deployment of the solution across the global business * Business Analysis, Process Mapping, Gap-Fit for Financials, GL, AP, AR and Accounting * Requirements gathering for Finance / Accounting /Controlling processes * Gap-fit analysis between existing Finance solution and JDE Template * Support JD Edwards Finance System localisations and changes based on local requirements * Support end-to-end solution design and rollout: System Testing, UAT and Training for end-users across business functions * Change management Your profile * ERP Functional Consultant or Finance Business Analyst with Oracle JDE knowledge * Strong Functional knowledge of Finance... processes; Accounting / Controlling: GL, AP, AR, Record-to-Report (R2R) * Finance Business Analysis and Gap-Fit for JD Edwards Finance * Experience delivering End User Testing, Training and Change for ERP implemenatations * Fluent German Type: Freelance Consultant / Contractor Duration: 6-12 months initially Location: Remote, Europe, with occasional travel in DACH regions Apply online, via LinkedIn or email your CV to Jamie@systemsaccountants.com SystemsAccountants is a specialist Headhunter in the area of ERP, EPM and Business Intelligence across Business Sectors. Follow #systemsaccountants on Linkedin! For more information on this and related ERP and Digital Finance career opportunities, or to understand how we can support you, please contact Jamie Colwell at SystemsAccountants: jamie@systemsaccountants.com

title: Business Analyst in Sach- und Rechtsschutz (m/w/d)
description:
Unser Kunde ist eine führende Versicherungsgruppe in Österreich mit starker Präsenz in den zentral- und osteuropäischen Märkten. Die Nähe zum Kunden und die Ausrichtung des Konzerns auf dessen Service-Anforderungen bilden die Basis für einen nachhaltigen Geschäftserfolg, der durch Innovation und Exzellenz erzielt wird. Um den Erfolgskurs des Unternehmens weiter auszubauen, suchen wir ab sofort engagierte und motivierte Verstärkung für das Team am Standort Wien.

Aufgaben
• Zusammen mit deinen Kolleginnen und Kollegen verantwortest du die Weiterentwicklung der Produkte im Bereich der Sach- und Rechtschutzversicherung
• Du erhebst, konzipierst und analysierst Anforderungen für die Neu- und Weiterentwicklung der Produkte und Softwareentwicklungsprozesse und begleitest die Umsetzung
• Gemeinsam mit dem Entwicklungsteam und dem Fachbereich definierst du die Implementierung und Durchführung der wiederkehrenden Indexläufe
• Qualitätssicherung, entwicklungsbegleitende Tests unter Anwendung... von Werkzeugen zur Testautomatisierung sowie die Erzeugung notwendiger Dokumentationen gehören auch zu deinem Aufgabenbereich
• Du beantwortest eigenständig Anfragen zur Berechnungslogik und möglichen Fehlern in den Tarifrechnern und wirkst aktiv bei UIP und UCP Change Projekten mit
• Du bist nicht nur Kommunikationsschnittstelle innerhalb deines Teams, sondern auch zu der Fachabteilungen IT / Operations

Profil
• Fundierte Kenntnisse der Sachversicherung, im Besonderen der Rechtsschutzversicherung
• Erfahrung in der Einführung von Standardsystemen von Vorteil
• Ausgeprägte IT-Affinität
• Analytisches und betriebsorganisatorisches Denken, Eigeninitiative und Lernbereitschaft
• Teamfähigkeit und Kommunikationsstärke, Termintreue
• Umsetzungsstärke und Hands-on Mentalität, hohe Eigenmotivation und Fähigkeit zur Selbststeuerung
• Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse, Englischkenntnisse sind wünschenswert - sowohl in Wort als auch Schrift

Wir bieten
• Ein wertschätzendes, modernes Arbeitsumfeld mit flexibler Arbeitszeit durch Gleitzeitvereinbarungen und Möglichkeit zu Homeoffice
• Ein abwechslungsreiches und spannendes Aufgabengebiet in einem dynamischen Team
• Zahlreiche weitere Benefits (zb. Essenszuschuss, Mitarbeiterrabatte)

Du übernimmst gerne Verantwortung, bist es gewohnt cross-funktional in Teams zu arbeiten und auf der Suche nach einem sicheren, langfristigen Job in einem dynamischen Umfeld? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Für diese spannende Aufgabe bietet Dir unser Kunde ein Jahresbruttogehalt ab EUR 42.000,- abhängig von Qualifikation und Erfahrung

title: Business Analyst / Requirements Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Ihre Aufgaben
• Sie bearbeiten Änderungs- und Erweiterungsanforderungen aus den Fachbereichen und arbeiten an den übergreifenden Abstimmungen dieser Weiterentwicklungen mit
• Sie übernehmen die lokale Steuerung der Weiterentwicklungen sowie die Abstimmung mit dem Headquarter inklusive Testing und Rollout der neuen Versionen
• Sie sind für die Koordination, Kommunikation und Verfolgung der Projektfortschritte unter der Nutzung von Konzern-Projektmanagementmethoden verantwortlich
• Sie unterstützen und betreuen die fachlichen Key User inklusive funktionalem 2nd Level Support
• Sie nehmen applikative Fehler (Bugs, funktionale Incidents) auf, analysieren und lösen diese bzw. geben diese an das zentrale IT-Kompetenzteam weiter
• Sie übernehmen die Nachverfolgung bei der Fehlerbearbeitung sowie die Unterstützung bei den Validierungen durch die Anwender/Key User
• Das Monitoring der Zusammenarbeit mit externen Providern auf lokaler Basis gehört ebenfalls zu Ihren Aufgaben
• Sie agieren als... verlängerter Arm des deutschen Infrastruktur-Teams
• Sie bearbeiten alle lokalen Belange in den Bereichen Desktopmanagement, 1st Level Support, Netzwerksupport

Weitere Details abseits der Stellenbeschreibung sowie Informationen zum Unternehmen erhalten Sie gerne im Gespräch.

Ihre Vorteile
• Sie erwartet eine spannende Tätigkeit in einem Unternehmen, in dem der Teamgedanke gelebt wird, eingebettet in ein internationales Umfeld
• Es gibt vielfältige Weiterbildungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten
• Die wöchentliche Arbeitszeit beträgt 38,5 Stunden
• Die Arbeitszeiten sind flexibel
• Es gibt Home-Office-Möglichkeiten (bis zu 90%)
• Es gibt Benefits wie z.B. eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge und ein Gesundheitsprogramm

Ihr Profil
• Sie haben beispielsweise eine Ausbildung als ausgebildete/r Bankkauffrau / Bankkaufmann mit hoher Technikaffinität oder ein Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik abgeschlossen
• Sie verfügen über gutes Verständnis von Bankenprozessen sowie deren Transformation in IT-Anforderungen
• Mehrjährige praktische Erfahrung bei der Umsetzung von IT-Projekten und Erfahrung im agilem Umfeld sind wünschenswert
• Sie bringen ein Grundverständnis klassischer Office- and Server-Infrastrukturen mit
• Sie kennen sich gut in MS Office, SharePoint etc. aus
• Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Datenbanken/SQL sowie Salesforce sind wünschenswert
• Sie verfügen über Organisationsfähigkeit, Flexibilität und die Fähigkeit zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten
• Sie besitzen die Fähigkeit zur schnellen Adaption neuer Tools und Technologien sowie zur klaren Darstellung und Umsetzung dieser Änderungen
• Sie bringen Analyse- und Entscheidungsfähigkeit
• Sie haben eine Hands-on-Mentalität, starke Kommunikationsfähigkeit (national und international) und sind ein Team Player
• Kundenorientierung, Gewissenhaftigkeit, Belastbarkeit zeichnen Sie aus
• Sie verfügen über sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

TechMinds GmbH

TechMinds ist eine HR Beratung mit Schwerpunkt auf Tech & IT.

Ihr Vorteil: Durch uns landen Ihre Unterlagen direkt beim Entscheider. Zudem profitieren Sie von einer kostenlosen Beratung zu allen Karrierefragen. Und Sie erhalten schon früh einen authentischen Einblick in den Arbeitsalltag beim potentiellen Arbeitgeber.

Ihre Bewerbung

Bitte senden Sie uns Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen über den folgenden Bewerbungsbutton oder per Email an bewerbung@techminds.de.

Eine Präsentation Ihrer Unterlagen bei unserem Auftraggeber erfolgt erst nach einem gemeinsamen Gespräch mit Ihnen.

Weitere Infos zum Vermittlungsprozess finden Sie unter Karriere Service

• Sie verfügen über gutes Verständnis von Bankenprozessen sowie deren Transformation in IT-Anforderungen
• Mehrjährige praktische Erfahrung bei der Umsetzung von IT-Projekten und Erfahrung im agilem Umfeld sind wünschenswert
• Sie bringen ein Grundverständnis klassischer Office- and Server-Infrastrukturen mit
• Sie kennen sich gut in MS Office, SharePoint etc. aus
• Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Datenbanken/SQL sowie Salesforce sind wünschenswert
• Sie verfügen über Organisationsfähigkeit, Flexibilität und die Fähigkeit zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten
• Sie besitzen die Fähigkeit zur schnellen Adaption neuer Tools und Technologien sowie zur klaren Darstellung und Umsetzung dieser Änderungen
• Sie bringen Analyse- und Entscheidungsfähigkeit
• Sie haben eine Hands-on-Mentalität, starke Kommunikationsfähigkeit (national und international) und sind ein Team Player
• Kundenorientierung, Gewissenhaftigkeit, Belastbarkeit zeichnen Sie aus
• Sie verfügen über sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

TechMinds GmbH

TechMinds ist eine HR Beratung mit Schwerpunkt auf Tech & IT.

Ihr Vorteil: Durch uns landen Ihre Unterlagen direkt beim Entscheider. Zudem profitieren Sie von einer kostenlosen Beratung zu allen Karrierefragen. Und Sie erhalten schon früh einen authentischen Einblick in den Arbeitsalltag beim potentiellen Arbeitgeber.

Ihre Bewerbung

Bitte senden Sie uns Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen über den folgenden Bewerbungsbutton oder per Email an bewerbung@techminds.de.

Eine Präsentation Ihrer Unterlagen bei unserem Auftraggeber erfolgt erst nach einem gemeinsamen Gespräch mit Ihnen.

Weitere Infos zum Vermittlungsprozess finden Sie unter Karriere Service

• Sie sind für die Koordination, Kommunikation und Verfolgung der Projektfortschritte unter der Nutzung von Konzern-Projektmanagementmethoden verantwortlich
• Sie unterstützen und betreuen die fachlichen Key User inklusive funktionalem 2nd Level Support

title: Business Analyst (m/w/d)
description:
METRO ist ein internationaler Lebensmittelgroßhändler mit einem vielfältigen Food- und Non-Food Sortiment, der bereits seit 50 Jahren in Österreich vertreten ist. Wir arbeiten weltweit für den Erfolg von unabhängigen Unternehmen. Wir arbeiten für über 500.000 Selbstständige österreichweit. Wir arbeiten für Umsetzer, Visionäre, Mutige, Abenteurer, jene die an sich glauben und ihre Träume verwirklichen. Wir arbeiten für unsere Kunden!

Zur Verstärkung unseres Business Intelligence Teams im Head Office in Vösendorf suchen wir einen

Business Analyst (m/w/d)
Vollzeit 38,5 Wochenstunden, ab sofort

Aufgaben

Ihre Aufgaben:
• Sie ergänzen unser BI Team und arbeiten aktiv an allen Analysen mit
• Sie sind verantwortlich für die Aufbereitung und den Versand regulärer Reportings
• Sie unterstützen operativ bei diversen Projekten
• Sie sind für ad hoc Analysen verantwortlich und unterstützen bei der Aufbereitung von Powerpoint-Präsentationen für den Einkauf sowie die Geschäftsführung
• Sie... analysieren Anwenderanforderungen zur Erstellung von Reports für unser Team
• Sie entwickeln und implementieren innovative Dashboards in unserem Reporting Tool

Profil

Ihre Qualifikationen:
• Sie haben eine abgeschlossene kaufmännische oder technische Ausbildung (z.B. Universität, FH, HTL, HAK)
• Sie haben Berufserfahrung in Analyse- oder Controlling Abteilungen
• Zahlenaffinität sowie analytisches Denkvermögen
• Sie verfügen über starke Excel-Kenntnisse und idealerweise haben Sie bereits mit Analysesoftware (wie z.B. MicroStrategy) gearbeitet
• Sie bringen gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse mit, um innerhalb des Konzerns zu kommunizieren
• Sie sind ein Teamplayer, arbeiten in Ihrem Aufgabengebiet aber selbstständig
• Sie arbeiten sich rasch in neue Themenstellungen und komplexe Aufgaben ein und bewahren auch in stressigen Situationen den Überblick

Wir bieten

Was wir bieten:
• Die Vorteile eines Großunternehmens mit ansprechenden Sozialleistungen wie Mitarbeiterrabatte, gratis Parkplatz und Vergünstigungen in unserem Betriebsrestaurant
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten im Rahmen unseres Gleitzeitmodells sowie Home Office Möglichkeit
• Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten bei METRO

Ihr Gehaltspaket:

Es ist uns wichtig, dass sich Ihr Gehalt an Ihren Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen orientiert. Gerne klären wir das gemeinsam im persönlichen Gespräch. Der guten Ordnung halber geben wir an, dass für diese Position ein Mindestgehalt von EUR 40.000,- brutto pro Jahr auf Vollzeitbasis gilt.

Haben wir Ihr Interesse an dieser Stelle geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung.
Ihr Kontakt bei Fragen: Frau Lucia Reiter

title: Test Analyst for George (all genders)
description:
﻿ Test Analyst for George (all genders)
Vienna, Wien, Austria

Banking has a name. And we create it.

For more than 9 million customers across Europe, George stands for a digital banking experience that combines design and technology on an open platform. At the George Labs, we strive for everyone. We achieve this by empowering people to understand, manage and, last but not least, enjoy one of their most personal things: their money.

Join us in our agile environment and make banking simple, intelligent and personal again!

We understand your pain. QA Engineers and Testers do not get the respect they deserve! But with us, your technical knowledge and testing abilities are as much valued as the cool designs that comes out of the creative team. You will work closely with our developers along the full user story, working together on the same code towards the same goal of providing market-ready software at the end of each Sprint. You will create well-structured and well-considered test... cases, executing automation scripts using open source tools, all while keeping the nasty bugs away.
What you’ll bring with you
• A toolkit full of software development and QA experience
• Experience with analyzing application logs
• Experience with checking databases for the correct state
• Patience for problem-solving and thinking out of the box
• Curiosity about object-oriented programming (Kotlin or Java preferred)
• The ability to write clean and readable code with documentation
• Experience with backend testing (both manual and automated)
• Deep insight of software QA methodologies
• A natural confidence with your communication skills, while being fluent in English
• Living the agile mindset, testing in a scrum team while collaborating with developers and business analysts.

You will impress us by
• Being able to independently solve problems and make decisions about testing results
• Feeling comfortable with talking to stakeholders and different business teams
• Confidently wearing T-shirts with the slogan ‘TDD & BDD are not diseases!’
• Being proactive and self-motivated without the ego to go with it
• Having the ability to see the big picture and have a strong quality awareness
• Knowing that variety, changing trends, and constantly upgrading your skills is better than any alternative

Why you will like us
• We’re a team of experienced testers who love to exchange ideas and push the boundaries
• We provide everything you need to work (e.g., MacBook Pro, mobile device, licenses) and lots of additional benefits
• We are open minded, and always keen to stand up and go the extra mile for the correct solution
• New Work is not just another buzz word to us. We proactively adapt to the ever-changing work environment of today
• We guarantee a competitive and performance-related salary, dependent on your professional and personal qualifications. We are obliged by law to quote the minimum wage of EUR 48.370,-- gross per year for this position, in accordance with the respective collective agreement.

If you’ve got this far It seems we have your interest. If you think you are a good fit for this position, please get in touch with us, we’d love to catch up.

Apply for this Job

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Business Process Analysis and Improvement specialist to strengthen our Process Excellence team at the global Red Bull headquarters in Salzburg, Austria.

In this position, you'll support the business as process analysis expert to drive process optimization utilizing process data analyses based on state-of-the-art process mining technologies. You'll collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand the business requirements, combine data from different source systems, define data requirements, analyze information and identify and drive process improvements. You'll act as a coach for the business regarding improvement of the business processes.

You'll collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand the business requirements, combine data from different source systems, define data requirements, analyze information and identify and drive process improvements. You'll act as a coach for the business regarding improvement of the business processes."]}]

title: Technical Analyst (all genders)
description:
﻿

Make a difference in the financial life of millions of people: At Erste Digital you are co-creating the digital future, in which better financial health is possible. #believeinyourself
Technical Analyst (all genders)

Location:
Vienna

Working-Hours:
Full-time

Occupation Area:
IT

Company:
Erste Digital

The future of banking is digital, and IT is the key to this change. Erste Digital is the digital enabler that drives innovative IT solutions for Erste Group, the leading banking group in CEE. Our service involves “run the bank” as well as “change the bank” activities. Our more than 2,000 IT experts and enthusiasts deliver best-in-class IT solutions and services to all Erste Group entities and by this directly to Erste Group’s more than 16 million customers. Are you ready to work for one of the most innovative and largest IT companies in the CEE region? Then hit the “apply now” button.

Now is an amazing opportunity to join Erste Digital in its mission to transform the banking... services in Austria and eastern European countries. We count over 6 million customers in Austria and over hundreds of Bank Products. We strive for building a digital bank that requires robust, fast, and stable processing systems in the background. We are looking for someone who is smart, savvy, and seriously good at translating business requirements into technical concepts e.g. by designing great REST APIs and business workflows. You are organized, a natural communicator, and can bring people together to create shared understanding. Consistency and clarity are important for you and you strive to always get better in it.
In this role, you will:
• support the team in the analysis of technical requirements in cooperation with business partners.
• define technical software requirement specifications and review functional designs regarding solution architecture, future business needs and operations.
• create a common understanding of business requirements, design solutions that follow our best practices, with always keeping a clear end-customer focus in mind
• work in a great team and with a diverse group of people such as other software engineers, data analysts, and decision-makers (e. g. product owners), to build solutions and gain novel insights.
• work with tools like Jira for ticket management and actively contribute to Scrum or Kanban meetings and retrospectives.

What should you bring with you:
• strong analytical thinking and a technical background, ideally with a completed technical degree.
• experience in requirements engineering and with state-of-the-art technologies (Microservices, PaaS, SOA, APIs, …) and agile software delivery methods.
• proven track-record working in the IT or similar area.
• good communication skills in English and/or German (verbal and written).

Our Offer
• Possibility to benefit and learn from our international, talented and passionate community at Erste
• Great learning curve through ownership and creative freedom
• Interest groups and clubs: Take part in discussions and get involved in projects. Numerous interest groups invite you to engage with a topic
• Good food: Healthy nutrition and good food are important for our quality of life. With seven restaurants and cafeterias, there’s something to suit every taste on the Erste Campus
• Health Centre – The Erste Campus operates a fully equipped health center that offers all employees a high standard of medical services during working hours
• New way of work: With our flexible working hours model we want to make your life less complicated. Combing the best of both worlds, remote and company time
• Employee benefits – Benefit from special conditions for financial services and insurances, supermarkets, clothing stores and many more
• Employee Referral Program – Become a talent scout for career opportunities in IT. We are rewarding every successful referral for Erste Digital
• Language courses for German & English – Learning a new language unites. We support you with appropriate language courses where you participate together with your colleagues
• Work-Life-Balance – Home office, paternity leave, sabbatical, sports courses -– we support you in balancing work, family and leisure time
• The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 48.370,-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person!
• Erste Digital considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin

Apply online

Follow us

title: Group Business Treasury Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
What if energy supply could be sustainable, affordable, and reliable at the same time? With its powerful Jenbacher and Waukesha gas engines, INNIO brings energy solutions for today—and tomorrow, in more than 100 countries, improving the quality of life for countless people. Do you want to make a difference with your work? For our Finance & Treasury Department we're searching for a Group Business Treasury Analyst (m/f/d). Join our team now!

At INNIO we offer you:
• An innovative and international working environment
• Flexible working time model (depending on position and role)
• Health We Care Program – including company sport activities
• Moving cost support for new employees in accordance with policy
• Good connections to public transport – station in direct proximity
• Transportation cost support in accordance with policy
• One of the best canteens in the area with healthy and various meals
• Attractive location in the heart of the alps which provides various outdoor sport and... other leisure possibilities
Your Responsibilities:
• Central contact for banks and investors
• Management of external and internal financing
• Group-wide Cash and liquidity management:
• Own and further development of a daily financial status
• Own and further development of a rolling 13-week cash flow forecast
• Execution of the daily disposition
• Observing interest rates / optimizing borrowing and investment
• Support with Administrative tasks (e.g. KYC)
• Independent support of the subsidiaries in all questions of cash and liquidity management
• FX observation and Management
• Treasury Reporting and Controlling
• Maintenance and further development of the Group Treasury Management System from Coupa/Bellin
• Close and independent cooperation with Accounting, Controlling and other relevant departments
• Support with direct reporting to the top management and the owners of the company
• Special projects and ad-hoc analysis in the area of Group Treasury
Your Profile:
• Bachelor or Master degree in Economics, Finance & Controlling with additional work experience or apprenticeship in a bank (e.g. bank specific higher education, bank clerk etc.)
• Proven experience in the areas of Treasury / Controlling / Accounting of an international enterprise
• Ideally first work experience in an international industrial company
• Very good MS-Office Skills, experience with the usual Treasury Management software systems
• Strong teamwork, cooperation capability, flexibility, strong commitment and resilience
• Fluency in English, German beneficial
• A valid work permit for Austria is a prerequisite for this position (Non-EU citizens: please attach the work permit to the application)
At INNIO, we offer a competitive salary package which is far above the requirements of the metal collective agreement in Austria. We highly value your individual qualifications and experience. As part of our recruiting process, we engage in open dialogue with you to discuss the details and ensure the best possible fit

title: Business Analyst
company_name: Penrith District Rugby League Football Club
description:
Penrith District Rugby League Football Club has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to join its energetic team. Built on a foundation of hard work and determination, Panthers strives to serve its community and deliver excellence on and off the field. As the back-to-back NRL premiers, this is a unique opportunity to join one of Australia’s leading sporting clubs.

Within this role you will help facilitate and drive business transformation across our organisation and play a key role in implementing strategic initiatives to improve processes, increase effectiveness with innovative solutions to support future growth.

Your main duties and responsibilities will include:
• Reviewing existing operations, processes and procedures to recommend productivity or cost saving initiatives
• Preparing business cases to support new investment, strategic and other business decisions
• Communicating results and recommendations to management and other stakeholders to improve the... overall business.
• Use process reengineering to improve current systems usage to drive efficiency and suggest system upgrades
• Building dashboards and visualisations for internal reporting across multiple departments.
• Creation of tools to facilitate self-service reporting.
• Administration of club data sets including (but not limited to) membership sales and attendance, partnership campaigns and merchandise sales.
• Collation and cleansing of externally and internally sourced data sets
• Reporting and Analysis of data sets such as survey results, consumer and sales data
• Assist with communication journeys for new data
• Assist with bi-annual corporate partner reviews
• Build merchandise and membership profiles to drive targeted communication
• Ensure club database contacts are active and are receiving communication
• Work with the Leagues Club Senior Business Analysis when needed and be trained as their backup
• Governance analysis

Skills and attributes
• Strong analytical background
• Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to build relationships across multiple teams and management levels
• Solutions orientated team member who can work in a rapidly evolving and dynamic team environment
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple competing priorities
• Ability to multi task
• Attention to detail
• Intermediate/Advanced Excel skills
• Experience in Qlikview, Power BI, Tableau (preferred)
• 3 to 5 years experience
• Business Degree

title: Associate Director, Business Analyst, Dev Centers Solutions
description:
2023 will potentially see Sandoz become a standalone organization! Already a global market leader in Generics and Biosimilar medicine, this is an exciting, once-in-a-career opportunity to set our own path forward as an independent, purpose-driven organization, and as the founders of a new Sandoz, this is a time of immense opportunity for us all, both professionally and personally!

Together we will shape the future of Sandoz… are you ready to make a difference?

Job Summary/Purpose :

As an Associate Director, Business Analyst, Dev Centers Solutions (d/f/m) you will be responsible for project delivery and/or operations in the given business area. It will see you partnering with Business Stakeholders and TT Strategic Business Partners for demand analysis, solution proposal/evaluation and project delivery.

Your Key Responsibilities:

• Execute technology delivery strategy for business systems, platforms, and processes for a particular Business domain / Function.
• Partner with senior... business stakeholders and TT Strategic Business Partners for demand analysis, solution proposal/evaluation, and funding estimates.
• Partner with business partners to ensure Technology Service/Solutions Delivery teams deliver products according to strategy with reuse across other areas. Ensure on time, within budget, compliant, secure, and quality delivery of portfolio for responsible function / service area.
• Ensure services, solutions, platforms, products are fit for purpose and achieve thedesired business value and impact.
• Run efficient DevOps for platforms, products, or systems ensuring availability andoptimal performance for responsible function / service area.
• Establish governance structure for projects, operations, etc with right stakeholder representation.
• Track, report, and deliver against agreed success factors and KPIs for variousstakeholders for responsible function / service area.
• Follow industry trends and emerging practices to drive agility, speed, efficiency, and effectiveness. Ensure the overall user experience is taken into account when designing deploying new solutions and services.

Diversity & Inclusion / EEO

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

What you will bring to the role:
• University degree or various degrees in business, computer science, information technology discipline or equivalent, MBA optional
• 5 years+ of industry experience in IT, healthcare, or pharma; expert understanding of technology and methodologies as applied in the respective area
• Deep knowledge of IT and business processes and experience in validated environments (GxP)
• Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders, manage issues, resolve conflicts, and mitigate risks.
• Networking with key business and IT stakeholders and ability to present to stakeholder groups
• Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills at team and management levels, with the ability to establish and maintain a high level of trust and confidence
• Strong internal and/or external influencing skills to achieve the program objectives
• Analytical, process-oriented with a keen interest to drive continuous improvements

Austria only: Minimum annual gross salary € 66526,88 (on a full-time basis)

#ORBIT

Why Sandoz?
500 million patients were touched by Sandoz generic and biosimilar medicines in 2021 and while we’re proud of this, we know there is more we could do to continue to help pioneer access to medicines for people around the world.
How will we do this? We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.
We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!

Imagine what you could do here at Sandoz!

Join our Sandoz Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Sandoz and our career opportunities, join the Network here

title: International Business Analyst - Convenience
description:
Company Description

The International Business Analyst will play a hands-on role in developing market winning strategies and initiatives to accelerate the Red Bull business.

If you are someone that relentlessly pursues all available sources, data, research, and communication to continually make informed proposals on areas of opportunity for the business this role might be for you!

Job Description

QUANTITATIVE

In this role you will be responsible for establishing knowledge and expertise on all current data sources – IRi/Nielsen sell-out, BI depletions and profitability, audit data, etc while you also evaluate when/where new sources are available and/or necessary. You'll build reports, dashboards, insights decks on a regular basis to continually be up to date on the latest industry trends as well as uncover, understand, and communicate the most important information to support insights, share with markets, and/or work with customers. You'll also be leading your own projects while... creates a deep understanding on core business principles/initiatives by advocating and leading research.

QUALITATIVE

This role involves being cross-functional in thought and process, collaborating with other departments to gain a comprehensive understanding of the brand's vision. It requires leading conversations with markets to stay informed about the local business landscape beyond relying solely on data. Additionally, meeting with customers, comprehending their objectives, and identifying opportunities to further support local teams is crucial. In this role you'll be responsible for presenting in various settings such as internal calls, customer meetings, and formal gatherings, serving as the subject matter expert on trends, data, and insights. Active listening skills are necessary to anticipate and proactively address customer needs or market demands. Problem-solving abilities based on logical and pragmatic thinking are required during negotiations. Lastly, finding effective ways to share information with teams, whether through Sharepoint or one-on-one calls, is an essential aspect of the role.

Qualifications

University Degree

Excellent English Skills

High level of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint

Previous Sales experience preferred

Learner, self-motivated and able to work independently

A team player with great integrity

Strong analytical skills using internal and external data sources (i.e. Nielsen, Canadean, etc)

Additional Information

Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is € 2.041 gross per month. However, our attractive compensation package is based on market-oriented salaries and is therefore significantly above the stated minimum salary.

As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin

title: Support Analyst Business Applications (m/f/d)
description:
Support Analyst Business Applications (m/f/d)

BRP-Rotax gets the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure

As a Support Analyst Business Applications you will be responsible and active for all technical aspects of the software lifecycle (conception, customizing, development, testing, documentation and 3rd level support) in a modern system landscape and in an international team.
• Together with the local and global IT team, you will drive the further development of existing and new applications.
• You will be the interface to several specialists, from the IT and other departments (virtually and personally: we offer flexible home office!).
• You will think outside the box and work closely with the internal business analyst team and translate business requirements into a functional design.
• We are a... company with a wide range of production and with the full innovation lifecycle onsite: from R&D over industrialization and mechanical manufacturing as well as fully automated assembly.
• Innovation: no matter if new products (e.g. electric motors) or the processes and tools that lead to it!

Your experiences and skills
• Completed studies (FH, university) in the fields of information technology or applied computer science
• At least 3 years of professional experience in a comparable IT role and industry
• Broad business application background (portals, archiving, document management, workflow management)
• Basic knowledge of IT infrastructure and system architecture
• Experience with ITIL standards
• Good German and English language skills
• Problem-solving team player with a high level of personal responsibility, commitment and analytical thinking

We offer
You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is € 53.068,12 EUR gross/year according to the very attractive collective agreement of the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience

title: Junior Business Analyst (Remote Internship)
description:
LOCATION: Remote Work

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Are you eager to hone your business analysis skills and kick-start a thriving career in this vibrant field? Would you like to collaborate with a prestigious Management Consulting company in Germany and gain hands-on experience in evaluating business operations? TalentKompass Deutschland is excited to present the perfect opportunity for you!

We are currently offering a beginner-level internship program tailored for individuals passionate about examining business operations and identifying areas for improvement. This internship will equip you with practical experience in business analysis while enhancing your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and more.

As an intern with our client's Management Consulting team, you will work closely with accomplished Business Analysts and consultants to collect and analyze data, discern trends and insights, and formulate recommendations for clients. This remote position allows you to work from... the comfort of your own home.

What we're looking for:
• A genuine interest in understanding business operations
• Robust analytical skills and the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets
• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for collaborating with team members at all levels
• Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to work precisely in a fast-paced environment
• A commitment to learning and growing in the field of business analysis
• Familiarity with Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
• A basic understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques

Responsibilities:
• Assist in collecting and analyzing data from various sources
• Collaborate with consultants to identify trends and insights
• Develop recommendations to address business challenges
• Participate in team meetings, contributing ideas and insights
• Foster a positive team culture and collaborate to achieve team objectives
• Support the creation of project documentation

If you're prepared to embark on your business analysis career and acquire practical experience, we encourage you to apply for our internship program. Seize this exciting opportunity to learn and grow in the field of business analysis

title: Senior Business Analyst, Intelligent Automation
description:
A new adventure awaits…
At Zurich we’re on a journey to lighting the way to a brighter future… a brighter future for you – focused on your career, your wellbeing, and your community – as well as our customers and the planet.
This exciting adventure will drive positive impact. So, if you want to be part of a values led organisation, that is a leader in the insurance industry with a track record of making a real difference and continuously taking steps toward a sustainable future for our people, customers, communities, and our planet, read on Let’s create a brighter future together, let’s make a difference
Work is something you do, not only somewhere you go. The way we work continues to evolve and at Zurich we are committed to creating ways of working that ensure you are helping to create a brighter future.
As the Intelligent Automation Process Designer, you will support the embedment and expansion of the automation program across Zurich Financial Services Australia and New Zealand. You... will leverage business and technical stakeholder relationships to lead the delivery of Intelligent Automation initiatives which achieve customer, time, cost, and benefit outcomes.
In addition, you will provide support and analysis across the portfolio of automated processes to continuously optimise performance and return on investment. Important to your success – let’s grow together
• Experience in supporting continuous improvement initiatives and designing solutions to solve business problems.
• Demonstrated understanding of Intelligent Automation technologies and operational excellence principles.
• Financial services (essential) or Insurance experience (preferred).
• Strong relationship building, problem solving and time management skills.
Belong. Zurich is here to support you
There are many reasons why Zurich is the right choice for you, but here are just a few – grow, and thrive in your career (we support and encourage it); work with global, diverse, and inclusive teams; explore your passions, fuel innovation, drive equity, collaborate and make a positive difference beyond your role; access programs to stay healthy and feel healthier; Flexwork@Zurich; become an activist in your community with the support of Z Zurich Foundation; award winning training programs; state-of-the-art Green Star rated office in North Sydney; we plant a tree for every new employee – one of many local initiatives driving our contribution to ambitious global sustainability targets.
We could go on, but the main point is that Zurich is a place that you can truly belong and thrive
Zurich is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair and accessible for all candidates. If you require any special accommodations to participate in our recruitment process, we encourage you to let us know at the time of your application.
So, if you want to come on an adventure that will build a brighter future together, and feel a sense of togetherness, then please apply today to start your adventure

There are many reasons why Zurich is the right choice for you, but here are just a few – grow, and thrive in your career (we support and encourage it); work with global, diverse, and inclusive teams; explore your passions, fuel innovation, drive equity, collaborate and make a positive difference beyond your role; access programs to stay healthy and feel healthier; Flexwork@Zurich; become an activist in your community with the support of Z Zurich Foundation; award winning training programs; state-of-the-art Green Star rated office in North Sydney; we plant a tree for every new employee – one of many local initiatives driving our contribution to ambitious global sustainability targets.
We could go on, but the main point is that Zurich is a place that you can truly belong and thrive
Zurich is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair and accessible for all candidates. If you require any special accommodations to participate in our recruitment process, we encourage you to let us know at the time of your application.
So, if you want to come on an adventure that will build a brighter future together, and feel a sense of togetherness, then please apply today to start your adventure']}]

title: Business Analyst SCM (m/w/d)
description:
Aufgaben, die mich erwarten
• aktives und selbständiges Analysieren von Supply Chain Prozessen (wie z.B. Beschaffung, interne und externe Transportlogistik und Lagerlogistik)
• Identifizieren und Spezifizieren von Berechnungsanforderungen sowie Erstellen und Interpretieren von Berichten zur Prozessoptimierung
• Modellieren von Daten sowie Auswerten und Interpretieren der Ergebnisse
• selbständiges Aufbereiten von Kennzahlen und Informieren von beteiligten Stellen innerhalb der Supply Chain

Qualifikationen, die ich mitbringe
• abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung auf Maturaniveau oder Studium im Bereich Data Science, Statistik, Mathematik oder Informatik
• einschlägige Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Datenanalyse
• ausgezeichnete Excelkenntnisse (z.B. Programmieren von Makros) sowie Kenntnisse in Matlab und RStudio wünschenswert
• SAP Kenntnisse und SQL Kenntnisse von Vorteil
• analytisches Denkvermögen sowie ausgeprägte Zahlen/Datenaffinität
• Freude an partnerschaftlicher... Zusammenarbeit im Team und mit anderen Abteilungen
• sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
• engagierte Persönlichkeit mit ausgeprägten Organisations- und Teamfähigkeiten
• eigenständige, gewissenhafte und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise

Angebote, die mich überzeugen
• vielseitiges Tätigkeitsfeld
• umfangreiche Einarbeitung
• top ausgestatteter ergonomischer Arbeitsplatz in einem modernen Bürogebäude
• Möglichkeit im Home-Office zu arbeiten (bis zu 50 %)
• zahlreiche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten zur Unterstützung der persönlichen und fachlichen Entwicklung
• kostenlose Verpflegung in Form von täglich frischem Obst und Gemüse, Kaffee sowie Tee
• Möglichkeit eines mehrmonatigen Sabbaticals
• sicherer und verlässlicher Arbeitgeber

Entgelt

attraktives Brutto-Monatseinstiegsgehalt ab € 2.708,- für 38,5 Stunden/Woche, abhängig von Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung bis € 3.910,- in der Endstufe

Arbeitsort

​4642 Sattledt, Hofer Straße 1​

Arbeitsbeginn

​ab sofort​

Online bewerben

Jetzt online bewerben und Lebenslauf inklusive Foto sowie sämtliche relevante Zeugnisse beifügen

title: Business Analyst im Kreditbereich (w/m/d)
description:
Náš společný cíl:

Du hast bereits Erfahrungen im Requirement Engineering gesammelt und auch zentrale Rollen in Projekten übernommen? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig, denn wir suchen zur Erweiterung unseres Teams „Financing“ genau Dich als erfahrenen Business Analyst für unsere Anwendungen im Kreditbereich.
Vaše důležité úkoly:
• Strukturierte Erhebung der fachlichen Anforderungen mit den Stakeholdern
• * Analyse und Modellierung der abgestimmten Anforderungen
• * Dokumentation und Aufbereitung für das Development Team im Rahmen unserer Qualitätssicherung
• Váš profil
• Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Business Analyse
• * Analytische Herangehensweise
• * Erfahrung mit Atlassian Tools (Jira, Confluence)
• * Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse
• * Erfahrung im Bankenumfeld und Zertifizierungen (wie z.B. CPRE Foundation/Advanced) von Vorteil
• Naše nabídka

Wir bieten ein sehr interessantes und entwicklungsfähiges Aufgabengebiet. Das kollektivvertragliche Mindestgehalt beträgt monatlich EUR... 2.854,00 brutto (Junior) bzw. EUR 3.910,00 (Senior) für eine 38,5 Stunden Woche. Die tatsächliche Bezahlung hängt von Deiner Ausbildung und Berufserfahrung ab.

Pracovní doba:

Vollzeit
Datum nástupu:

ab sofort

title: Business Analyst (m/w/d)
description:
JOIN THE POWER OF TELEMATICS

Wir sind Rosenberger Telematics. Als familiengeführtes Unternehmen und einer der führenden Anbieter von Telematiklösungen, sind wir auf die Vernetzung und Ortung von Maschinen- & Fuhrparks spezialisiert. Egal ob Fahrzeug, Bagger, Container, Silo oder LKW, wir digitalisieren die Welt mobiler Objekte. Unsere Mutterorganisation Rosenberger Hochfrequenztechnik ist ein Hidden-Champion als Zulieferer in der Automotive- sowie Telekommunikationsindustrie.
Warum Du unserem Team beitreten solltest:

Wir arbeiten in einem zukunftsträchtigen & spannenden Markt, mit tollen Menschen an internationalen & vielseitigen Projekten. Außerdem bieten wir Dir ein offenes Arbeitsklima mit flachen Hierarchien und großem persönlichen Gestaltungsspielraum.

Aufgaben
• Du bist für die Erhebung und Definition der Anforderungen zuständig
• Übersetzung der fachlichen Anforderungen in die technischen Möglichkeiten
• Du koordinierst und steuerst die Testaktivitäten und die... Produktumsetzung
• Du kümmerst Dich um die klare Kommunikation und das Voranschreiten des Projekts
• Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den anderen Bereichen, um das Produkt zu definieren
• Du bist innovativ und bringst Lösungsvorschläge

Qualifikation
• Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Business Analyst (m/w/d) oder in ähnlichen Positionen
• Erfahrung im Bereich Software Entwicklung
• Kenntnisse im IT Anforderungsmanagement und IT Projektmanagement
• Erfahrung im externen Kundenkontakt
• Hohe Selbstständigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke und Analysefähigkeit
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Benefits
5 Gründe für Rosenberger Telematics:
• Die perfekte Größe: Wir sind groß genug, um große und spannende Projekte umsetzen zu können, aber dennoch klein genug, um Hierarchien flach zu halten. Das macht den Umgang im Kollegenkreis familiär und die Zusammenarbeit konstruktiv und effizient.
• Der Teamgeist: Eine der schönsten Seiten an der Arbeit bei Rosenberger Telematics ist unser gutes Betriebsklima. Das bedeutet Teamzusammenhalt mit ehrlicher Kollegialität und Wertschätzung. Diese Kultur des Zusammenhalts liegt uns am Herzen und wir laden Dich ein, ein Teil davon zu werden.
• Die Flexibilität: Eines vorweg: Geregelte Arbeitszeiten sind bei uns selbstverständlich. Für individuelle Flexibilität bleibt trotzdem genug Platz. Deswegen ist auch Homeoffice möglich.
• Die Verweildauer: Wir sagen es ganz offen – wir sind kein guter Arbeitsplatz für Job-Hopper. Wenn wir uns für eine neue Mitarbeiterin oder einen neuen Mitarbeiter entscheiden, dann tun wir das ganz bewusst und mit einer langfristigen Perspektive im Hinterkopf. Diese Einstellung wünschen wir uns auch von neuen KollegInnen.
• Das attraktive Gehalt: Wir bieten Dir ein sehr attraktives Gehalt über dem Mindest-Jahresbruttogehalt von 55.000,- Euro. Das tatsächliche Gehalt ergibt sich aber durch eine Einstufung in Abhängigkeit von deiner Ausbildung, Qualifikation und Erfahrung.

Ist das der perfekte Job für dich?
Dann schicke deine Bewerbungsunterlagen an:

Rosenberger Telematics GmbH
Christian Meschnig
Atterseestraße 56, 4850 Timelkam
Mail: career-telematics@rosenberger.com
Telefon: +43 (0) 664 / 25 02 436

Jetzt bewerben Zurück zu den Stellenangeboten
Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung

title: Sr. Analyst, IT Business Systems, EU
description: Group Introduction Transforming mobility. Making automotive technology that is smarter, cleaner, safer and lighter. That’s what we’re passionate about at Magna Powertrain, and we do it by creating world-class powertrain systems. We are a premier supplier for the global automotive industry with full capabilities in design, development, testing and manufacturing of complex powertrain systems. Our name stands for quality, environmental consciousness, and safety. Innovation is what drives us and we drive innovation. Dream big and create the future of mobility at Magna Powertrain. Role Summary As Sr. Analyst, IT Business Systems you will be responsible for the project management of IT system implementations, rollouts and integrations (interfaces) in a global system landscape. You support the Sr. Manager, Business Relationship Management for Europe. You will work in cross-functional teams and offer expert advice and assistance in the use of IT systems and applications to all our employees... Your responsibilities Continuous improvement of processes within Magna Powertrain's global system landscape Analyse business demands, create project definitions and financial business plans Support implementation and coordination of our global cross-functional business systems Interact with third parties ensuring procedures detailed in Service Level Agreements are defined and followed Configure and test the application, adjust necessary interfaces between different IT applications Meet business requirements and ensure stakeholders are informed on the impact of potential changes Use reporting tools to create, develop and maintain reports to monitor data quality and support the organization Support the implementation of upgrades, patches and maintenance efforts Your qualification Masters or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or the equivalent in experience Minimum of 5 years’ experience of performing, supporting business processes within IT-Tools Demonstrate understanding of working in a customer focused environment Demonstrate experience of developing and maintaining procedures appropriate for supporting IT services in a complex environment Experience in organizational projects or know-how in organizational / change management is highly welcomed Excellent communication and presentation skills (additional trainer experience is highly welcomed) • Readiness to travel regional in Europe and globally from time to time Experience in global teamwork and different cultures will be an advantage Fluent in German and English Our offer Benefits: As an international company, we offer attractive services such as various sports and health programs, numerous benefits at partner companies and the Magna Profit Sharing Program in addition to exciting tasks, flexible working hours and an extensive range of training and education opportunities (incl. onboarding sessions, individual trainings, mentoring program,…) Salary: For this function, we offer an attractive compensation package that matches your individual experience and qualifications. The gross monthly salary corresponding to the metal collective agreement for 38.5 hours is at least 3.439,42 (14 x p.a.). Overpayment is possible according to your experience and educational background. Are you interested? Become part of our team We are looking forward to your online application (jobs.magna.com). Contact for this position Julia Zettinig julia.zettinigmagna.com Mobil: 43 / 664 80444 - 3430 Magna Powertrain GmbH 14Information, Security, Risk, Compliance FPermanent/Regular

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Description

Job Title: Business Analyst

Reports to: Sr Manager, Operations and Development

Group / Division: Service & Support, ANZ

Career Band: Band 5

Job Track: Professional

Position Location: Scoresby, Victoria Â Â

Number of Direct Reports: 0

Position Summary:

Your role as Business Analyst at Thermo Fisher Scientific is strategic, enabling you to generate actionable business intellegence initiatives through data analysis and modelling to help optimize strategies and drive process improvement within the Service and Support business.Â Your role is multidimensional, covering technology, process and data strategies.

You will work closely with the service leaders, operations team and various commercial stakeholders to capture measurement of activities that enable actionable decisions.Â If you thrive in a dynamic, fast moving environment with a culture of process improvement, teamwork, and success, then this is the role for you.

How will you make an impact:Â

Reporting
•... Collect and prioritize relevant data into practical insights using a variety of data sources, distilling them into impactful reporting, demonstrating powerful data visualization tools.
• Create dashboards and key reports (PowerBI or other data visualization platform experience a plus).
• Develop, enhance, and optimize business analytics to deliver critical insights
• Prepare and present reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings, insights, and recommendations.
• Collaborate with subject matter experts to ensure data quality and integrity is maintained during collection and reporting

Analysis and Insights
• Document and standardise data entry processes for all systems to ensure data integrity for accurate reporting
• Ensure KPI and metric tracking remains in alignement with various SOPs and Work Instruction
• Carry out Service Level pricing review and anlysis with the objective of pricing recommendation
• Analyse trends and offer insights to internal sales teams to develop commercial opportunities
• Leveraging metrics to enable continuous improvement to achieve and set new performance standards

How will you get there:
• Bachelorâs degree, preferably in finance, business or data analytics or related field, preferable in a service-based industry.
• 5+ years of confirmed experience in business or data analytics or related field, preferably in a service-based industry
• Experience with data analysis and visualization tools (e.g. Excel, Tableau, Power BI).
• Strong proficiency with SQL
• Excellent communication skills and is highly inquisitive.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
• Experience of sophisticated projects; able to effectively prioritize and deal with ambiguity.
• Demonstrated ability to tackle problems and provide internal or external solutions.
• Knowledge of enterprise systems (eg ERP), business intelligence tools (eg SAP business objects), customer relationship management systems (eg SFDC) and service management systems.
• Collaborative style with ability to work within a matrixed environment and with external customers, influencing outcomes and leading change, both internally and externally.
• Work autonomously with a bias for action and perseverance.
• Work simultaneously on multiple requirements with a variety of projects and short timelines.

Frequent Contacts:

Internal
• Service Business Leaders
• Information Technology
• Service operations
• Service sales

External
• Customers
• IT Infrastructure partners

Other Job Requirements:
• Adhere to OHS policies and procedures and ensure a safe and healthy workplace environment

title: Senior IT Business Analyst for HR Solutions (f/m/div)
description:
Are you a dedicated and solution-oriented professional with a passion for providing exceptional support? As a Senior IT Business Analyst you will play a crucial role in managing our HR systems. This position offers an opportunity to work in a dynamic, international, and multi-cultural environment, collaborating with various stakeholders.

In your new role you will:
• Be the S ubject Matter Expert for Time Managemen t and the channel between HR business and development teams
• Support the delivery of the necessary technology services to HR business by analyzing and refining requirements
• Configure the cloud-based Time Management System UKG Dimensions (Kronos) and provide ongoing support
• Manage processes to upgrade and maintain UKG Dimension s (Kronos) and work closely together with the vendor
• Implement end-to-end Time Managemen t processes, incl. technical documentation and training delivery
• Create the best user experienc e by exploring ease of use approaches to solve end-users... problems

You are best equipped for this task if you have:
• A degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Business Informatics, or a related field.
• Knowledge of the latest technological trends in the HR IT environment, ideally with experience in SAP HCM and/or UKG Dimensions (Kronos).
• Experience working with agile methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban would be a plus.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• Proficiency in German and English language

We offer competitive salaries and additional benefits based on your performance, experience and qualification. The employment is in accordance with the collective salary and wage agreement for employees of the electrical and electronics industry, employment group F (https://www.feei.at/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/minimum-salaries-white-collar-workers-2023.pdf). The monthly salary is paid 14 times p.a. We offer a higher compensation depending on your expertise and skills.

More than 5.000 people work at five different sites in Austria.

Driving decarbonization and digitalization. Together.

Infineon designs, develops, manufactures, and markets a broad range of semiconductors and semiconductor-based solutions, focusing on key markets in the automotive, industrial, and consumer sectors. Its products range from standard components to special components for digital, analog, and mixed-signal applications to customer-specific solutions together with the appropriate software.

The Information Technology department has become an important business advisor for Infineon, converting business requirements into great IT solutions. It is responsible for provisioning hardware and software solutions at benchmark costs for all areas within Infineon reaching from office users to research & development, to frontend and backend production around the globe. More than 1000 IT-colleagues work closely together with other business areas and external partners. They increase the efficiency of business processes offering more than just modern equipment, secure infrastructure and newest communication solutions.

The provincial capital Klagenfurt , in the heart of Carinthia, impresses with its liveliness, culture, numerous events and sights. The southern climate with the pictorial Wörthersee, the close link between urban infrastructure and rural areas as well as the proximity to Slovenia and Italy make Klagenfurt particularly livable.
https://www.visitklagenfurt.at/en/ .

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.
This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant´s experience and skills.
We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.
Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.
More about diversity & inclusion at Infineon at https://www.infineon.com/cms/en/careers/diversity-and-inclusion

title: Requirements Engineer ERP Business Analyst
description:
Your role in the team
• Interface between our internal process experts and users (department) and the development team (partly external partners) as well as software architects
• Identification, analysis and specification of requirements, some of which are highly complex
• Conceptual activities in the field of process, software and data modeling as well as visualization and documentation
• Participation in the design of future applications and thus a valuable contribution to the standardization and automation of IT-supported processes
• Active participation in the prioritization, planning and creation of product backlogs
• Determination of costs, efforts and required implementation iterations

Technologies and skills
• SAP

Our expectations:

Qualifications
• Knowledge of the visualization and documentation of software requirements
• Quick comprehension as well as analytical and solution-oriented thinking
• Initiative and independent work
• A feeling for the essential wishes of the... stakeholders and a talent for presenting complex issues
• Perseverance and ambition with challenging IT requirements
• project management skills
• Very good knowledge of German and English

Experience
• Experience in the ERP / SAP environment is an advantage, but not mandatory

title: Business Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
We are Rosenberger Telematics. As a family-run company and one of the leading providers of telematics solutions, we specialize in the networking and tracking of machinery & fleets. Whether vehicle, excavator, container, silo or truck, we digitize the world of mobile objects. Our parent organization Rosenberger Hochfrequenztechnik is a hidden champion as a supplier in the automotive as well as telecommunications industry.

Why you should join our team:

We work in a promising & exciting market, with great people on international & diverse projects. In addition, we offer you an open working atmosphere with flat hierarchies and great personal freedom.

Tasks:

– You are responsible for the elicitation and definition of requirements

– Translating the business requirements into the technical possibilities

– You coordinate and control the test activities and the product implementation

– You take care of the clear communication and the progress of the project

– You work closely with the... other departments to define the product

– You are innovative and propose solutions

Qualification:

– Several years of professional experience as a business analyst or in similar positions

– Experience in software development

– Knowledge of IT requirements management and IT project management

– Experience in external customer contact

– High degree of independence, strong communication skills and analytical ability

– Good knowledge in English

4 reasons for Rosenberger Telematics:

– The perfect company size: we are large enough to be able to implement large and exciting projects, yet small enough to keep hierarchies flat. This makes the interaction among colleagues familiar and the cooperation constructive and efficient.

– The Team spirit: One of the best things about working at Rosenberger Telematics is our good working atmosphere. This means team cohesion with honest collegiality and appreciation. This culture of cohesion is close to our hearts and we invite you to become a part of it.

– The Flexibility: First of all, regulated working hours are a matter of course for us. Nevertheless, there is enough room for individual flexibility. That’s why home office is also possible.

– The attractive salary: We offer you a very attractive salary above the minimum annual gross salary of 55,000 euros. The actual salary, however, is determined by a classification depending on your education, qualifications and experience.

We are looking forward to your application

title: Junior Business Analyst (Remote Internship)
description:
LOCATION: Remote Work

SCHEDULE: Part-time

Are you eager to hone your business analysis skills and kick-start a thriving career in this vibrant field? Would you like to collaborate with a prestigious Management Consulting company in Germany and gain hands-on experience in evaluating business operations? TalentKompass Deutschland is excited to present the perfect opportunity for you!

We are currently offering a beginner-level internship program tailored for individuals passionate about examining business operations and identifying areas for improvement. This internship will equip you with practical experience in business analysis while enhancing your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and more.

As an intern with our client's Management Consulting team, you will work closely with accomplished Business Analysts and consultants to collect and analyze data, discern trends and insights, and formulate recommendations for clients. This remote position allows you to work from... the comfort of your own home.

What we're looking for:
• A genuine interest in understanding business operations
• Robust analytical skills and the ability to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets
• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for collaborating with team members at all levels
• Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to work precisely in a fast-paced environment
• A commitment to learning and growing in the field of business analysis
• Familiarity with Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tools
• A basic understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques

Responsibilities:
• Assist in collecting and analyzing data from various sources
• Collaborate with consultants to identify trends and insights
• Develop recommendations to address business challenges
• Participate in team meetings, contributing ideas and insights
• Foster a positive team culture and collaborate to achieve team objectives
• Support the creation of project documentation

If you're prepared to embark on your business analysis career and acquire practical experience, we encourage you to apply for our internship program. Seize this exciting opportunity to learn and grow in the field of business analysis
