title: Financial Planning Process Analyst
description:
To strengthen our international team, we are looking for a Financial Planning Process Analyst with a strong focus on Planning Process & Data Quality in our global headquarter in Fuschl am See. The role is placed within the Finance Function of the Global Data & Analytics Team.

In this challenging position, the key deliverable to the organization is to secure process excellence combined with a high degree of data quality throughout the financial planning process. As part of the Finance Data Quality Management Team, one governs, and quality assures the financial planning process from an end-to-end business perspective. Training & support of the global finance community on the process & system side, as well as ensuring relevant, high-quality go-lives of developments and enhancements complement this profile. Through close collaboration with our internal and external stakeholders & our subsidiaries worldwide, we challenge and push our state-of-the-art planning solution to the next level.

title: BI Developer/Analyst (m/f/x), HR Systems
via: via Jobs At Magna - Magna International
description:
Group Description

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.

Role Summary

The Business Intelligence (BI) Developer/Analyst will be responsible for interpreting the business needs of HR stakeholders and for developing the reporting analytics that meet those needs. This includes the design, development, maintenance, integration and reporting of business systems through cubes, ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. The Business Intelligence... Developer/Analyst will work closely and effectively with internal stakeholders and business analysts to provide support and expertise in data management, reporting and underlying infrastructure. This position may also need to cover oversight and guidance on deliverables provided by external partners as well a supervising & leading role in the team.

Key Responsibilities
• Work with the business to define reporting/BI requirements and translate those requirements into reporting/BI deliverables.
• Design complex business intelligence and analytic solutions based on functional requirements.
• Translate data results into written reports, tables, graphs, and charts.
• Ensure the availability and performance of the solutions and reports.
• Participate in and lead functional and technical specification reviews.
• Research technical solutions to solve business problems.
• Develop/train on company standards and procedures to support self-service BI.
• Provide training and technical assistance to other team members and users for generation of various types of reporting.
• Provide ongoing support for legacy and future BI solutions.

Work Experience
• 3 to 5 Years of Work Related Experience.

Knowledge and Education
• Completion of University Degree in the field of computer science or Information Technology.

Key Qualifications/Requirements
• Experience in developing reporting or dashboard solutions with BI tools (PowerBI preferred).
• Experience in creating data models (SSAS Tabular Model preferred).
• Proficiency in ETL and Data Warehouse concepts.
• Strong SQL and scripting skills.
• Advanced skills in Microsoft BI stack (SSAS, Power Pivot, Power View, PowerBI).
• Self-motivated and self-managed with a high degree of analytical skills (quick comprehension, abstract thinking, recognize relationships).
• Ability to be a strong team member and communicate effectively.
• Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and reasonably estimate work effort for tasks.
• Demonstrated critical thinking and analytic skills with strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
• Ability to manage confidential and sensitive employee information.
• Ability to accurately collect information to understand and assess the clients’ needs and situation.
• Understanding of HR operations and processes, and experience in employee data management a nice to have.
• Excellent English language skills (written and oral).

Additional Information

Salary starting from 45 000 EUR/ gross/year. We offer attractive benefits (expl. profit participation, yearly bonus, development opportunities).

For dedicated and motivated employees, we offer an interesting and diversified job within a dynamic global team together with the individual and functional development in a professional environment of a global acting business. Fair treatment and a sense of responsibility towards employees are the principle of the Magna culture. We strive to offer an inspiring and motivating work environment.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
Our client is an excellently positioned company in the paper and packaging industry with several production sites throughout Europe. The basis for their international success lies in the personal commitment of each and every employee. They offer an interesting environment that promotes self-responsible action, characterized by open communication and teamwork!

As they continue to grow, they are now actively looking for a talented and passionate
IT Business Analyst to join their team.

Your responsibilities:
• Monitor the smooth implementation of SAP processes
• Develope new business lines to improve existing models in the production and logistics environment
• Participate in the SAP rollout of production facilities in other locations
• Define the market and adapt processes to market needs

Your profile:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business Informatics, Business Administration, Industrial Engineering or an equivalent valuable training
• Background as a Business Analyst or other comparable... role
• Preferably experience with BI tools
• Independence, creativity and ability of problem-solving
• Analytical and organizational skills with innovation and great communication abilities
• High English and German language proficiency

Your benefits:
• Generous compensation package and favorable working conditions
• Flexible working hours and home-office options
• International team with diverse backgrounds, where respect, support and openness are key
• Stimulating projects and opportunities for personal growth
• Relocation package with VISA support and company apartments if necessary
• Being part of a growing company with a focus on sustainability
• Annual gross salary starting from 70.000€ with possibility of an increased salary depending on professional background. Individual experience and knowledge will be clearly honoured in the reel compensation package If you are interested in this challenging position we are looking forward to receiving your comprehensive application for
ref.no. 95,492 preferably through our ISG career portal or via email.

Visit isg.com/jobs/search - here you can find new job offers every day.

ISG International Service Group

ES-28040 Madrid, Calle Viella 21

Rebeca Trejo, T: +34 911 743 400

@:application.trejo@isg.com

• Generous compensation package and favorable working conditions
• Flexible working hours and home-office options
• International team with diverse backgrounds, where respect, support and openness are key
• Stimulating projects and opportunities for personal growth
• Relocation package with VISA support and company apartments if necessary
• Being part of a growing company with a focus on sustainability
• Annual gross salary starting from 70.000€ with possibility of an increased salary depending on professional background. Individual experience and knowledge will be clearly honoured in the reel compensation package If you are interested in this challenging position we are looking forward to receiving your comprehensive application for
ref.no. 95,492 preferably through our ISG career portal or via email.

Visit isg.com/jobs/search - here you can find new job offers every day.

ISG International Service Group

ES-28040 Madrid, Calle Viella 21

Rebeca Trejo, T: +34 911 743 400

@:application.trejo@isg.com']}]

title: Maritime Sustainment Model Business Analyst
description:
Title:
Maritime Sustainment Model Business Analyst

Your KBR future - delivering solutions and changing the world

About KBR:

Kellogg Brown & Root (KBR) is a leading Defence and Government professional services provider. In Australia, KBR has been delivering solutions to Defence and Defence industry for over 20 years. We provide in-depth expertise to a wide range of Defence sector projects through our core competencies of program and project management, engineering, asset management, integrated logistics support, procurement and training solutions.

Learn more about our business here.

The opportunity:

Mission and Scope

Department of Defence is undergoing an ambitious but achievable reform program for sustainment of the RANâs surface fleet. Key to the new approach is the Maritime Sustainment Model (MSM) and its use of standardised contracts, plans, processes, guides, procedures, and ICT tools by its workforce and across the Maritime Enterprise. Development of this sovereign... sustainment capability is key to ensuring Defence has the workforce, systems, tools, supply chains and infrastructure to support the future fleet and operations.

As part of the MSM Team, the MSM Business Analyst is accountable to the MSM Lead to develop a suite of processes which enable optimisation of the MSM across the Maritime Sustainment Division Enterprise.

Responsibilities

The key responsibilities of the role will include, but is not limited to:
• Apply process excellence tools and techniques to understand, analyse, document and recommend future process and solutions in line with NLIS business needs.
• Facilitate stakeholder engagements via Workshops, Interviews, Focus Groups, and using previously documented materials to establish accurate process workflows.
• Scope process and analysis appropriately and identify core stakeholders and associated benefits and risks related to Navy and Defence Systems.
• Recommend effective process strategies to the business problem and or new opportunities within the Maritime Domain.
• Actively engage with stakeholders to ensure recommended solutions are in line with core business needs.
• Ensure process strategies are aligned with the long-term business requirements of the systems program offices and Navy Logistics Systems.
• Enhance business processes to drive Process Maturity through Process Re-Engineering and Continuous Improvement.
• Document and ensure that processes in Training Services are consistently documented using a practical set of Business Process Model & Notation (BPMN) standards and process modelling tools.
• Document processes following the team's Process Governance and Architecture practices defining business rules and templates.
• High Level and Low-Level Design of Process development using Lean Methodology and ensure that documentation of the future state process design adheres to the required governance and architecture practices.
• Process Development and Delivery of all known application standards used by Navy Logistics Systems.

As the ideal candidate, you will bring:

Qualifications, Skills and Experience:

Essential:
• Experience in business analysis and operational process design using Holocentric or similar BPMN tools.
• Ability to assess existing workflows and identify options for improvement.
• Experience understanding and documenting the impacts of change and adapting to processes, business practices and operational requirements.
• Experienced in the use of MS Office products, business process tools and complex applications.
• Experience in creation of flow and logic diagrams.

Desirable:
• Experience working in a Defence network/systems environment

What we will offer you:
• A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work
• Flexible working conditions
• Competitive salary (including annual reviews)
• Paid parental leave
• Income protection
• Corporate rewards
• Salary packaging/Novated leasing
• Employee stock purchase plans
• Flu shots, skin checks and private health insurance
• Career development: Online learning, mentorship and career pathways

If youâre ready to shape tomorrow, letâs get started. Apply Now

KBR acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of Country throughout Australia and their continuing connections to land, sea, community and culture. We pay our respects to Elders past and present.

KBR is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive and diverse work environment. We encourage candidates of all abilities to apply.

As a Major Service Provider of the Australian Defence Force, an AGSVA security clearance will be required and compliance to International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). As such, our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences.

description: Description What if energy supply could be sustainable, affordable, and reliable at the same time? With its powerful Jenbacher and Waukesha gas engines, INNIO brings energy solutions for today—and tomorrow, in more than 100 countries, improving the quality of life for countless people. Do you want to make a difference with your work? For our Finance & Treasury Department we're searching for a Group Business Treasury Analyst (m/f/d). Join our team now At INNIO we offer you: An innovative and international working environment Flexible working time model (depending on position and role) Health We Care Program – including company sport activities Moving cost support for new employees in accordance with policy Good connections to public transport – station in direct proximity Transportation cost support in accordance with policy One of the best canteens in the area with healthy and various meals Attractive location in the heart of the alps which provides various outdoor sport and other... leisure possibilities Your Responsibilities: Central contact for banks and investors Management of external and internal financing Group-wide Cash and liquidity management: Own and further development of a daily financial status Own and further development of a rolling 13-week cash flow forecast Execution of the daily disposition Observing interest rates / optimizing borrowing and investment Support with Administrative title: Requirements Engineer ERP / Interfaces Business Analyst (m/w/d)
description:
Mit der Schalungskompetenz von Doka entstehen rund um den Globus beeindruckende Bauwerke. Das ist die gemeinsame Leistung unserer mehr als 6.800 Mitarbeiter innen in über 60 Ländern dieser Erde - und darauf sind wir stolz.

STELLENBESCHREIBUNG
• Schnittstelle zwischen unseren internen Prozessexperten und Anwendern (Fachbereich) und dem Entwicklungsteam (teilweise externe Partner) sowie Software Architekten
• Identifikation, Analyse und Spezifikation von Anforderungen mit teilweise hoher Komplexität
• Konzeptionelle Tätigkeiten im Bereich Prozess-, Software-, und Datenmodellierung sowie Visualisierung und Dokumentation
• Mitgestaltung der zukünftigen Applikationen und somit wertvoller Beitrag zur Standardisierung und Automatisierung von IT-gestützten Prozessen
• Aktive Mitwirkung an der Priorisierung, Planung und Erstellung von Product Backlogs
• Ermittlung von Kosten, Aufwänden und erforderlichen Implementierungsiterationen

QUALIFIKATIONEN

Jetzt bewerben klicken und weiterlesen!

title: Mitarbeiter Unternehmensanalyse / Business Analyst (m/w/d)
description:
Náš společný cíl:

Sie suchen abwechslungsreiche, sinnstiftende und interessante Aufgaben in einem engagierten Team? Dann bewerben Sie sich jetzt - wir bieten Ihnen die Chance, Ihre Karriere bei uns zu gestalten!
Vaše důležité úkoly:
• Analyse von Unternehmen im Zusammenhang mit komplexeren Projekt- und Wachstumsfinanzierungen und Plausibilisierung der zugrunde liegenden Geschäftsmodelle sowie Businesspläne
• * Erstellung von Bilanzanalysen nach UGB und IFRS sowie Peergroup-Vergleiche
• * Sie führen vertiefende Managementgespräche mit den Unternehmern/Managern und Betriebsbesichtigungen durch
• * Das Ergebnis aus diesen Analysen ist eine wichtige Grundlage für die Entscheidungsträger der Oberbank bei ihren Kreditentscheidungen
• Váš profil
• Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes wirtschaftswissenschaftliches Studium
• * Sie konnten idealerweise bereits erste einschlägige Berufserfahrung in einer Bank im Bereich Bonitätsbeurteilung oder in der Steuerberatung/Wirtschaftsprüfung... sammeln
• * Sie haben Kenntnisse in einem der folgenden Fachbereichen: Controlling, IFRS, Unternehmensbewertung oder Steuern
• * Eine rasche Auffassungsgabe, lösungsorientiertes und selbstständiges Arbeiten sowie Teamfähigkeit und Kommunikationsstärke zeichnen Sie aus
• Naše nabídka

Das kollektivvertragliche Bruttogehalt beträgt für diese Tätigkeit und für das beschriebene Profil mindestens EUR 3.336,90 (abgeschlossenes Magister-/Masterstudium). Eine Überzahlung ist insbesondere bei einschlägiger Berufserfahrung und besonderer Qualifikation möglich. Es warten außerdem tolle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einem erstklassigen Arbeitsumfeld auf Sie! Attraktive Sozialleistungen wie flexible Arbeitszeit, Möglichkeit auf Homeoffice, Mitarbeiterbeteiligung, Fahrtkostenzuschuss für öffentliche Verkehrsmittel, Gesundheitsförderung sowie unser Top-Mitarbeiterrestaurant runden unser Angebot ab.
Pracovní doba:

Vollzeit
Datum nástupu:

ab sofort

title: Business Process Analyst
description:
Company Description

We are looking for a Business Process Analysis and Improvement specialist to strengthen our Process Excellence team at the global Red Bull headquarters in Salzburg, Austria.

In this position, you'll support the business as process analysis expert to drive process optimization utilizing process data analyses based on state-of-the-art process mining technologies. You'll collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand the business requirements, combine data from different source systems, define data requirements, analyze information and identify and drive process improvements. You'll act as a coach for the business regarding improvement of the business processes.

Job Description

BUSINESS PROCESSES & NEEDS

You'll review business requests, define data requirements, system connections, and performance indicators to deliver process mining dashboards and solutions to the business.

PROCESS ANALYSIS

You'll work with the business to measure and... analyse business processes to understand strengths and improvements and their associated root causes.

VALUE REALIZATION

You'll deliver process mining solutions to the business and monitor the value and resolution of process optimizations and the wider process mining program.

ROLLOUT & TRAINING

You'll analyse use cases for global applicability and train end users to use process mining to find improvements and drive value realization. Finally, you'll develop and maintain process mining methodologies, standards and templates to ensure a streamlined engagement with the business.

Qualifications

4-6 years relevant work experience in process management, process improvement and data analysis

Proven experience driving process improvement, preferably through methodologies such as Six Sigma, Lean, Kaizen

Strong analytical and numerical skills, including the ability to think differently about the data, which may lead to less obvious conclusions

High affinity to IT systems especially strong familiarity with business process software and process mining tools (Celonis)

End user knowledge for ERP systems like SAP, Business Objects, BI is an advantage

Strong communication skills, particularly the ability to convey complex topics in simple memorable terms

Willingness to learn, to accept challenges and work in a team environment

Result and performance oriented

Additional Information

#E

University Degree; Or Equivalent Professional Experience

#L

Fluent in English

#K

Analyst, Celonis, Process Improvement, Process Mining, process management, Prozessmanagement, Prozesse, Six Sigma, Data Analysis

#D

Aus gesetzlichen Gründen sind wir verpflichtet darauf hinzuweisen, dass das kollektivvertragliche Mindestgehalt für diese Position bei monatlich EUR 2.181 brutto liegt. Unsere attraktiven Gehaltspakete orientieren sich jedoch an aktuellen Marktgehältern und liegen daher deutlich über dem angegebenen Mindestgehalt.

As an employer, we value diversity and support people in developing their potential and strengths, realizing their ideas and seizing opportunities. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or origin

title: SAP Solution Analyst (m/f/d) Production
description:
SAP Solution Analyst (m/f/d) Production

We get the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure

As SAP Solution Analyst Production you will be responsible and active for all technical aspects of the software lifecycle (conception, customizing, development, testing, documentation and 3rd level support) in a modern system landscape (SAP Quality Award in Gold) and in an international team.
• Together with the local and global IT team, you will drive the further development of existing applications and the preparation for S/4 HANA throughout the company.
• Home office! Both virtually and personally, you will be in close exchange with the specialist department (flexible home office incl. home office flat rate).
• You will think outside the box and work closely with the internal business analyst team and the... solution architect to translate business requirements into a functional design.
• You can expect a company with a wide range of production: industrialization of new products (e.g. electric motors), mechanical manufacturing as well as fully automated assembly.

Your experiences and skills
• Completed studies (FH, university) in the fields of information technology or applied computer science
• At least 3 years of professional experience in a comparable IS&T role and industry
• Very good SAP knowledge (PP, MM, QM, WM) as well as basic knowledge of IS&T infrastructure and system architecture
• English language skills, German knowledge is an advantage
• Problem-solving team player with a high level of personal responsibility, commitment and analytical thinking

We offer
You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is € 53.068,12 EUR gross/year according to the very attractive collective agreement of the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience

title: Analyst, IT Business Systems (m/w/x)
via: via Jobs At Magna - Magna International
description:
Jobnummer: 58406

Gruppe: Magna Powertrain

Division: EC Sankt Valentin

Art der Beschäftigung: Festanstellung, Leasing mit Übernahmeoption

Standort: ST. VALENTIN

Gruppenbeschreibung

Fortschritt in der Mobilität ist für uns nicht nur ein Schlagwort. Wir bei Magna Powertrain arbeiten täglich an Technologien, Systemen und Konzepten, die Fahrzeuge sicherer, sauberer, komfortabler machen und gleichzeitig für Fahrvergnügen stehen. Als ein führender Anbieter in der globalen Automobilindustrie bieten wir Lösungen für konventionelle, hybride und rein elektrische Fahrzeuge. Unser Name steht für Qualität, Umweltbewusstsein und Sicherheit. Unser Herz schlägt für eine neue Welt der Mobilität. Passt das zu dir? Dann komm zu Magna Powertrain, um mit uns die Grenzen deiner Vorstellungskraft zu erweitern und gemeinsam die Zukunft der Mobilität zu gestalten.

Das erwartet dich

Du administrierst IT-technisch das Magna Powertrain PlanviewOne IT System, das global von allen MAGNA Standorten verwendet... wird. Als Analyst, IT Business Systems (m/w/x) hast du die Verantwortung über die Systemstabilität, Performance und Daten-Integrität. Du bist Teil eines internationalen Teams und übernimmst innerhalb des Teams Verantwortung für nachfolgende Aufgaben:
• Konfiguration, Customizing und Testen von User Stories im PlanviewOne
• Du agierst als technische_r Ansprechpartner_in gegenüber dem Softwarehersteller und anderen Partner-Unternehmen
• Administration der PlanviewOne-Systemarchitektur und die damit verbundene kontinuierliche Verbesserung von Benutzerfreundlichkeit, Funktionalität und Performance
• Sicherstellung der IT-Servicequalität, Security- u. Compliance-Anforderungen und Umsetzung/Anpassung des Berechtigungskonzeptes
• Unterstützung des Projektteams mit technischem Know-how im IT-Umfeld und Schnittstelle zu internen Fachbereichen

Das bringst du mit
• HTL oder Bachelor-Abschluss in Informatik
• Idealerweise 2-3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im IT-Applikations-Umfeld
• Erfahrung im Umgang mit agiler Entwicklung, Datenmanagement via SQL sowie PowerBI Reports wünschenswert
• Zuverlässige und selbstständige Arbeitsweise
• Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten in Englisch

Das bieten wir

Bei uns wird die DU-Kultur sowie flache Hierarchien gelebt. Nach Beginn eines umfangreichen und strukturierten Onboarding-Systems, wo dir ein Pate zur Seite steht, bist du direkt an der Entwicklung, dem Design und der Fertigung der weltweit fortschrittlichsten (Elektro-)Mobilitätstechnologien beteiligt. Es erwarten dich spannende Aufgaben und neue Herausforderungen in einem dynamischen und motivierten Team. Darüber hinaus bieten wir dir umfangreiche

Sozialleistungen und Benefits
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Mobile Work für eine ausgewogene Work-Life Balance
• Umfangreiche Lern- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten (Externe sowie In-House Trainings, Coachings und Workshops, Besuche von Tagungen und Konferenzen, Job Shadowing mit Einblicken in andere Fachbereiche)
• Essenszuschuss für Kantine und Jausenstation
• Mitarbeitervergünstigungen über den Betriebsrat (Corporate Benefits für Auto, Technik, Reisen, Mode, Freizeit, Sport, Medien, Tickets, Wohnen)
• Mitarbeiter- und Teamevents
• Zahlreiche Angebote für Gesundheitsförderung

Entgelt

Neben all den bereits genannten Benefits ist es uns wichtig, ein faires und attraktives Vergütungspaket anzubieten. Mit einem abgeschlossenen Masterstudium gilt für diese Position ein Mindestgrundgehalt von EUR 54.600,-- (bei Masterabschluss) brutto pro Jahr (Basis: 38,5h, kein All-In). Eine Überzahlung ist jedoch aufgrund von entsprechenden Erfahrungen und Qualifikationen gelebte Praxis.

Ansprechperson für diese Position

Theresa Rittenschober, Tel.: +43 664 / 783 397 57, LinkedIn / Xing

Engineering Center Steyr GmbH & Co KG

Steyrer Straße 32

4300 St. Valentin

Du möchtest mehr über die Karrieremöglichkeiten bei Magna Powertrain | Engineering Center Steyr am Standort in St. Valentin erfahren?

Besuche uns auf unserer Karriereseite!

Bewusstsein. Einheit. Stärkung.

Wir bei Magna sind davon überzeugt, dass eine vielfältige Belegschaft für unseren Erfolg entscheidend ist. Deshalb sind wir stolz darauf, ein Arbeitgeber der Chancengleichheit zu sein. Wir stellen auf der Grundlage von Erfahrung und Qualifikation sowie unter Berücksichtigung der jeweiligen beruflichen Anforderungen ein, unabhängig von insbesondere Hautfarbe, Abstammung, Religion, Geschlecht, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Staatsbürgerschaft, Familienstand, Behinderung oder Geschlechtsidentität. Magna nimmt den Schutz deiner persönlichen Daten ernst. Wir raten dir davon ab, Bewerbungen per E-Mail zu senden, um die GDPR-Anforderungen und die des lokalen Datenschutzgesetzes zu erfüllen

title: SAP Business Analyst / I2D (Remote, Zurich Based, Permanent Contract)
description:
Position: SAP Business Analyst / I2D Invest to Divest - Focus Investments management

Location: Remote with travel to Zurich, Switzerland

Contract: Permanent contract

Salary: 80€ - 95€ per hour

This is a remote position and we welcome applications from within the EU.

Who you will be working for:

Our client is a major international IT consulting company within the Fortune 50. You’ll work with visionaries across multiple industries for the world's most innovative and valuable companies.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As an SAP Business Analyst I2D, Invest to Divest (investment management and fixed asset accounting) in a large S/4HANA transformation program, you will serve as a client-facing practitioner who leads and implements expert services utilizing the breadth of our offerings and technologies. A successful Consultant is regarded by clients as a trusted business advisor who collaborates to provide innovative solutions used to solve the most challenging business problems.

As... a Business Analyst on our SAP S/4 HANA program:
• You will identify process improvements and outline design proposals in terms of best practice/best-fit solutions in the S/4HANA but also in the context of interfaces to/with surrounding systems.
• You structure and moderate discussions about business requirements with business departments and with external stakeholders in the relevant business area.
• You work closely with agile teams that are responsible for implementation (i.e. SAP consultants and developers as well as business functional product owners) to understand functionalities, issues and optimization opportunities well
• You evaluate options in terms of feasibility, potential and effort

Your tasks will include:
• The structured management and moderation of workshops with representatives - including the preparation and follow-up of the
results
• Gathering requirements and insights for complex business processes to support the solution design process guiding and supporting other stakeholders in analysis, design and further development of solution proposals
• Create structured and complete documentation (concept documents, business blueprints, technical specification of WRICEF documents)

You bring the following skills with you:
• Profound SAP design and implementation experience in I2D Invest to Divest
• No programming knowledge required
• Focus Investments management
• Solid and practical, perennial technical and process knowledge
• A structured and pragmatic approach
• Ability to make complex issues simple and understandable in one structured form and explain them in an understandable way

This is a remote position and we welcome applications from within the EU.

Sounds interesting? Please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile outlining a track record of your achievements. In case of any questions, please contact E-Mail auf click.appcast.io ansehen

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

By replying to this job offer, you agree with processing your personal information and confirm that you have had the opportunity to learn about our handling of your personal data.

Guaranteed reply to all applicants

title: IT Business Analyst (m/w/d) Produktion
description:
IT Business Analyst (m/w/d) Produktion

Wir bringen die aufregendsten Powersportsfahrzeuge der Welt in Bewegung. Als Teil von BRP, mit rund 20.000 Mitarbeiter:innen weltweit, sind technologischer Fortschritt und nachhaltige Mobilität unser Antrieb. Und wofür schlägt Ihr Herz?

Ihr neues Abenteuer
• Hauptansprechpartner für alle IS&T relevanten Themen in der Produktion (Fertigung & Montage)
• Verantwortlich für die Definiton der jährlichen Roadmap bis zur Umsetzung des IS&T-Portfolios
• Budgetverantwortung sowie Erstellung von Budget- und Projektanträgen
• Enge Zusammenarbeit mit der Fachabteilung und dem Solution Analyst
• Ansprechpartner bei Supportanfragen in der Applikation (ERP & MES)
• Administrative projektbezogene Aufgaben (Koordination von Meetings, Terminplanung)

Ihre Erfahrungen und Fähigkeiten
• Abgeschlossenes adäquates IT-Studium (Universität, FH) mit mind. 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung
• Technische Kenntnisse in ERP und MES Systemen
• Betriebswirtschaftliche Kenntnisse und... Prozesswissen im Industrieumfeld
• Verständnis und Erfahrung für Produktionsprozesse
• Sehr gute Deutsch- sowie gute Englischkenntnisse
• Kommunikationsstärke sowie analytisches Denken und Handeln

Was wir bieten

Sie erhalten eine spannende Position in einem internationalen Unternehmen mit vielen interessanten Benefits. Das Mindestgehalt für diese Position liegt gemäß dem sehr attraktiven Kollektivvertrag der Metallindustrie bei EUR 53.068,12 brutto/Jahr. Eine Überzahlung ist möglich, abhängig von Ihrer Qualifikation und Erfahrung

title: Analyst, IT Business Systems (m/f/x)
description:
Job Number : 58449

Group : Magna Powertrain

Division : Sankt Valentin

Job Type : Permanent / Regular

Location : ST. VALENTIN, BELGRADE, LANNACH

Group Introduction

Advancing mobility. Making automotive technology that is smarter, cleaner, and safer, while still fun to drive. And making it for everyone.

That’s what we’re passionate about at Magna Powertrain. We do it by creating world-class powertrain solutions for conventional, hybrid, and pure electric vehicles.

We’re making electrification more than a buzzword, we’re bringing it to the road. Innovation is what drives us and we drive innovation.

Dream big and create the future of mobility at Magna Powertrain.

What can you expect

You will administer the Magna Powertrain PlanviewOne IT system, which is used globally by all MAGNA locations. As a specialist for IT applications you are responsible for system stability, performance and data integrity.

You are part of an international team and assume responsibility for the... following tasks within the team :
• Configuration, customizing and testing of user stories in PlanviewOne.
• You act as a technical contact for the software manufacturer and other partner companies.
• Administration of the PlanviewOne system architecture and the associated continuous improvement of usability, functionality and performance.
• Ensuring IT service quality, security and compliance requirements and implementation / adaptation of the authorization concept.
• Support of the project team with technical know-how in the IT environment and interface to internal departments.

Key Responsibilities
• Technical college or bachelor's degree in IT or computer science
• Ideally 2-3 years of professional experience with IT applications
• Experience in dealing with agile development, data management via SQL and PowerBi reports
• Reliable and independent way of working
• Communication and presentation skills in English, German beneficial

What we offer

We have flat hierarchies and after a structured onboarding there will be exciting tasks and new challenges waiting for you in a dynamic and motivated surrounding.

The position can be fullfilled in Lannach, Traiskirchen or St. Valentin (Austria), Untergruppenbach (Germany) or in Serbia.

Benefits

As an international company, we offer attractive services such as various sports and health programs, numerous benefits at partner companies and the Magna Profit Sharing Program in addition to exciting tasks, flexible working hours and an extensive range of training and education opportunities.

Compensation

Commitment and qualification pay off at MAGNA Powertrain : For this position we offer an annual gross starting salary from €42,000 on a full-time basis.

However, the actual salary will be determined together with you on the basis of previous service, qualifications, relevant professional experience and the collective agreement of the vehicle industry

title: Support Analyst Business Applications (m/w/d)
description:
Support Analyst Business Applications (m/w/d)

BRP-Rotax bringt die aufregendsten Powersportsfahrzeuge der Welt in Bewegung. Als Teil von BRP, mit rund 20.000 Mitarbeiter:innen weltweit, sind technologischer Fortschritt und nachhaltige Mobilität unser Antrieb. Und wofür schlägt Ihr Herz?

Ihr neues Abenteuer

Als Support Analyst Business Applications sind Sie für alle technischen Aspekte des Software-Lebenszyklus (Konzeption, Customizing, Entwicklung, Test, Dokumentation und 3rd Level Support) in einer modernen Systemlandschaft sowie in einem internationalen Team zuständig und tätig.
• Gemeinsam mit dem lokalen und globalen IT-Team treiben Sie die Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Applikationen und die Vorbereitung auf SAP S/4 HANA im gesamten Unternehmen voran
• Sie sind die Schnittstelle zu mehreren Spezialisten, aus der IT- und anderen Abteilungen (virtuell und persönlich: wir bieten flexibles Home Office!)
• Sie blicken über den Tellerrand hinaus und arbeiten eng mit dem internen... Business Analyst Team und dem Solution Architekt zusammen, um Geschäftsanforderungen in ein funktionales Design umzusetzen
• Wir sind ein Unternehmen mit einem breiten Produktionsspektrum und haben den gesamten Innovationszyklus vor Ort: von der Forschung und Entwicklung über die Industrialisierung und mechanische Fertigung bis hin zur vollautomatischen Montage
• Innovation: egal ob neue Produkte (z. B. Elektromotoren) oder die Prozesse und Werkzeuge, die dahin führen!

Ihre Erfahrungen und Fähigkeiten
• Abgeschlossenes Studium (FH, Universität) in den Bereichen Informationstechnologie oder Angewandte Informatik
• Mindestens 3-jährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren IT-Rolle, idealerweise in der Industrie
• Breites Business Acument bzgl. Portale, Archivierung, Dokumenten- und Workflow- Management
• Basiswissen über IT-Infrastruktur und Systemarchitektur
• Erfahrung mit ITIL Standards
• Gute Deutsch- und auch Englischkenntnisse
• Problemlösungsorientierte Teamplayer mit hoher Eigenverantwortung, Einsatzbereitschaft und analytischem Denken

Was wir bieten

Sie erhalten eine spannende Position in einem internationalen Unternehmen mit vielen interessanten Benefits. Das Mindestgehalt für diese Position liegt gemäß dem sehr attraktiven Kollektivvertrag der Metallindustrie bei € 53.068,12 EUR brutto/Jahr. Eine Überzahlung ist möglich, abhängig von Ihrer Qualifikation und Erfahrung

• Gemeinsam mit dem lokalen und globalen IT-Team treiben Sie die Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Applikationen und die Vorbereitung auf SAP S/4 HANA im gesamten Unternehmen voran
• Sie sind die Schnittstelle zu mehreren Spezialisten, aus der IT- und anderen Abteilungen (virtuell und persönlich: wir bieten flexibles Home Office!)
• Sie blicken über den Tellerrand hinaus und arbeiten eng mit dem internen... Business Analyst Team und dem Solution Architekt zusammen, um Geschäftsanforderungen in ein funktionales Design umzusetzen
• Wir sind ein Unternehmen mit einem breiten Produktionsspektrum und haben den gesamten Innovationszyklus vor Ort: von der Forschung und Entwicklung über die Industrialisierung und mechanische Fertigung bis hin zur vollautomatischen Montage
• Innovation: egal ob neue Produkte (z. B. Elektromotoren) oder die Prozesse und Werkzeuge, die dahin führen!

Ihre Erfahrungen und Fähigkeiten
• Abgeschlossenes Studium (FH, Universität) in den Bereichen Informationstechnologie oder Angewandte Informatik
• Mindestens 3-jährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren IT-Rolle, idealerweise in der Industrie
• Breites Business Acument bzgl. Portale, Archivierung, Dokumenten- und Workflow- Management
• Basiswissen über IT-Infrastruktur und Systemarchitektur
• Erfahrung mit ITIL Standards
• Gute Deutsch- und auch Englischkenntnisse
• Problemlösungsorientierte Teamplayer mit hoher Eigenverantwortung, Einsatzbereitschaft und analytischem Denken

Was wir bieten

Sie erhalten eine spannende Position in einem internationalen Unternehmen mit vielen interessanten Benefits. Das Mindestgehalt für diese Position liegt gemäß dem sehr attraktiven Kollektivvertrag der Metallindustrie bei € 53.068,12 EUR brutto/Jahr. Eine Überzahlung ist möglich, abhängig von Ihrer Qualifikation und Erfahrung']}]

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
IT Business Analyst (m/f/d) Production

We get the world's most exciting powersports vehicles moving. As part of BRP, with around 20,000 employees worldwide, we are driven by technological progress and sustainable mobility. And what does your heart beat for?

Your new adventure
• Main contact for all IS&T relevant topics in production (manufacturing & assembly)
• Responsible for the definition of the annual roadmap as well as the implementation of the IS&T portfolio
• Budget responsibility as well as preparation of budget and project proposals
• Close cooperation with the business department and the solution analyst
• Contact person for support requests in the application (ERP & MES)
• Administrative project-related tasks (coordination and scheduling of meetings)

Your experiences and skills
• Completed adequate IT studies (university, FH) with at least 3 years of professional experience
• Technical knowledge in ERP and MES systems
• Business knowledge and process knowledge in an... industrial environment
• Understanding and experience of production processes
• Very good knowledge of German and English
• Strong communication skills and analytical thinking and acting

We offer

You will receive an exciting position in an international company with many interesting benefits. The minimum salary for this position is EUR 53.068,12 gross/year in accordance with the very attractive collective agreement for the metal industry. An overpayment is possible, depending on your qualifications and experience
